title: Touristy thing to do
review: If you want to see a haveli go there but its ike a palace or a fort where things are up for display bit not quiet how they would otherwise be placed ..designs on the walls and intricate carvings are spellbinding. Can take great pics if a you have a knack of it

title: Stay outside
review: Don’t visit inside. As many places in India, you’ll pay an expensive ticket to discover few things in bad shape. Instead, stay outside and enjoy the architecture!

title: Nice old Haveli
review: Nice old Havelis of Tradesman having old things that were used that time , an ok place to go looks really nice from outside .

title: Got the first movers advantage for me, otherwise average
review: Tourist spots are forcibly made out of places where there is a scarcity of tourist spots. Patwon ki haveli is one such place. It is a small haveli which feels exciting if this is the first place you visit in the city. But if you have been to the fort first, it will lose its flavour. 30 - 40 min spot.

title: intricately carved and well preserved building housing a family museum
review: most beautiful haweli of 200 years old vintage, maimtained in excellent shape and housing beautiful collection of furniture, clothings, household articles , from a private collection of generations who lived there.

title: Must visit!!
review: One should not miss Patwon ki haveli while he is in Jaisalmer.

title: Old chains of havelis
review: 2 km from jaisalmer fort a chain of chain of havelis founded. Architecture is vary good you can feel glory of Rajasthan.

title: Havelis
review: It is nicely constructed. One of few Havelis which are on the tourist map once you open the pages for Jaisalmer must visit places. The architecture is good. Go with some time in hand if you want to actually study the construction.

title: Intricate facade , worth a visit
review: You have to pay around ₹100 pp and it entitles you to a guide (if you are in a group). It's a heritage building which was built by traders about a hundred + years ago. You will find antique items inside and a shop that's run by the original descendants. However, the real beauty is on the outside !

title: I’ve never seen this kind of carving!!
review: I was lost in Hawelis after seeing their carving. I went literally speechless after seeing the workmanship of the Labours or persons who made this masterpiece of art after spending this much time and money in era when there were no Automations or anything. It was totally done with Hardwork and made my hands. Must visit place in Jaisalmer!!

title: Good visit
review: The haveli is located in the Center of the city and is a pretty good attraction for a tourist with various historical items kept there.

title: Good
review: Amazing mansion. Made of yellow sand stone. No use of mortar. Ornamentally carved front elevation. Tells the story of glorious past of Rajasthan. Worth visiting.

title: Good stone carving
review: These Havelis has a very fine work of stone carving and looks amazing. This is nearby the fort area.

title: Must Visit Place
review: This haveli is having great interior and exterior and amazing fort view from roof top.

title: Patwon Ki Haveli Jaisalmer
review: Patwon Ki Haveli. The Patwon Ji ki Haveli is an interesting piece of Architecture and is the most important among the havelis in Jaisalmer. ... The first among these havelis was commissioned and constructed in the year 1805 by Guman Chand Patwa and is the biggest and the most ostentatious.It took 55 years and it was completed by his son.Worth visiting take a guide charges 100 rs.

title: dont miss this
review: this is indeed beautiful,amazing architecture and handwork that spell binding .so much of detailing that has  gone into to every piece of art

title: Awesome Rajasthan
review: Best time to visit is around 9 to 10 am. Golden architecture . 2 to 3 hour is enough for this haveli.

title: Tourist spot
review: Nice place to visit with family. Best time is in the evening. The guide hire is important of you want to learn the history

title: Intricately carves Jharokhas
review: It was indeed fascinating to see the 5 havelis with the intricately carved windows. The approach area is on the dirty side so watch your step for animal droppings.  The family still stays in certain parts of the havelis and they sell some items in the shop with the premises. This helps in the maintenance/upkeep so some purchase does benefit them.

title: Average place to visit
review: If you on a rajasthan trip and had already seen other forts than there is nothing new to see in this fort except for the terrace and few points that you can use to capture good photos.

title: Good quick visit
review: As per lonely planet guide we planned on going through just the museum of Kothari Patwo ki Haveli. We did take a guide (INR 150) and it was worth it. The architecture and carved details as well as the exhibits of weapons etc inside are worth seeing. It does not take long - about 40 minutes. They will try to make you stop and shop but it’s not too hard to turn down.

title: A Peek into the lifestyle of the Wealthy Marwaris
review: If history interests you and you like insight into the life and lifestyle of the era and people goneby you will love this place. Comprising of 5 “havelis” (palatial villas), they give a wonderful insight into the life of the wealthy traders of Jaisalmer. Colourfully (as with All things Rajasthani) done up intricate ceilings, incredibly beautiful carved works, and the sheer architectural marvel of erecting such a large haveli solely using the locking technique for stones makes it a beautiful impressive place to visit. Household and business good in use in those times are stores and put up for display. Get a guide for a 100 bucks and he’ll prattleike a parrot in understandable English the life and time of the owners of these havelis. Compact history class. Authenticity suspect though. Interesting and potentially true nonetheless.

title: Patwaon Ki Haveli
review: This is an ancient Haveli related to Jaisalmer and should be taken a guided tour once there.. it will be interesting if a guide is taken..

title: Disappointment
review: The Havelis are so intricately carved and must have been beautiful in their prime, but are now so ill-maintained and dirty. Even the two haveli's taken over by the government are not well maintained. It is sad to see the decay of what must have been splendid at one time.

title: Oldest haveli of Jaismaler
review: The haveli is the oldest haveli of Jaisalmer.It is 5 mins walk  from fort. Architecture carved on stone walls is good. You can give around 1 hour in your itenrary to this haveli

title: One of the best tourist attractions
review: Beautiful and rich in architecture, the 5 havelis of the 5 brothers are one of the best tourist attractions of the city. Clearly above par compared with the other havelis in the city, these definitely merit a visit. And if time permits, one should take the tour of the first haveli that the government maintains.

title: Biggest Havali in Jaishalmer
review: A Very big Havali made of yellow lime stones. It takes at least 2 hours to complete. Must visit place.

title: Virasat
review: A heritage   Hawaii show all item ,room & materials used in past with good maintained positions show how they live in past

title: Unique cluster of hawelis
review: Patwon Ji ki Haveli - Cluster of 5 Havelis built in the 19th century, started by Guman Chand Patwa, a wealthy banker, Patwon ki Haveli took almost 55 years to be built and was completed by his sons. It is most famous for its fine wall paintings, beautiful jharokhas (balconies), archways and gateways.

title: Beautiful havelis
review: Very well kept, haven't seen such intricate carvings in such a good condition. Truely incredible India. One of the must do's on your trip to Jaisalmer.

title: old haveli
review: The 5 Havelis are nice and have been well preserved. The way the artifacts have been displayed is nice.

title: Evidence of royal past
review: Comes with a hefty entry fees. But upon entering the complex, and going through the different stories, one is left awe struck. The rang mahal is marvellous. The panoramic view of the golden fort from its roof is an extra topping.

title: Historical magnificence
review: We did not go inside the havelis but viewed from outside & walked around the area!!!

title: Group of 5 beautiful havelis
review: This is a group of 5 havelis that are located side by side. There is a museum in the first haveli that is worth seeing . All other havelis are also worth a brief visit. Visit for some nice visual arts experience.

title: Havelies in Jaisalmer
review: Waste of money and time... Not even picturesque... RS 100 per person ticket is not worth... Half an hour waste.. parking RS 50 not worth..

title: Must visit place in Jaisalmer. Fantastic stone work and artistry
review: Must visit place in Jaisalmer. Fantastic stone work and artistry. It was the haveli of a big merchant. This haveli gives the glimpse of the lifestyle of merchants of that time (not the royalty, but the merchant community). All the other palaces and museums show us the lifestyle of the royalty, but this place shows us the lifestyle of the rich non royal people. The intricate artwork on the exterior walls is the highlight, done by the Goldsmiths (yes Goldsmiths on the stone). Don't miss. Steps are steep, not advised for elderly and people with health issues.

title: Very nice
review: A must see from outside. Beautiful intricate work. Even though the approach is not all that great. Can't carry strollers as roads r very narrow. Should use tuk tuk to get there. Cars won't be able to reach

title: Must visit in Jaisalmer
review: Very beautiful haveli with intricate carvings on the outside. There is an entry fee of 50 Rs. Inside haveli is a museum. You can skip the entry and can just see the haveli from outside. In case you decide to enter the museum, guide is not needed. I took a guide and paid him 150 INR but it was not required. (you need to negotiate if you hire a guide).

title: Magnificient
review: There are two sections too it. One is managed by government with Rs.50/- entry ticket and one is privately maintained at Rs. 100/- entry fee. I would recommend to visit both and get a  full perspective of the amazing place.

title: A Jewel in crowd
review: The art of Jaiselmer’s construction workers is amazing and made according to Vastu ..?all most all the structures we saw have Brahm Sthan and criss ventilated rooms. The stone cutting work is extra ordinary and depicts the class and religion of the worker..

title: Out of the world monument
review: Breathtakingly marvellous carvings...so intricate..big salute to the master Craftsmen of that age..lovely colorful shops all around selling bags, magnets and clothes.

title: Beautiful
review: Worthy of a visit. The hand work on the exterior of the Haveli is exquisite. Definitely a must see if you are in Jaisalmer.

title: Too much crowded
review: The walkways and stairs are so narrow that they must limit the no of ppl they let in at a time. It got so suffocating for us. The place is otherwise good and well maintained. Recommend hiring a guide if you really want to put things in perspective.

title: Ok
review: Only part that I liked here was real side of haveli. Painting was beautiful, walls were beautifully decorated. Gave a touch of history

title: Another haveli
review: A well maintained haveli with history attached to it . The haveli allegedly belonged to opium smugglers and undoubtedly they were stinking rich with the patronage of the rulers . They had the best of facilities. There is a entry fees and a guide is highly recommended.

title: Must see
review: This haveli is architectural wonder.

title: Nice to visit
review: This haveli is located very near to Jaisalmer fort. This is haveli of devan of raja of Jaisalmer. This has total 5 haveli but only 2 are open for public.

title: WORTH A VISIT FOR ITS HISTORICAL LEGACY
review: The haveli reminds one of the times of the land routes to Europe when Jaisalmer ws an important place in the route. The original owners of the haveli made their wealth in trade which slowly faded as sea routes were discovered and partition killed whatever was left. The insides of the haveli offer a glimpse into the lifestyle of the financiers of the king in olden days - probably more powerful than the king himself. The property can certainly be better maintained given the entry fee collected. A guide is necessary to appreciate the artefacts and the history of the place. Can be combined with a visit to the Jaisalmer fort.

title: great architectual building
review: this is the place, everyone should visit, know how people intelligent 300 year back, there living style, their untensil, there working place, hiding money in different type of lockers, must took guide.

title: worth a visit
review: Just be aware that we got trapped into visiting private part pf Patwa havelli by paying Rs 100 ( which has exhibits like furniture, clothing, coins, locks etc) but there is one part which is managed by ASI and you can enter by paying Rs 30/

title: Beautiful exterior
review: This group of havelis are gorgeous to look at from the outside but aren't really worth paying good money to go inside. The one we visited consisted of rooms recreated as they'd have been a century or so ago and weren't anything special. The main attraction is the beautiful stonework on the outside. That's really worth appreciating so if you don't have time to go inside, don't worry.

title: Truly Unique
review: The Haveli's are truly unique,external architecture and the 'Jali' (mesh) work is really outstanding. Must see

title: Not my kind
review: The first impression was bad.

title: Visit at pattwan ki haveli,jaisalmeer
review: This haveli can be seen alongwith jaisalmeer fort, the famous "sonar kella ".It is a worth seeing haveli having beautiful architecture, off course,a bit tough for elderly people as the stairs are steep,but no one should miss to see the haveli.

title: OK place
review: Not very impressed by the way the place is being managed.They charge 50  for the entrance.But still one can visit.

title: Well preserved (relatively)
review: We availed services of a guide - he asked for just Rs 100 (about usd 1.5) so we said why not

title: Good haveli
review: Kothari patwa haveli is good. Entry fee is 100₹ per person. Take guide must.. 100₹ for guide is ok. Take picture in rajasthani dress is icing on the cake

title: Nice place
review: Magnificent haveli owned by the Kotharis partly and partly by the Govt. Of India. A set of four havel's lines on a row on a small narrow  by lane. The architecture and interiors are splendid. The intricate carvings gs are worth a see. The royal lavishness oozes in the lifestyles. Entry fee is affordable. A good half an hour can be spent admiring the classic. Localities needs to take care so that it attracts the tourists. A must visit.

title: Preview of Bafna's prosperity - once upon a time
review: The place is very attractive from outside and makes us curious to experience the inside view. The inside view and displays are below average.

title: A good place to visit while in Jaisalmer
review: This haveli is in the Jaisalmer Fort area and was created based on the king's instruction to the wealthy business family to support the needy who cleverly gave money on the condition that a grand mansion be made. And the intricate work is really praiseworthy. We did not prefer to go to the museum inside based on the guide's suggestion but were enthralled with a musician duo of father son and their soulful song with music.

title: Nice place to visit.
review: The place is excellent example of rajasthani stone art work. walkable distance from Jaisalmer fort. Better to walk then to take the vehicle to this place

title: architectural marvel ...
review: Already spent lots on ticket so didnt went inside but it looks so good from outside so worth to visit.

title: Kothari's Patwaon-Ki-Haveli
review: Kothari's Patwaon-Ki-Haveli, is placed in jaisalmer. it is like meuseum of Raja's things like pots, clock, clothes, etc. it has a huge collection of this things. nice place to visit. there is a ticket for enter in haveli.

title: Crowded.
review: You can check it out while wandering around. Just visit the palace and that's enough. You get an idea of the history attached to it, after the fort and the palace, it does not need to be entered, a view from outside is enough just to see it for the sake of it. Unless you're very keen, no need to enter.

title: Good watch from outside - Glimpse of great artistry
review: Worth watching from outside. you can roam around in the square, grab pictures and relish the artistry and finesse of the carvings done on the facade. Simply mind blowing hand work in those days.

title: Nothing to see
review: After visiting City palace in Jaipur, Umaid Bhavan in Jodhpur and City palace in Udaipur we felt like nothing to see in this small conjusted Haveli. If the ticket cost is rs10 then you may consider to visit, but definitely can be skipped. Fort view from the top is worth to take pictures though.

title: Small but beautiful haweli relaxing
review: The 5 Haweli are beautiful from the outside 100 per person entry is not expensive to see inside

title: Patwaon-Ki-Haveli
review: The haveli is good but there is no restroom as told by the collector because more people come and it cannot be repaired.

title: Good place with fine work in interiors
review: Most of d historical places has been converted into  museums u cud see d ancient work done on the walls of haveli along with old coins n weapons which were used in earlier times .

title: Wow
review: Haveli or palace you can call it, big one and have lots of rooms, halls, arts, the building structure and interiors to exteriors everything is wow.

title: intricate carvings
review: The intricate carvings (jaali work) on sand stone is really beautiful. It gives you a feel of  the life of rich & famous of old times. Cleanliness of the approach roads can be improved. Better traffic management is required.

title: Patroon Ki Haveli
review: Visit to this beautiful monument is a must and gives insight to how the rich and poor used to live... the place is an architectural beauty..

title: Lavish Haveli in Jaisalmer
review: Famous place to see after Jaisalmer Golden Fort. There are few Haveli's built by old rich businessman, who built these Havelis to support people during 3 years long feminine.

title: Patwaon Ki Haveli - there are 5 in same location
review: 2 of them are still being used as residences and the rest 3 have been converted as Museums. Must visit t again be spellbound seeing the detailed sculpture all around the place. There is also a small bit of shopping you could go downstairs.

title: Good Workmanship!!
review: We didn’t go inside but enjoyed it from outside and took few photos. Excellent workmanship on the exterior wall!

title: More lavish than a king's palace
review: Superb - a set of 5 havelis out of which only 2 are open for public view. Built by textile traders who were so rich, they financed the king's treasury & the havelis are testimony to that wealth.

title: Old style Haveli but very crowded in tourist season
review: It’s an old style Haveli with lots of interesting heritage. But it gets very crowded in tourist season and not worth visiting inside too much.

title: Visit to this haveli
review: It is intricately carved haveli & there are quite a few havelis which are beautiful around this. This haveli is a residential place & hence you can't go in these but can see from outside & really wonder the craftsmanship.

title: must see place in jaisalmer
review: Patwon-ki Haveli is one of the popular attractions in Jaisalmer. Being the largest haveli in the city, the building is currently managed by the government of Rajasthan. The exteriors and interiors of this haveli are superb.

title: Inside a narrow lane
review: Comes on the way out to the Jaisalmer Fort. A narrow lane and there it is. Beautifully structure to capture.

title: Heritage
review: A nice little Haveli in a Blake. There are many such in naisalmer. However this is unique. A must visit when here. Also there is a Jain temple probably 600byrs old. And what an artitecture.  So much detailing on the Stone. Can't believe your eyes that 100scof gets ago it would have been possible without the gadgets. Great. Go to jaisalmer once in a lifetime.  The GOLDEN CITY.

title: Nice but expensive
review: 100 bucks to see some old artifacts. Yes the haveli is nice and one can easily imagine the wonders or yore. But it seemed a  tad bit expensive. Beware of fake guides. These touts started at 100 bucks for the entire tour and bargained their way down to 20!

title: Nice architecture
review: If you have seen fort then can skip this.place .More or less similar designing that anytime bored young kids

title: Nice place
review: Good place. Guide named Sachin is excellent. The best guide ever I met. Please try to take him. Movies like Dil de chuke Sanam, Balika Vadhu shooted here.

title: Beauty of Jaiselmar
review: We came here and visited the Patwa Haveli. This palace is well maintained and carries their lost history. Nice place to recall our history.

title: A Historic Masterpiece
review: The Haveli is a true masterpiece denoting the architecture & life of the time. The majestic towers & carvings are a treat for the eyes.

title: Intrucare jaali work at display but not allowed inside
review: You are allowed only to watch the haveli from outside. The jaali works are intricate and beautiful but nothing much to adore apart from it as you are not allowed inside.

title: A must visit
review: Every haveli has a story which connects to the interior,the museum, the temple,the ambience,the stores,the architecture. Loved every bit of the time spent in the haveli

title: Patwaun ki haveli
review: Good place to visit.extremely good collection and carvings

title: Nice small place to visit in Jaisalmer
review: We booked a guide for just 50 bucks and he explained the importance of the place and the history behind it was really interesting. Glad we visited this place. But getting there by car is bit tricky as there are no parking places near haveli.

title: My visit to Patwon Ki Haweli
review: It is a good place to visit at Jaisalmer. Architecture of haveli and Museum are good.

title: Amazing Architectural
review: Very nice design work in this Haveli. I like very much this place must visit in Jaisalmer. I will try visit again.

title: Nice from the outside but...
review: Actually just looked at the outside and the ground floor of the first one. The guy that took me in was ok and asked the usual questions and gave a history of the shop there. I then just said I would like to sit in peace and rest and that was ok. Then his friend came up and started the same questions. When I said no more questions he did not like it, so I left. Better to go with others or with a guide. There are not that many tourists and the weather is still quite hot.

title: Beautiful haveli in jaisalmer
review: I have been this haweli and it's very beautiful architecture. Also great view of fort.Street is quite different from another side of india.Recommended to all the visitor's.

title: Very nice Haveli in the heart of Jaisalmer!
review: Really loved this place.But you should have a guide who will explain the things to you.They charge a nominal 100/150 bucks only.The view of Jaisalmer fort from the roof is awesome.

title: Architectural Marvel
review: Patwon-ki Haveli is one of the popular attractions in Jaisalmer. It's not just the elegant buildings, but the location itself is clad in golden coloured stone. The narrow lane in front of the Haveli has its own charm. Better you get the service of a guide so that you will be able to get a clear idea of the historical value of the Haveli. We were lucky to have a guide arranged by the hotel Akashdeep, where we stayed. There is enough scope for photography too. People usually stand near the 'jharokhas' (the typical open windows in Rajasthani architecture) and get their pictures taken. A Jaisalmer visitor should never miss this heritage building.

title: Awesome place
review: This is a unique place in jaisalmer. History has lots of glorious things about placea unique carving done by some unique people which is not possible at these days..

title: A must-see at Jaisalmer.
review: It seemed a very interesting place to visit. The havelis have been so well maintained that you can feel its originality by closely observing its walls, floors, ceilings and other objects.

title: Looks Amazing & a Great View!
review: This place is pretty much empty.the entry fee is 50 rupees. The view from the top floor is amazing

title: Favrt place in rajasthan ( jaisalmer)
review: I like very much that place . Its art and imtiriror decoration just awesome. The roof top view of jaisalmer like tik tok gonna stop here. Awesm place

title: Havelis of Patwaon
review: Managed by localities people here story is they left this havelis for the tourist and royal  family shift to other place

title: Royal Living Of Jain Traders
review: If you like history and old objects like Camera, Telephone, etc etc this is the place for you, please be sure to enter the right haveli which is right next to entry gate

title: Wow!
review: The government owned Havelis are not well maintained, it stinks of pigeon excreata.

title: Patwaon ki haveli
review: Architecture is fabulous Nd guide was also very good . Excellent antic collection and excellent photos view.

title: Haveli
review: Great carving in monuments. It’s like gold jewellery. Better to take a guide. You can have nice clicks. But can be maintained more better way.

title: Wonderful
review: One of beautiful Haveli near Jaisalmer fort, constructed by businessmen patwan to provide work to residents when fort was completed. It took 12 years to complete. Patwan was both importer n exporter and one of rich business. Awesome craving work, even I have not seen in forts. Later on acquired by Government and converted into Heritage place n museum.

title: Good one
review: Located very close to the Fort, the architecture is fantastic. It is a little hard to find it but after navigating through the alleys, you get there. There is an entrance fee and you don't  spend more than an hour seeing the artifacts displayed within the haveli.

title: Patwaon Ki Haveli
review: Knowing about Patwa's will be good and interesting. One can relate the past with current business and luxury available in modern world.

title: Best havali
review: This havali is the wondeful stone carving , same like a maharaja palace. Defidently recommended to see all of my friends and family..

title: Beautiful haveli
review: I went at Patwa haveni such a beautiful mension with great balcony and more details of stone carving. With 66 balcony and beautiful museum with nice old collections.

title: Patwari’s are the top
review: This yet another yellow stone patwon ki haveli is good for it’s own looks but the scenic beauty is not as good as the Main fort has. Also, the city view is not so good.

title: Beautiful
review: I was at jasalmer for holidays and seen this beautiful place was awesome..... There is three havelis...... And three of them was do beautiful.. I am in

title: Nice Haveli with he decor
review: It was a nice experience to See tredational patwon ki Havali. I see carving of Jaisalmer stone.Its amazing in Jaisalmer yellow Stone.

title: Good historical place
review: This place is worth visiting to see some old traditions. Though in the small lanes, do not worry as it will not make much time either to reach or to see.

title: Golden heritage place !
review: Jaisalmer was a awesome city all over trip in India because there was many old haveli included patwa haveli.

title: Best haveli in Jaisalmer
review: We visited this and paid R200 for a guide, but the fee is up to you. You can find one near the entrance. Worth a visit for an hour. Some areas have been renovated. Beautiful exterior in local carved stone. Gives a great insight into the rich life of a C19 merchant. Cost was R250pp.

title: Amazing
review: The structure, the rooms, the view. Really worth to visit. Is rrally beatifull house, eventough the enterance fee is very different with local but you can find is worth to visit

title: Gd Haveli
review: Visited and surprised to see luxuriousness of Haveli. Good plsce to visit once. Its very nice Interior.

title: Amazing carvings: and well maintained
review: I visited this place in late FEB 2018,

title: Nice Place for time pass
review: There are always some secondary spot along with main spot. This haveli falls in secondary spot category. If u have time than go there. If u skip it nothing big is missed. Good art work. Expensive glasses. Hire a guide, he will charge Rs50 and he will take u in complete haveli and tell the story in an hour. after which u can stay there for some more time.

title: Magically
review: Patwaon ki Haveli are truelly magically.Its gives you the glimpse the rich history that India has. Havelis were hub of ancient trade routes between India & middle east countries in ancient times.Beautifully built & crafted havelis also offer the amazing view of Indian architecture.It is also shows how rich Indian traders were & there lavish life..

title: Visit of Jaisalmer
review: Nice architecture model with superb stone carving work. It impress us with our great past. Must visit this place.

title: Enchanting
review: This is truly an amazing work of architecture. An interesting insight into the lives and culture of those who built the haveli. It is well worth the visit if you are in Jaisalmer!

title: Very beautiful interior architecture
review: Patwon ki Haveli comprises of five havelis, out of which the first haveli is the largest and worth visiting. The havelis are famous for their interior architecture as the rooms are decorated with gold, fine wall paintings, beautiful balconies, archways and gateways.

title: DECENT HAVELI
review: I feel very surprise to see this kind of haveli. Well built and attractive place for tourist.  Must see place in area.

title: Lovely architecture
review: The patwo ki haveli has marvellous architecture and a must visit in Jaisalmer! The place has lot of stairways so please take care with young kids and do hire a guide

title: A merchant's home
review: The havelis in Jaisalmer all have a stunning architecture, in this one you can have a look inside to daily life of a merchant's Family(19th century). Admire all these wonderful interior decorations which are similar to those in the palaces.

title: Fascinating insight into Haveli Life
review: Well worth a visit. The decorative stonework is amazing and there’s loads to see, a real insight into life in the merchants house from the counting house to the kitchen

title: Blast from the past
review: This interconnected collection of Havelis or palatial edifices houses an enviable collection of day-to-day items, attires, vessels, tools and devices used in the 19h century, giving us a glimpse of the lifestyle of the rich and the famous who flourished under the monarchy. An interesting place to visit!

title: Lovely Haveli
review: This is well worth a visit as beautifully restored with some interesting painted buildings.  Well worth the effort to climb up the many steps up to the roof for an excellent view of the fort and across the city.

title: Marvel Homes
review: Great architecture and craftsmanship. Well planned houses and well maintained.Interact with family of these homes. Its an experience to hear how it came into being Must visit. Market very close and walking distance from fort.

title: Dip into the history
review: Rich historical site with a ton of artifacts from the era of kings and palaces. There are a few neat shops around as well and roof top cafe to relax afterwards.

title: WOW!!!!!!
review: what a haveli...amazing..cant beleive still that we have seen the old haveli with old times things in that..still not satisfy myself..i want to see once more....every one should see the haveli ...

title: Nice place to be in Jaisalmer
review: The Haveli was worth a 1-2h visit with a nice guide. The guide cost us 100 rupees and we gave him 200 in the end. The shops around seem to be tourist traps.

title: Unique architecture which has to be seen if you're in Jaisalmer
review: We visited the Havelis in 42 degree heat, which wasn't ideal - but the architecture is stunning and well worth the modest entrance prices. There are a number of Haveli, each with their own entrance price - the "museum" one is the best, as affords the archway view back over the exterior of the other buildings - the iconic shot.

title: Very expensive for what you get.
review: The haveli is acutally not as big as excepted. The 250 rupiahs you pay are not really worth the museum. It is hard to get around and the time we were there they had some renovations going on, so you could not get in to all rooms. Compared to other havelis in the city it feels overpriced and in the end they once again try to get you to buy things in a rather aggressiv way. Would not recommend to go inside, from the outside its very nice!

title: beautiful architecture
review: there are a series of havelis.you can see the havelis from outside and go inside a step or two for free.but there is a fee to enter inside the havelis.there are musicians and puppeteers and people selling dresses

title: Patwaon-ki-haveli
review: This place is just ️,saw haveli for the first time ,had a royal feeling ,have a visit here ,if you plan a trip to jaisalmer.

title: Patwaon-Ki-Haveli
review: Unfortunately when we visited this place only one Haveli was open for Tourist & remaining was closed for renovation.

title: Beautiful architecture
review: Beautiful place in jaisalmer .has the feel of the history.worth seeing the handcrafted art in walls.get a nice view too and close to city

title: Dream Haveli... Patwaon ki Haweli
review: COntains more than 3 hawelis together built. The inside rooms are decorated with glass, stones, pearls, and mirrors. One of the mesmerizing example of carving, designs and fine arts.

title: A must visit in Jaysalmer
review: I have seen many who don't know or visit this master piece in Jaysalmer. This is a MUST visit place to experience what story the marvelous yellow stone can say.

title: Better than the fort itself.
review: Very much informative and has more exhibits than the fort palace itself. Give good time for it as there are lots to see and well planned exhibits

title: A decent place to spend some time
review: For the entrance fee of 50Rs. (March 2018) this was worth it, it's an interesting place to poke around in for a bit and has a great view from the roof. The exhibits are not super interesting, go more to see the house than anything else.

title: dont miss this at all
review: its the best oldest haveli again guide is the best person to take through and explain this place its so beautiful cant explain one needs to go and see this place

title: Patwan ki haveli
review: Old building in a very narrow lane with Stunning designs curved in yellow stone is what uou find here. These are homes of rich merchants of Jaisalmer now converted to museum.

title: Visit with a Guide or you are missing the point
review: It was a must visit attraction of Jaisalmer so we visited the haveli and hired a guide who give us the detailed history about the whole complex. A must visit do hire a guide to know the real facts and they do not demand much money.

title: Good Enough
review: Paying Rs.100/- per head as entry fee we entered the Haveli.  It's big, it;s full of decent architecture, it's attractive.  Through narrow corridor with careful movements we had to complete the call following a Guide, may be hired by another party.  Finally, you will reach a shop offering Saree, Bed cover etc., situated at the ground floor in line of exit the haveli.

title: Beautiful !
review: Jaisalmer has many Havelis, all of them more than a 100 years old ! The Jain families still live in most of these havelis even now in a segregated part of the haveli.

title: Nice historical place
review: The haveli is must watch place in Jaisalmer. It is located near to sonar quila. It will take most 40 mins to visit the place completely. Outside you can do some shopping also. Ladies bags, T-shirts are sold just outside.

title: Beautiful place
review: Patwaon ki haveli not a big place but a must place in which jaisalmer.amazing architecture where rich people used to live in that time.

title: Havelis of Rich
review: These are about five Havelis together in the Jaisalmer city. The architecture is unique and beautiful. Tickets of privetly maintained Havelis are high.

title: Major attraction
review: Fort, Patwaon Ki Haveli and other attractions can be clubbed and managed in a single day. A museum inside the haveli is good. "Zarukha" and extremely difficult carvings are mind blowing.

title: Astounding
review: Anywhere you go in the city of Jaisalmer, you are sure to set sights on the delicate carvings of the various ‘havelis’, and Patwon ki Haveli is one such monument. Situated in the vicinity of the Jaisalmer fort, you can take a vehicle to a certain point then go by foot, or if you fancy marveling at the beautiful sand-stone structures, walk the entire distance.

title: A rabbit warren
review: Room after small room of interesting architecture and some furnishings.  It was a fun place to visit.  Pretty sure we never would have found our way out if we didn't have a guide.

title: Havelis of wealthy traders
review: It’s a cluster of 5 havelis which is quite famous and attracts tourists. It is just a hype and just one of them could be visited rather than visiting all of them. Eachhaveli has its own entry fees and guides will pounce on / pester you to showthe insides for a nominal fee  which is totally not worth it because the havelis can be explored on your own without any help. The tourists are their only means of earning and In case you want to encourage their livelihood then please do engage their services. The havelis just house the items used by the rich merchants in their prosperous times. It’s just a collection of daily used items on display.

title: Exquisite art
review: The art on the walls outside is too good. It is pure example of craftsmanship of Rajasthani artisans of that period. Must visit.

title: Well maintained hawali
review: This is very maintained haveli. This is private property.Interior is very good. You can see Jaislamer and fort from the top of this haveli

title: One of the few attractions in Jaisalmer
review: This is one of the highlights of my trip to Jaisalmer. Tracking it down could be a bit difficult but fun. Just ask around plus there's also directions that'll lead you. It's a beautiful structure though touristy. You can take a lot of beautiful pictures! This haveli shows how wealthy people before lived. There's a lot of touts and vendors along the way. Don't be sidetracked.

title: A beautiful building from another era
review: This is a beautiful heritage building located in the heart of Jaisalmer. These are 5 different havelis but entrance is allowed for the first one. The intricate carvings are done beautifully and it apparently took a team of artisans more than 12 years to make a single Haveli. The first Haveli has been converted into a museum and has artifacts, utensils and other stuff used on a daily basis. It is a window to the beautiful past of India and a place that should definitely be visited when in Jaisalmer

title: Good for Architecture lovers but clumsy
review: Almost in a walking distance from the Jaisalmer Fort, is another heritage site which you can drop in - Patwaon ki Havelli. There are actually five different havellis of which two are maintained by the Government and the others are maintained by the local trustees and authorities. The entrance ticket serves you for the three other than the Government ones which needs seperate tickets. The first havelli showcases important items used by the Maharajas and the walls are adorned with paintings and handicraft items. The whole structure is build with yellow sandstone with fort like architecture. One can witness ancient musical instruments, wide range of silver utensils.

title: Ptwo ki hveli
review: Very good arctchr...tickets rate is so high i think. .100 rup jitna kuch nhi h...bus arctchr is so nice..shoping outside it good ..like hand made bags

title: A good history lesson
review: With a guide we navigated through this former merchants house and were amazed at the detail and luxury of the construction of the house. The guide was inciteful and gave us a much greater understanding of this Haveli and the surrounding Haveli's built for the merchants family.

title: Good
review: This is private really middle of market so nice Kaun Banega very nice beautiful buildings I like it so much

title: Beautiful architecture
review: Beautiful architecture but ticket is expensive 100 to go inside, u can see them from outside as well. The next haveli maintained by govt is 50 rupees ticket but first haveli people did not let u realise this. U can find it after coming out

title: Standout attraction in Jaisalmer
review: Road is very narrow but enough parking space available. Entry charge is around 100. I found it more interesting than Jaisalmer fort. The structure is built using sandstone,

title: A good spot to visit
review: Though a let down after Sonar Kella, yet a good one. The feel and the stories mesmerizes you when you think of that era.

title: Oldest Haveli in Jaisalmere
review: This multi-storey house provides a look into the ancient and more recent history of Jaisalmer. Steps are narrow and sometimes slippery. Be careful. Take your time and don't let anyone rush you.

title: Wonderful craftsmanship
review: Architecture lovers delight .. must visit at Jaisalmer. The craftsmanship is wonderful, each and every article displayed wow's you. The roof top provides a good view of the fort.

title: Average
review: I don’t understand why pay 100 r/s to go in and see things which aren’t unique. Get a glimpse of the buildings from a distance and avoid the bird droppings.

title: A Must visit!
review: Awesome architecture and a must visit for history lovers. Out of 5 havelis, opt for the very 1st one for an inside view.

title: Finest Haveli
review: I went to Patwaon Ki Haveli. The Patwaon Ki Haveli is considered to be the one of the largest as well as the finest haveli of Rajasthan. This haveli is essentially a cluster of five havelis, which was constructed in 1805 CE by Guman Chand Patwa. It is great place to go.

title: great stone work
review: This haveli is located at walking distance from the Jaisalmer fort. The architecture work is superb.there are group of 5 havelis. but I think  entry fees is too high, also beware of birds dropping which is very common in Jaisalmer.

title: Awesome
review: Marvelous, intricate stone work, definitely better than the fort. Must see location in jaisalmer. But shops opened in the haveli are spoilers

title: Good
review: Is very old building by making Yellowstone so beautiful very good car winning I see the outside so beautiful after I go inside so I like it so much I see in the world beautiful gardening place

title: Ancient Indian designs and architecture
review: Havelis in India were huge however, they were made out of thick stones and rocks and even the bricked walls used to be twice as thick than the usual walls we have these days. One could see steep stairwells, an open common area in the middle of the property and rooms that have a set of stairs to enter the room. These are the things that commonly define a Haveli. Now, the things that separate the property are :

title: Trippy trippy
review: The fee for foreigners is much higher than for locals but it’s so worth it. I gasped when I entered the first room. The outside is just as impressive as the inside, but they’re very different. Get a guide for 50rps to hear all the awesome stories about the intriguing history of this special place. Don’t miss it.

title: A haveli in true sense
review: This 6- storey mansion is an architectural gem worth a visit. Take a guided tour for just 50rs to know about the haveli and patwa people. This haveli is the most famous one and a private property, hence has been renovated from time to time. The haveli has ornate paintings and intricate sandstone carvings. The entrance fee charged is 100 bucks. But just behind this haveli there is another one of these havelis which is a government property and is in a sorry state.If you wish to really see the original state of these havelis do visit this one.The entrance fee is only 50rs. You’ll find a crowd of people in the first haveli whereas there will be hardly a few in this one. Also you get a brilliant view of Jaisalmer fort from the top of both Havelis.

title: Narrow lanes
review: The place tells all about the Rajasthan culture and its architecture... Its little crowded looking at the lot of stairs which needs to climb to see the entire haweli .. Overall a nice experience with family

title: Great place to visit with spouse
review: Travelled with my wife and visited these architectural marvels, which are worth visiting while crossing Jaisalmer.  Must go to the top of the building to have a bird's eye view of the magnificent city.

title: Nice place for photography
review: Nice place for photography. 100 rupees entry fees. Market to buy some traditional items as well. Few movies also shooted over here.

title: Must visit place in Jaisalmer
review: The lavish haweli is a must visit place in Jaisalmer. You will get to know how these rich people used to live in that era. Amazing architecture, beautiful paintings, past time technology and scenic view of the city from the roof-top makes it a great place to visit.

title: Good atmospheric llace
review: I enjoyed this trip. It takes about half an hour to an hour to explore but there is a rooftop where I stood and enjoyed the city view from there for an extra half hour. There is often music and dance outside.

title: Old, beautiful and smart place
review: Visited in morning. There are 5 havelis. One is with gov that you can see in Rs50 but we visit first one which is with master (Baniya) which decorated his haveli with old antiques and colorful glasses. Entry ticket is Rs100 & for students 70. He smartly covered the entire place for making business. Haveli is beautiful and on opposite side shooting of Bollywood song 'Jhanjharia' done. You can find Rajasthani caps and have a photograph for Rs10 only. I'll say it's a must visit place.

title: Beautiful havelis
review: A set of five beautiful havelis, only one of them is open for public now. This haveli is located at walking distance from the Jaisalmer fort. Top of the haveli gives a beautiful view of the fort.

title: Old and Beautiful
review: Not a big place but a must visit in Jaisalmer. Amazing architecture where rich people used to live in that time. This is also a great location of architecture and street/people photography.

title: Good
review: very old building is Yellowstone making so nice carving so very good I love it images plays Jaisalmer full video international don't miss this place and heartly request

title: Ancient Haveli
review: A must visit place. You will have a glimpse of the life style of the people who lived few hundred years ago in such a extreme weather.

title: Nice place to visit
review: It was nice experience to see royal art work n well maintained haveli. We hired a guide which one also reasonable n give whole info about it in Rs 50. We also meet nice fellow -owner of handicraft shop just outside of patwa haveli- Shri Ganesha -art handicraft.

title: Nice look into history
review: 5 havelis , we paid entry ticket of rs 100 per person for 1st which had a museum and found it worth the money.

title: Awsome creativity
review: Must visit to see the carving in haweli. Well maintained. Good market outside with reasonable prize.

title: Decent place to visit
review: Only the first haveli one should visit.

title: Nice experience
review: It was a nice experience to See tredational marwer Havali. I see carving of Jaisalmer stone.Its amazing in Jaisalmer yellow Stone.

title: A pleasant surprise
review: We did not expect much from the place but found it worth a visit. The collection and glass work is amazing.

title: Gorgeous architecture
review: Carved like a dream, the 6 story structure is a marvel. Fans which worked on kerosene, ice cream machines centuries old, gold ceilings and exquisite architecture like you have never seen before. The abode of the opium traders from the ancient world. It will take your breath away.

title: Good one
review: Rajasthan is all about Royalty and this place will makes your feel how alive Rajasthan is in terms if  restoring history.

title: BEautiful and intricate.
review: So thoughtfully built buildings with places to keep lamps. Intricate work and preserved heritage.

title: Visit to Jaisalmer not complete without viewing this
review: The intricate carvings outside and inside the haveli are stunning and mindblowing. Days can be spent viewing this architectural marvel. its a heritage monument now belonging to the Govt of india

title: No words to discribe
review: When i saw it first time its like i lost in a a black hole. like my mind didnt think about any thing at that time its like lost in time. no words

title: havelis
review: Must visit place,Beautiful and stunning architecture.Halls and windows provide amazing view of the town

title: Not worth the money spend
review: Better to visit from outside and the view of the whole city and the fort from the terrace. 1 part is of government and another private. Private part has museum inside and the ticket rate is also high as compared to government.

title: Beautiful
review: Had a really enjoyable time exploring this beautiful Haveli. It has some interesting exhibits and is definitely worth the entry fee. Sadly, as with many attractions locally, you are pestered by unofficial ‘guides’ who follow you round even though you decline them repeatedly. In our case, the ‘guide’ had a shop in the Haveli and just wanted us to go inside at the end. We refused. He interfered in our enjoyment of the visit by persistently approaching us despite us saying we were happy to explore alone. We still enjoyed the visit nonetheless. Views from the roof are excellent for taking photos of the fort.

title: Good view
review: This haveli is walkable distance from the hotel and we can also explore the shopping on the street for bags and kurtas and junk material etc

title: Haveli with very detailed work
review: Definitely Recommended for a visit.

title: Beauty personified, Money speaks..
review: Beautiful is the word, breath taking ly quiet and just awesome, a must visit if you're lover of architecture. A place which defies the money power of business man. How a money can transform an ordinary house into palatial and rich one.

title: Nicely preserved and maintained
review: A good place to see the old traditional work nothing less than a beautiful painting. The walk to the top could be little tiring.

title: Dripping with history...
review: Amazing cultural and historical monument...

title: mindblowing ! pride of jains.
review: Patwaon were rich jain merchants and built these set of 5 havelis for each of their 5 sons. The havelis are beautifully carved and very intelligently designed. the first haveli from the road is the best to visit and the rest can be avoided. its a photographers delight and those who love architecture will also appreciate the rich history and design of these havelis.  Pls do take a guide to appreciate the site better. Must visit and not to be missed.

title: Must visit
review: Surprise to see the lifestyle of rich in place like Jaisalmer . All modern aminities were there , refrigerator , printer, photocopier machine etc , lot of more things , haveli is very beautiful , what a carving

title: Chain of Haveli
review: Chain of 4 havelis built by patwa's having great piece of art and design in it. you must be having 2 hours time to completely visit and thoroughly understand the dept of art it contains

title: Amazing Craftsmanship
review: It is a chain of 5 Havelis. It was built by a rich merchant for his family in early 1900s. The facade of each Haveli is uniquely decorated with amazing carving on the native 'golden stone' of Jaisalmer.

title: 200 year old Noble Men Houses
review: Big Businessmen -200 year old  Families build these for their children. Got famous for their beautiful architectures.

title: Amazing place, brilliant guide!
review: An absolutely fascinating and stunningly beautiful Haveli with great history and a great build story. My guide brought the place to life and had a huge knowledge about it. It was so worthwhile to spend time here. I thoroughly recommend a visit as it will be right at the top of your time in the stunning city of Jaisalmer.

title: Can be skipped if in a hurry
review: Its a good place but can be skipped if in a hurry. Just a regular type of haweli but entry price of Rs.100 is a little bit high f9r this place.

title: Very attractive to see a super luxerry life style of patwah of jaiselmer
review: Visit this place to see how much luxery life style was they have at that time too.. with. Children's can see some things which they have no any knowledge of them.

title: Artistic Haveli and Museum
review: We took a guide to visit the Jaisalmer city. We paid ₹ 400 for the same. Guide helped us cover the city in less than 3 hrs by taking us to right places and letting us know the stories and history keeping us interested all the time. This Haveli is beautiful from outside and it took 60 years to build it completely. Combination of 5 havelis where one of it is converted to Museum to give an insight on old lifestyle of Patwas. Museum also has shops where one can find Camel wool stoles. These are expensive than pashminas but are rare.

title: Gorgeous Architecture.
review: We did not go inside, but definitely worth seeing this amazing structure. One does not make structures like this today, and it is a testament to the designers, architects, and builders to have been able to do this a really long time ago.

title: Fraud Parking Gangs
review: The moment we entered through the main road while driving our car, we were stopped by this young boy ( teenager)  asking 50 Rs for simply entering the the road which lead us to the complex. We told him we were simply going to get dropped by the driver and then leave, to which he denied and said " Police would not allow , and that car would go inside only when you pay us money " . We got angry and denied him any sum to which he made a phone call to some police guy i suppose. A minute after we noticed that the police man standing at the barricading at that narrow lane stopping all cars ( especially with Non Rajasthan registration numbers ). We decided not to mess up with that and got off and walked on feet to the venue. This maligned our whole experience. This is so sad that most of the tourist destinations in India have such Goon combo ( nexus) between Police and localites who fool tourists in the name of Parking/Guided tours.

title: One of the most beautiful structures for photography
review: Trust me if you love photography, visit this place.

title: Serene Place
review: Very Nicely maintained and very beautiful. It is however necessary to have a guide else you have high chance to miss out on the small details. The craftsmanship of the house of just mind blowing.

title: Well maintained
review: Beautifull haveli with original forniture and utensils. I loved it! The view from the top is nice and the surroundings full of shops

title: An interesting place
review: An interesting historic place to visit. Do take a guided tour. There are few shops in the end, do bargain with them if you want to buy something from them.

title: Intricate carvings
review: Visit this haveli to get an idea of the skill of the artisans of the time.It is made of yellow sandstone and boasts ornate walls,finely carved balconies and windows.A government guide will take you on a tour explaining the history and architecture of the place.Be prepared to climb 4 floors up on very deep stairs.It is definitely worth it.The lanes outside the haveli are dotted with street vendors selling their hand crafted wares.A must visit .

title: Overhyped and overpriced
review: You can easily skip this one. Their main intention is to take you to their shop. 100/ per person is not at all justified. Thanks

title: This is Art
review: Dilapidated and almost turning into ruins due to apathy of the authorities. This Haveli (large sized house) is matchless in planning, architecture and sculpting. Golden sandstone used to create these matchless marvels in still intact even after a few centuries.

title: One of top tourist places in Jaisalmer
review: Beautiful Haveli, worthy of visiting. Mirror halls are as beautiful as in Udaipur palace (but of course on a smaller perspective) . There are many well painted rooms with historical equipment and rich exposition of objects related to daily life of old Indian nobles. We visited quite many of Indian historical monuments and many of them showed much less for this price... You will spent there some time to go through all the rooms.

title: Small nice haveli
review: This is a small haveli (2-3 floors) located on the other end of the Jaisalmer fort. 50rs - Car parking , 100rs Entry , 30rs p.p one way auto charge to reach here from the parking. Time needed - 1 hour max . Guide charge nominal 50-100 rs.

title: Beautiful haveli
review: Patwon ki haveli is one of the most beautiful and well preserved, well maintained havelis (mansion) in Jaisalmer. It is said that it is the first haveli that was erected in Jaisalmer. Guman CHand Patwa, a rich trader of that time, got this haveli built. It is a must visit place while in Jaisalmer.

title: Must visit place, if you are in jaisalmer
review: One of must watch , if you are in jaisalmer

title: Old classic haveli
review: One must visit and see old collection.  Every haveli having tickets, but roads are dirty,

title: Five intricately built mansions by Bafna Business family centuries ago
review: The masnions have amazing design with rooms for various types of activities like business rooms, Conference rooms, living quarters, Kitchens, store houses, secret safe vaults, secret tunnels, women's quarters, view galleries all designed thougtfully. It is an architectural marvel.

title: Architectural Gem
review: Since you are already in Jaisamler, visit the place once. Absolute delight to visit this grand old Haveli which as intricate carvings on the facade.You can afford to spend an hour here. This is the biggest architectural work in jaisalmer but let me caution you the tickets are a bit steap.

title: Excellent
review: This Haveli was a complete surprise. We nearly didn’t visit it and would have missed something very special. The exterior takes you back to a different era. Apparently there are 5 havelis in total but we only visited first and second. The first has been restored but second has been more or less left as it is. So visiting both gives you a good perspective of the life of wealthy merchant family.

title: A view from outside works after a visit to Jaisalmer fort
review: I loved the area around the Haveli and captured the ambiance. The outside of the Haveli is beautiful probably inspired by the Jaisalmer Fort. The street and the local street vendors add so much color to the haveli.

title: Crowded ill maintained heritage site !
review: It’s a free sight with some paid parts. One can spend an hour or two walking along its street and checking out the rooms of this once home to a prominent business families of Rajasthan. A lovely location for some portrait photography and traditional  shopping.

title: Nice
review: It’s just another amazingly built fort in Jaisalmer. The interiors are mesmerising and amazing. The history is pretty interesting, our cab driver knew a lot about it and went on talking about it for about 30 mins

title: Nice old Haveli. Must visit place
review: Patwon ki Haveli gives a very good idea of old culture, architecture and  house planning. One can get many details of old Rajasthani culture and trade practices . Important thing is to take a guide , else  it is quite difficult to understand the background and the importance of structure/planning . You can get a very nice view of the city from the top floor terrace

title: Underrated
review: A lot of people were telling us to just look at it from the outside, however we are so glad we ended up going in. It was truly so gorgeous, and we hope some more work is put into maintaining this beautiful house to ensure that many more people will be able to see it!

title: Beautiful and impressive stone carving
review: Very beautiful carving on stone.  So intricate as if done in wood.  I have been to several beautiful buildings and palaces and I will say these havelis were some of the most beautiful that I have seen.  I did not go inside as I did not have time.

title: Interesting place that takes you back into history
review: Well worth a visit to see how the wealthy business lived in Jaisalmer. It is an elaborate building which steeps in history.

title: Excllent architect
review: Exclent architect but if you guys have seen udaipur city palace musem , albert musem in jaipur, haldi ghati musem, it purely waste of seeing inside its better to take pics from out side and move to other place

title: Commercialised and Hyped
review: There is nothing worth seeing in these havelis except the carved stone walls. The govt property stinks. The other private haveli I did not visit, for it truly looked commercialised. Absolutely can be skipped.

title: Stunning view of Jaisalmer city
review: Patwaon ki Haveli, 5 different ex-Residences of Patwa brothers. Great piece of architectural art, very beautiful and glimpse of historical royal life.

title: Patwao Ki Haveli
review: Patwon ki Haveli is one of the prime sightseeing place in Jaisalmer. The heritage monument is marvel of the city. The beautiful work of art on ceiling of the halls and chambers will leave you speechless. The premises is free to visit however if you wish to visit each chamber or halls then you need to buy ticket that will provide you guided access to the palace

title: Art at its best
review: The havelis are another attraction in jaisalmer. The art over the yellow Stone is breathtaking and the jharokhas are very beautiful. From the inside though much have changed but still looks good. It is just small walk from sonar Kila and a must visit place in jaisalmer

title: Nice Haveli
review: Nice amazing chambers and intrinsic ceilings.

title: Exquisite design
review: This is truly an excellent building to visit....not only for its intricate carving, but also for the wonderful design. Its in the heart of the town, and is part of 5 such havelis, two of which are open to visitors. These were built by merchants, whose descendants reside in the private ones to date. The havelis have separate entry fees - something which does not seem very right to me as a visitor! the detailed carving is beautiful, and the rooms and their decor are maintained quite well, giving you a glimpse into the past. I definitely recommend a visit here...

title: Nice well maintained place
review: Its a nice place. Artifacts and rooms are well maintained. You will find some good architecture and artifacts here. If you are into history you will love this place

title: Excellent art work
review: We visited Patwon ki Havelis on 21st Nov, 2017. These havelis are constructed by doing very intricate art work in golden Jaisalmer stone. Out of these a few are under the Govt. while a family is living in one of these. One haveli has been converted as museum by its owners and they charge Rs 100 from Indians & Rs 250 from foreigners.

title: Entry fee is too high to visit again
review: We visited this place second time in the last 10 years. This time looking to the entry fee charged, I did not find it worthwhile to revisit in future.

title: Nice Havelie
review: Patwaon-Ki-Haveli is one of must visited place in jaisalmer, there are total 5 havelies in a row but only 2 of them are open for visitors, but 1st one is the main attraction for visitor. with having great museum inside and great carvings.

title: Palace is OK but entry fee it too high
review: This place is not value for money. The entry fee is too high. Haveli is good one and probably best one among all havelis. The access to haveli is on foot as you have to park your vehicle about 500 m away from the havelis and navigate across house lanes to reach the spot. If you are wiling to shell out Rs. 100 per visitor (for indian traveller), you may visit; otherwise you may skip.

title: Nice place
review: Good example of architecture of Jaisalmer.

title: must see haveli
review: Out of the 3 havelis in Jaisalmer this is the one to see. This is the most complete and with access to many rooms.

title: Not a Must Visit Place. A little overhyped.
review: If you are visiting Jaisalmer, you are told to visit this haveli as per all the travel websites but as per my experience it should be the last destination during your Jaisalmer visit. Visit this place only if time and energy is left after visiting other places. There are five havelis named Patwon ki haveliyan owned by old rich merchants. Out of five, only one is open for tourists with Rs. 100 ticket per person. In this haveli you would get to know and see the lifestyle of old desert city, rajasthani architecture, old household articles etc. Its not very far from Jaisalmer fort and you can go there by walking as well.

title: Most mpressive display of his wealth
review: Built in 19th Century over 50 years spanning 5 Floors to house his 5 sons, this amounts to a rich man's ostentatious display of wealth.

title: TAKE A GUIDE FOR RS 50 ONLY. WE TOOK MANISH VASU. HE WAS SO WORTH IT
review: We found the entry price of 100 per person excessive but the guide's 50 buck charge is so worth it. The guide will tell you things about the past of the havelis, things you would never have known otherwise. After having seen all the fabulous forts and palaces of Rajasthan, the haveli would have been ordinary without the guide's narrative. The other guides are very loud but Manish was soft spoken. He also pointed out his cousin's store Krishna's Handlooms & Handicrafts but funnily enough we had already purchased a lot from this store as we had found it very reasonably priced.

title: Second Haveli is good one as it’s less crowded than first one
review: First number Haveli is too much crowded and entry fee is Rs 100,while second number Haveli is less crowded.entry fees is Rs 50

title: Even if you are not into History!
review: Take a guide for a quick & informative tour, although most of the exhibits in the haveli are self-explanatory! Since, most parts of the fort are commercialized & the famous Gadsisagar lake heavily crowded, I found this place the most worth visiting one, after the sand dunes, of course!  Even if you are not into History-do visit!

title: Good view of ancient haveli style buildings.
review: It is beautiful architecture and design makes you aware of the ancient style of living.The inside of the abandoned havelies are inhabited by a large bat population and is stinky.The guides tell you about the havelis but it is not really needed.One can have a  round see the exhibits,architecture and design.Not much activity otherwise.

title: A place of architectural importance
review: The one thing that I liked about this place is its architecture which also reminds of the wealth of the Patwas who own this haveli.

title: One of the Much Interesting historical Place
review: Good Historical Place The Patwon Ji ki Haveli is an interesting piece of Architecture and is the most important among the havelis in Jaisalmer. This is precisely because of two things, first that it was the first haveli erected in Jaisalmer and second, that it is not a single haveli but a cluster of 5 small havelis. The first among these havelis was commissioned and constructed in the year 1805 by Guman Chand Patwa and is the biggest and the most ostentatious. Stayed for long time and explored the place.

title: Patwo ki haveli tour.
review: Nice place to visit. Beautiful building.good view of the jaisalmer Fort from here. 4 out of 5 haveli are not meant to visit. Good architectural design.

title: Absolutely stunning
review: Very very nearly beautiful set if 5 Havelis with probably the finest architecture in an of Rajasthan. One of the Havelis is a privately owned museum arranged with many antiques as the Haveli would have been from the inside in its glory days. Must visit place.

title: Ok ok
review: The place has nothing new....very huge stairs

title: Beautiful
review: Walking around so friendly no hassle , the architecture around the town is gorgeous. This i the largest haveli in jaislmer and the colour was stunning.

title: Beautiful
review: I had seen pictures of these havelis about 15 years back when my mother visited it and since then I was longing to see them myself. Such intricate carving cannot be seen anywhere else in the world. Dream come true for me

title: Exceedingly good place
review: The auto charged Rs 50 from Jaisalmer fort to reach this place. There are two of them side by side. You need to individually buy tickets. There are guides available for as low as Rs 20. The haveli is grand. Architecture is amazing. You climb through various levels. There is WOW every now and then. This is good place to admire lifestyle of those ages. Plenty of artifacts on display. The best part was terrace where I was lucky to witness sunset. You can also get fantastic photo shots of Jaisalmer fort from terrace. You must visit these two haveli's if you are in Jaisalmer

title: Visit once
review: Since you are in Jaisamler, visit the place once. Nothing extraordinary about the place but you can afford to spend an hour here.

title: OK. 250 INR fee is steep
review: An old house with a museum which is ok in parts

title: Haveli with intricate carvings - Must visit
review: For people who like architectural marvels, this is a must visit place in Jaisalmer. The ostentatious carvings etched out in sandstone with infinite detail are just amazing. Mirror-work and paintings inside are beautiful too.

title: Must visit
review: If you are in Jaiselmair, this place is must visit. Good museum with lots of objects. Architecture is key attraction. If you are photography freak this place is heaven.

title: beautiful heritage structure
review: This is one structure which reflects the rich past and glory of rajputana.It has been very well maintained also.We were coaxed into hiring a guide but he just rushed us through.Everything has been explained in the writings near each room,so one can easily understand the details.One should not miss this haveli.

title: Patwa ki haveli
review: It is one of the best dharohar of ancient time. The art work on stone is beyond imagine. The old articles have been place in systematically. The silver and gold work is beautiful. The traditional dress up are stored. The old articles like fridge,hot water chimani etc are good.

title: house of the then rich merchants
review: Patwon ki haveli is the house that was constructed by a once-rich merchant of Jaisalmer. He actually made 5 houses, in which one is kept open for tourists. The works on the houses are simply awesome. The furniture kept inside will give you an idea of how rich these people were once. There are many informative boards kept on the walls and reading them gives you more knowledge on their then life

title: Must visit in Jaisalmer
review: If you are in Jaisalmer, you should not miss this. Certainly more beautiful than the fort palace.

title: The best of the town
review: There are various haveli's in jaisalmer and this surely the biggest.Great architectural work and has a wonderful market.

title: Ancinet place Really Exciting
review: Visited Patwaon Ki Haveli. This place is very beautiful Palace. Here very beautiful art on stones. And here old jewellery museum. This place is most important place for visit. Good place to get a view of life style of rich people 100yr back. Woth visit to the place.

title: absolute delight to visit this haveli
review: exclusively carved and treat to visit. In fact if you have time, spend little more time. Not to forget, objected displayed inside were insight to desert life.

title: Nothing much to see
review: If you have already been to other forts or planning to visit them, then this place may not offer you much to explore and appreciate. Entry ticket of INR 100 per person of this small haveli is too high and not worth paying.

title: Good place
review: It's not a fort.. One big haveli is divided in to 5 parts. 2 of them is now open for public views.. One is kept unchanged. And the other is modernized.. Good place to see our old culture and tradition

title: Must visit in Jaisalmer even better than the fort
review: The place is great which shows different things used in different rooms in haveli. It is much better than the fort because it's much cleaner.

title: historical place
review: nice place to explore. if someone is very found of history. else its bit boring. overall nice time spended

title: Architectural beauty!
review: A cluster of 5 small havelis, it is an interesting piece of architecture built in an incredibly narrow lane. two out of five havelis are open for public and a visit inside gives an idea of their lavish lifestyles. Beautiful windows, intricate glass work, heavy textiles and what not.  There are souvenir shops inside and outside, but are usually a bit more expensive than the market area. Recommended place when in Jaisalmer.

title: The archeteture is so amazing
review: Its really so surprising to see cutting and modution of stones in patwo ki haveli

title: Very nice
review: Should visit this haveli.

title: Just time pass.
review: As normal,

title: Beautiful buildings
review: Built by the Bafnas over 300 yrs old...Five Havellis (Big Buildings) are there...After 1970s they left the place and was taken over by Govt. One building has been privatized but other remain with the Govt..The Private Havelli visit charge is Rs. 100 per person while that of Govt is Rs. 50 per person...We visited the one of the Govt....Beautiful and well designed 5 Storey building....Beautifully hand sculpted... The security person showed us the entire building along with the wonderful story of the Bafnas who were Patwaons - people who used to work on clothes using gold and the purposes of the rooms..There are many rooms with secret chambers for storage of Gold...Still a room holds ceiling of Gold work with ivory and looks as if newly made...Worth visiting....But Thousands of Bats were there in the roof, they do not do anything in the morning and is safe unless loud sounds are made.

title: Haweli
review: This place is a complete art must visit in Jaisalmer there is an entry fee of 50 rs here and you can have tour guide to explain you the history of the place.

title: A unique heritage experience
review: Patwaon ki Haveli is a palace of one of the 4 important person from Jaisalmer darbar (court). Haveli means Palace in english. This haveli is build using interlocks and sandstone.

title: Expensive for 30-45 minutes time
review: Great historical artifacts and preservation of life style in that time. 250rs is a bit pricey for the size of the place

title: Good only from outside
review: It's better to see this spot only from outside. In the main haveli, ticket is ₹50 for Indians. There are only empty rooms. Where as few rooms ( in same buikding) converted into private museum who charges double - ₹100. Felt like cheating here. Hence did not go in based on advise of those who just came out of the museum. Wondering how the things from rooms under govt possessed rooms go into private museum.

title: Better craftsmanship than the Jaisalmer fort but not as good as Jain temples
review: These are five Haveli out of which people stay in two, one is close, one is under government and open for tourist, and another one is a private property but converted to museum and is open to museum. Only the one under private control is worth visiting as the one under government control do not have much craftsmanship as well as ill maintained.

title: WASTE OF MONEY AND TIME
review: This place is absolute waste of money and time. You will find 1000+ such properties in Jaisalmer. Morever, half of the antiques have been replaced with dummies or new age items. nothing so significant to spend time here.

title: beautiful havelis
review: superb haveli buildings  with intricate carving and beautiful architecture. A must visit place in jaisalmer.

title: Over-rated
review: It is worth a visit if you want to explore everything that Jaisalmer has to offer or if you are a history buff like me, but honestly, you can easily give this place a miss.

title: Architectural delight
review: Golden stone ; gorgeous architecture ; incredible carving ; definitely worth a visit in the most beautiful town of Jaisalmer.

title: Old Rajasthani house
review: Nothing special, but it is a wonderfully carved house with a basic museum of household articles, half an hour can be well spent.

title: Kothari's Patwa-Ki-Haveli
review: Just a few minutes walk from the fort, highly recommended visit to a beautiful haveli, filled with exquisite mirror work inside and intricate carvings on the facade.

title: Not so great
review: Disappointed with the maintenance and the approach to this place. Not so great as compared to Jaisalmer Fort and lot of pigeons making the place dirty and not clean

title: Rajasthan trip
review: I love Patwo ki haweli most, Beautiful architecture and history of merchants. There living style, must hire a guide to know everything and made your trip attractive n informative.

title: Very Informative place
review: Its must visit to know the history of the people over there....5 storey building... out of which   2 floor belongs to government  and 2  floors is for private use..

title: Indulgence of the past
review: Patwaon ki Haweli is one of the first havelis comprising of 5 intricately carved houses of one of the rich Gujrati (Bafna is what my guide told us ) family who were silk route traders but mainly money lenders for the king and kingsmen - only 2 of the 5 is available for public viewing - one with entry fee of 50 rs per head and another with rs 100 per head ( expensive I must say !) - though not unique from other museums it was a sneak peak of the rich indulgence of this family in terms of modern day goods available even during that era - the display of opulent silver furniture , leisures of chess , musical instruments, gramophone , kitchen accessories like noodle machine , kerosene based fridge , ice boxes ; modern toys , toilet , iron , sewing machine, gold hand carved dresser etc - I don't know how much of these of display is a true version of their lifestyle but if it is true - it will definitely make one envious :) ! Should be part of your itinerary as even the walkway to the haveli will give a glimpse of local street and shops selling trinkets , jooties, textile garments , puppets - this place will make you happy if not awed !

title: Remnants of the rich trade in thepast
