review: Patwaon Ki Haveli is a five storied building, very well maintained  displaying all the old utensils and equipment in a nice fashion. The building and its interiors are itself a worth to see. Kerosene operated refrigerator and pedestal fan was something worth mentioning. A lot of antiques are displayed nicely and is a pleasure to see.. We had a guide along and according to him this haveli was owned by some Gujarati trader who was immensely rich through his trade in the Silk route.There is an entry fee but its worth paying that.

title: Average place
review: We were in Jaisalmer at night searching a nice place to eat. We passed by this place but we didn't knew its a tourist location but we liked it. Next morning when we searched for tourist spot and reached this haveli, it was heavily crowded. Overall its an average, its not a tourist destination as such, as it is surrounded by houses. It has a historic resemblance though.

title: Nice mixture of Art and Culture at this Haveli
review: This haveli has a entry ticket and that's around 200 INR per head. Inside, it is a museum  with 3-4 stores. From the terrace, you get the full view of the Golden Fort and it's worth climbing the stairs :-)

title: Beautifully carved haveli complex
review: Visit this place at leisure. One can see the beautifully carved havelis, 3 of which are said to be bought by Indira Gandhi. You also get nice souvenirs, like cushion covers, bed covers, sarees, stoles etc., at this place at a very reasonable rate as compared to anywhere else in Rajasthan. You also get beautiful brasso fabric here.

title: Amazing Carvings
review: The complex is just amazing with all the inticate carvings on the stone.  The structures are magnificent.  The structures of the havelis are all to admired from the outside unless you are visiting the Palace which is well worth it.  But the Havelis that are privately owned are well maintianed on th outside, the tour guides will tell you to see how people live inside an ancient building but once inside its nothing more than a gift shop, which the guide will get a commission if you purchase something.

title: Nice example of Herritage
review: It has entry ticket. It has 3 to 4 floors. Museum is very good and takes us in past. View from terrace is awesome. U can have wonderful photographs from there. No needto take guide if u have some knowledge of history

title: Good to see the art, but not great
review: Haveli is divided into multiple properties and entry tickets were expensive. One can enjoy it from outside as well. Roads towards the haveli is narrow and there is not enough parking space. One can visit it with spare time, but not a must visit place.

title: Architectural marvel!
review: The haveli complex is intricately carved.It's a must visit place in jaisalmer!

title: Must see while on a city tour of Jaisalmer
review: This is part of a must while on a city tour of Jaisalmer. Hire a guide for half a day city tour of the city and this would be part of the places you would visit. It's a beautiful and well kept haveli !

title: Deserve a visit!!
review: Very well managed and maintained historic Haweli. Worth visiting th place. I would suggest to hire a guide.

title: Go for the Architecture and History
review: Chose this one only if you have short time and you may skip Salim Singh and Natwar ki haweli. Please take a guided tour which makes it all interesting.

title: Worth the money and time
review: It was the best haveli that we visited. Inside it has many interesting rooms and exhibition. All very well decorated and furnished. It has two floors and you can visit also roof to se the view of the fort and the city... (250rs entrance for foreigner)

title: Marvellous
review: This place is huge and marvellous.Its rare to see such a work nowadays, the carving, the planning, way of design and architecture. While exploring you will realise how their lifestyle was and how they travelled through those mini passages.

title: Decent Place
review: The haveli has nice carving. There are two sections one gov and another one private. We were told that gov one is plain and doesn't have anything inside so we decided to go in the private one. The fee for gov is Rs 50 while private was Rs. 100.

title: Craftsmanship at its best
review: This place was our 2nd stop after Jaisalmer fort. The haveli (mini palace) is relatively new and was built by a rocking ch family who then migrated for their profession. The government of India took this place under its wings under the heritage program.

title: Old and authentic Rajasthan experience
review: Another highlight of Jaisalmer. Nice building, old, authentic. Need a bit of physical to the rooftop. The view from the top is amazing.

title: Excellent architectural beauty
review: An excellent example of architectural beauty with carvings as fine as done in jewellery

title: Perfect spot for photography
review: It's a perfect spot for photography and buying beautiful cotton garments and camel leather's products.

title: Nice to see
review: One of the biggest and nicest Haveli in the jaisalmer city,,,,, it's good to visit to get some authentic and ethnic monument with great infrastructure

title: Incredible Artistry
review: The place is must visit as it expains the living culture of the ancient times. there were 5 havelis but only1 is open for the tourists. The other 2 havelis are owned by government and remianing 2 are with the descendants of Patwas. The whole architecture within the haveli is worth visit and the cost is very nominal. In addition to this, you can have a view of jaisalmer fort.

title: Amazing Haveli
review: Patwa on ki haveli is a landmark of Rajasthani architect. Stone carving of haveli is unmatched. One must visit these haveli's in jaisalmer.

title: Nice
review: Very old building a good car winning looking so nice I like it very beautiful building I never scene in the my life so I like it

title: A gem
review: Amazing place, a well preserved architectural wonder, Clean place and but tickets are very high. That is the only point I didn't liked

title: Patwaon ki Haveli, Jaisalmer
review: In fact it is not one but five Havelis. We visited the first haveli as some memorials of the Patwas were kept. The richness of these business class Patwas can be seen in the Haveli

title: Good
review: This photo how are you was really great I really like this old house outside so beautiful thank you so much

title: excellently built residential haveli of  olden days.
review: these are residential havelis biult with golden stone by olden days business community patwas who were dealing with clothes/printings using natural colours,stone articles etc

title: Nice
review: Good place to visit. And food also very nice. We ate breakfast and lunch here. It was very nice and also worth for it. Thank you

title: Beautiful work Smelly Route
review: The work is excellent though we were overcome by the open drain and the cow dung smells. We could not stay for more than a couple minutes. It is not worth the visit unless you are bored. You would be better served just driving out to the dunes and enjoying nature. All the shops sell is stuff from Jaipur film except for the sandstone stuff.

title: Beautiful culturally rich haveli.
review: Beautiful culturally rich haveli. We got a wonderful guide who explained us each room in detail. We were highly impressed. It is a must visit for all those visiting Jaisalmer.

title: Worth going
review: its worth seeing .Good and different tourist spot..it depicts what used be in olden days.quite picturesque...

title: Beautifully Crafted!!
review: Amazing Architecture. It's a Haveli built by the Patwaons of Jaisalmer. He built same havelis for his sons. Inside the haveli you get to see various household equipments, traditional clothes, utensils and everything that was being used by the Patwaons family.

title: Architectural and Art Delight
review: A unfamiliar name but a place with loads of fame. It is a treat to visit this place and to understand the culture and life of Jaisalmer. Interactions with locals on the pathway leading here, the small shops selling delightful souvenirs and goods, the traditional eateries etc add to the flavour of this must visit locale

title: An architectural marvel-Jaisalmer's best haveli!
review: This haveli is simply stunning! It is one of Jaisalmer's largest and best haveli's. Lying on one of the narrow lanes in Jaisalmer this Haveli is 5 storeys high and extensively carved. One could spend hours here!

title: Golden city
review: Wat a architect masterpiece..if u are in Jaisalmer u can't miss that place.. it will remind u dat once India was a golden bird..the one and only live haveli in Jaisalmer .the new generation of patwaon are still living in dat haveli ..

title: Patwaon-ki-haveli
review: I last visited this place in 2012 with my friends. My visit in August 2016 at Patwaon Ki Haveli was limited. The architectural view of this haveli is breath taking and has a flavour of its own history and reason of existing. to know the story make sure you visit here. I am sure you will love it and be in a

title: Nice
review: Very old Haveli and nice decorated​ design.

title: Walking Haveli with beautiful architecture
review: Me and my friend just walked through the Haveli. We didn't end up taking a tour but it was beautiful and worth at least passing by.

title: NICEEEE ARCHITECTURE!
review: For you who likes photography, you must love this place. This place has an amazing architecture and awesome atmosphere of Rajasthani culture. In front of it there are people playing Rajasthani music instrument. So perfect

title: Heart of Jaisalmer
review: We have visited this patwaon ki haveli as well and i feel this place is heart of the jaisalmer many people visit everyday this place and enjoy the royalty of jaisalmer and i have also recommend many of my friends.

title: Best haveli
review: Patwa haveli too good haveli in jaisalmer.

title: Old gem of Jaisalmer
review: Visited this place with husband around 11am and found it really enchanting. The craftsmanship is of a very high order but administrators are not keeping it in good shape. Went right upto the top and saw lovely skyline. Ticket costs only Rs.50/- per head.

title: Must see
review: Built by a rich Rajasthan family , these 5 houses were built for his 5 persons. Now owned by various people it's a nice visit place.

title: Beautiful home
review: Intricately designed rooms, with long corridors and walls covered with exquisite artwork- the haveli is a palette of the local art and culture. It was built by a rich local trader by the name Guman Chand and his sons. It is right in the middle of the city.

title: Haweli
review: A patawa hawali is most wonderful place it's stone art make in 12th century or a art of gold rooftop ...........

title: It is a Bat Haveli
review: The haweli has very good architecture although the rooms are full of bats. Be careful while photographing them or the flash might cause them to attack you finally turning you into a vampire.

title: The architecture stands out
review: A must visit if you are in Jaisalmer. Just take a auto at hanuman chowk and complete the circuit including Nath Mal Ki haveli. Do take a guide, it just helps you appreciate the place better and gives you a better insight into the effort that's gone into making this

title: richness haveli
review: We visited both havelis private and goverment. Furniture and other traditional decor will amaze you. you can also see their kitchen cloths and instruments.

title: One of a kind  haveli
review: Never Ever Seen Anything More Beautiful In My Entire Life. Seriously this one line sums up my whole thinking about this entire Haveli.

title: Beautiful is the word
review: The haveli is beautiful built. One must visit the place to admire the architecture of this place. It's walking distance from the jaisalmer Fort.

title: A art of stone
review: A art of stone is so beautiful and the environment is so beautiful when sunrise. Awesome place for travel with family and friends or couple. The haweli best place for photoshoot. If you once come at Jaisalmer its place awesome traveling.

title: Nicely Architectured
review: Very Beautifully carved structure called haveli. If you are art lover you will definitely like this place. Entry fees of Rs. 100.00 is little bit disappointing you. Very popular visiting place in Jaisalmer. Take a guide for better feel and understanding. Look of Jaisalmer City from the terrace is awesome. One visit of this place is reasonable.

title: Historical Place to Visit !
review: If your interested in history and wanted to know how people were living, what things were using in day to day life you will get idea about here. Very good crafted buildings. Good history to know. You need couple of hours to visit this place. On top of royal home you get beautiful view.

title: Haveli - Architecture
review: Its an old haveli with good architecture. Its located in a narrow lane and can be seen from outside. To go inside you have to buy tickets. But doesn't seem to be worth it. Its ok type only.

title: Famous Havelis of PATWAS
review: Rajasthan in general and Jaisalmer in particular are world famous for its beautiful Havelis with their intricate carving on stones.Patwon ki Haveli is the 1st name as and when we think of Havelis of Rajasthan.

title: Best part of jaisalmer
review: My best part of my trip of jaisalmer wow great looking patwa haveli what a work in stone , if are you visit jaisalmer must visit Patwa haveli

title: One of the best thing in Jaisalmer
review: Mind blowing hand carving on stone. Heritage building,mainly showcased the  living style of Patwa's. Architecture of the building is awesome.But not secured well other Haveli's are becoming ruins.

title: Beautiful Heritage Architecture of Rajasthsn
review: Patwon Ji ki Haveli is an interesting piece of Architecture and is the most important among the havelis in Jaisalmer. This name has been given probably because the family dealt in threads of gold and silver used in embroidering dresses.

title: Excellent
review: I loved this place! Not only was the building beautiful but they have set up the rooms as they would have been when lived in which was interesting to see. A must see in Jaisalmer

title: Best carving
review: If u see the carving of the each and every haveli  they all r very unique. Lot of cows and cow dong  was there but enjoyed photography there.

title: Can give a miss!
review: Nothing extraordinary about this - best seen from outside (if at all !) Much better visited Raja mahal

title: A Haveli worth visiting
review: Although the entrance is a bit shabby, it is mesmerising once you step inside. Painted ceilings and walls, antique furniture, and household items take your breath away

title: A poorly maintained Haveli
review: The place is no doubt an architecture marvel but it's flooded with bats. It's quite horrific to stand inside even for 5 minutes. The bats are everywhere and makes it difficult to explore the entire palace.

title: Patwaon ki Haveli
review: Visit to Jaisalmer would be incomplete if you do not visit few Haweli's in the city.

title: Beautifully crafted buildings
review: Patwaon ki haveli is a set of 4-5 havelis out of which only 1st one is really worth seeing from inside. Guide took about 100 per person and took us through various rooms telling stories about everything there. Overall a good place to visit in Jaisalmer

title: Beautiful
review: Beautiful architechture.... But there is no relevant history attached to it... No need to hire a guide... If you are really interested in history only helpful to get your pictures clicked!

title: Patwon ki haveli
review: Patwon ki haveli is another famous havwli of jaisalamer..this havali actualy famous because some story about this ...but beautifull and good for visit once

title: Hidden Gem in Golden City
review: It was so amazing to visit this famous haveli in Jaisalmer. The architecture of haveli was so wonderful. Recommended for all travelers to visit this palace.

title: Another nice monument.. with no maintenance...
review: very Nice construction.. but the look is spoiled by running electricity wires in the view.. people, cows, shops around.. does not make it feel like a heritage place...

title: only 1 was shown
review: Of the 5 havelis only 1 haveli was open for public view that disheartened me.

title: Nothing Special.
review: Yet another haveli in Jaisalmer, except for its age. Nothing great to see. The only attraction is the architecture of the building.

title: A royal home
review: This place is filled with artifacts and items used by the rich families in olden times. If you like to know how these families lived, do visit this place or else it can be dropped.

title: Piece of history crying out for care
review: This is an amazing architectural and historical monument that needs serious care.  Highly recommend visiting

title: Beautiful havelies
review: Fasanating five havelies inside it. Reasonable ticket price to see havelies but have to pay individually for all havelies. Small market also inside. Jharokhas are carved beautifully & u can city view from there. It's pride of Jaiselmer.

title: Haveli in Jaisalmer
review: Patwaon ki Haveli is located near the golden fort of Jaisalmer. The place is worth visiting once. The visitors get to see one of the five havelies located side by side.

title: Trip to jaisalmer
review: This is really most attractive palace of jaisalmer. Out decor of haveli was amazing. But need to care from inside.

title: A jewelery
review: A glimpse in the life of rich Indian family. Beautiful carvings, sculptures, glass, exhibit of objects. A small museum.

title: Must visit
review: The haveli so beautiful made its beauty are eye catching. It had part one is private another is private made we enjoyed public.

title: Mystic havelis
review: A must visit site for all. Though a little congested place in narrow lanes of old jaisalmer market, but the intricacies of the work on yellow sand stone was worth watching.

title: Nice to be in the afternoons
review: Since this is entirely a a shahi haveli ( a royal house) to watch, i would suggest to go in the afternoon. Time spent is approx 1 hr. Its good to see the beautiful house but it can also be a skip if you are short of time. The location is quite complicated to reach so need google maps on to walk here. The view from the terrace is average. Guide not required unless you are bored to read the placards displayed.

title: Royal Haveli
review: A very beautiful Haveli it is. Has a museum in it which has entrance fee. This Haveli has various buildings and so many rooms. It is always crowded with so many tourists. There are shops in it with beautiful handicrafts. The view from terrace of this haveli is fantastic.

title: Beautifully made
review: The Haveli so beautifully made ! It was really appealing to the eyes. A very good part of the trip..

title: Fort reloaded
review: Second fort in Jaisalmer. this one strangely has two sections  - a private museum and a government one. The private one is at the entrance and majority go inside this. They have a musuem and some shopping centers. Overall can be safely skipped if you running short of time.

title: Patwon ki Haveli by walk
review: After Jaisalmer Fort, follow narrow lanes to get to this beautiful architect and carvings. Beautiful will amaze you instantly.

title: Intresting place...
review: There are two versions open to public. One is the government owned havelis and the other one privately held havelis. I have seen both and would recommend that you go to the privately held. Many unique devices like Refrigerator which works on kerosene and electricity are kept here.

title: old Plane need maintainence
review: Whole Jaisalmer was filled with this kind of buildings. It was having nice architecture and my kids loved to see all these buildings. Nice experience

title: Must Visit
review: There is a 5 havelis complex with each haveli built in 15 years. Each room the house temple, the baithak, the kitchen, the dining area, play area, dressing room has been tastefully developed reflecting the intricate art skills of rajasthani culture

title: beautiful haveli
review: beautiful structure, shows how royalty an opulence was displayed in the olden days. nice carvings on the windows and walls.

title: beautiful architecture
review: Its more beautiful from the outside compared to inner decor. The furniture & other stuff kept inside is fascinating.

title: awesome
review: This is a set of 05 hawelis, under different ownerships. One of them is fully open to public and is well maintained. These are magic in stone such an intricate carving. you wonder and salute the skills of the artisans who built these.

title: Again an art of history!!!
review: Patwon ki haveli consisting four buildings out of which only one is available for visitors and maintained by govt. The whole monument consist of a full royal housing facilities along with old way of living life!!!! The kitchens, bedrooms are well maintained with old furniture and  dressings.... A long lost way to visit history of royal people

title: definitely  recommended
review: j definitely  recommended  patwo haveli,

title: Jharokha
review: Fantastic architecture.....beautiful exterior work....great building with great history...one of the best haveli in Jaisalmer.

title: Unique amongst all the others
review: October 2016 : A cluster of 5 Havelis which look like one. However, all have different limestone carvings on them and differ from each other. The mirror work is to watch out for.

title: Marvelous
review: This haveli speaks about the artistic nature & visualisation of our ancestors. The carvings on the wall, the design of the building looks splendid.

title: Very beautiful buildings
review: Buildings are way to much beautiful even houses in this area are too beautiful. ticket charges are bit high are but worth visitig

title: Heritage haveli and good guide
review: This is a chain of 5 havelis constructed by erstwhile Oswal family trading in spices to opium across the border. Being financiers for many a royal families, including the King of Jaisalmer, the merchants were granted this area to construct a haveli and then add 4 more, one for each son. Only one of the five has undergone restoration and can be visited from inside to view the lifestyle of the merchant family in the times when they enjoyed the patronage of the royal families.

title: Patwaon ki haveli
review: This the only open haveli for the visitors.The havelly is basically a presentation on the then life stile of Queens,Kitchen,dressing,clothing etc.Its a must watch for the artisans and the collections.

title: Amazing feat of architecture and art!
review: This beautiful building really takes your breath away. An elaborate carving of the facade is really amazing. You can sit down and spend some time enjoying this view.

title: must see place in jaisalmer
review: Must see place in Jaisalmer, but don't forget to hire the guide. Otherwise you will miss many things.

title: Overwhelmingly beautiful
review: One of the most beautiful monuments of our India trip: very finely carved stone with rich decorations... A must!

title: Nice havelis to see when you are visiting Jaisalmer
review: My wife and I visited Jaisalmer in February 2017. As we did not have much time, we viewed the havelis (a series of 4-5 buildings) from outside. The exteriors of these havelis present a nice view. I am not sure how they look from inside though. Rajasthani dolls and jewelry are sold just outside these havelis by street vendors and once should at least have a look at them.

title: Small , Offbeat but most authentic collection of Kingdon's accessories..
review: Its in the small bylanes of city and outside main fort ... but it offers view of actual Kingdom's accessories like clothes, utentials, jewellery, furniture etc... Small 3 stoy pld havelli  ... can take around max. 1 hour  but worth visiting if have time...

title: Intriguing architecture not seen elsewhere
review: These are five palatial erstwhile residences of an old time trader family.

title: big haveli
review: it is the best of havelis available to view in jaisalmer. other havelis can be skipped to see the architecture of this haveli

title: Nice Haveli to visit
review: Its a composite of 5-7 hawelies, of which only 2 are open for public, for 1 there is a ticket of Rs 100/ and another one is free of cost.

title: A cultural heritage
review: The building might not impress much from outside which would deter one from going inside, but every penny spent for an inside tour is worth it. This is truly Rajasthani in style with its core traditions intact and very well preserved.

title: Was not fascinating, entry charges too high
review: It is good to visit and see the Haveli, it is not as old but probably 150 yrs or more. The funny part was the cradle which was used during British era by the Diwans which is kept in the museum. Do not take a "guide", it is waste of money. The entry charge for 100/- per adult is way too expensive for this Haveli. Would not suggest shopping in this area as it's too expensive than other places. Would suggest people to shop near Gadisar Lake or Fort instead.

title: Glimpse into the times gone by
review: Loved the Haveli and all the related stories and tid bits about the place and its inhabitants. A very short trip will take you to another era. Some of the paintings etc were newer but still had a charm of its own. Its a place worth visiting. Its was a good idea to take a guide along as well especially so that he could take the perfect pictures in the doorway and ornate window frames.

title: Highly decorative buildings
review: The capability of someone designing and carving these Haveli's is quite astonishing, you really shouldn't miss them.

title: in terrible condition
review: Aprt from the good carvings on the walls and ceilings, you could get the scary looks of the BATS in the haveli. stinks badly. govt is chrging 50/- per person for no good.

title: Good haweli
review: Good haweli but nothing much to see here. unless you have time in hand and nothing else to do, visit this place. NO guide is required.

title: Great
review: Good one. Totally recommendable doing it, It shall maybe be cleaner but Indian in general aint clean at all so...These buildings on the inside are just perfect.

title: patwo ki hawali
review: this is an art place which is quite beautiful it is an heritage place. there are quite lot of havelies there .

title: Good place to visit
review: Its one of the tourist attraction in Jaisalmer. It is a cluster of five small havelis. It was built by wealthy trader in Jaisalmer. From outside it has very beautiful carvings and from inside its an museum where you can find various items used by them before 100 years.

title: Patwaon-Ki-Haveli - Richness at Extreme High Level
review: Must visit place in jaisalmer or you can say in rajasthan. The lifestyle of patwaons was lavish. Excellent piece of stone carving.

title: Amazing place !! Must visit in Jaisalmer...
review: Patwon ki haveli - the stone carving at its best, no words to explain. One has to see and experience it. Remarkable work and wonderful architectural master piece. Intricate mirror work, murals, paintings just out of this world feeling !!! Highly recommended....... not to miss.

title: Must visit atleast once if you are in Jaisalmer
review: Old haveli with a lot of detailed and intricate carving on golden stone. If you are interested to know about ancient architecture and old palaces, forts excite you, then do visit this place. We liked it.

title: Good
review: What's really nice beautiful would explain are you this place happy life thank you so much enjoy life

title: Art of Rajasthan
review: In old time Marwadi business men stayed there for some time because this route was called silk route up to Afghanistan so they travel to do business there.now this haveli has some small shops inside which run by patawon ke family members.finally this haveli has a fine art work in local stone.but you have to need a proper guide to understand the haveli.

title: Limited heritaje protected in time
review: This place is located in the city. You will have to leave your cabs behind and take a rickshaw at Rs 10 a seat to the Haveli. A guide for this place will cost about Rs50 for 30minutes. The Haveli has entry fee of Rs100 per person for Indians. There are 5 haveli next to each other. It has been a background for shooting of advertisment such as Siayaram-featuring Saif Ali Khan and Supaari ad featuring Ajay Devgan. The Haveli has beautifully crafted roofs and antiques are well maintained. This place has narrow and very steep stairs, so please evaluate before entering.

title: Royal Life
review: Really Gud and Interesting Location. I Really fell Rajasthani Culture . It Too gud Place. We are Enjoyed.

title: Nice Place to Visit
review: It was a very beautiful place but it will be helpful if their is a guide with you so you can learn the history. You should visit this haweli if yu go to jaisalmer.

title: If u have time, visit
review: It's not a must see .. if u have time and are a history buff go there . Place is small and sort of crowded .

title: Amazing architecture
review: These havelis has amazing carving work and architeture work which was done so many years back. Its worth visit place in jaisalmer.

title: royal feels
review: Just watching this haveli is alluring and the whole way its built is mezmerizing. amazing and magical place

title: Simply the best Haveli in Jaisalmer
review: Auto rickshaw is the only vehicle to reach this haveli as the nearby alleys are too much congested. Try to spend here at least one hour. The best time to visit this area after 12 noon for better photography

title: Worth visiting
review: In a narrow lane there are a group of amazingly designed houses which belonged to wealthy merchants. There isn't much else to them honestly. There are 5 such houses in a row, belonging to 5 brothers. The first one has been converted into a private tourist trap (Rs.100 per person), the second and third are closed or being renovated. The 4th converted into a shop and the 5th one is a government run tourist trap (Rs.50 per person).

title: Such intricacy!
review: The detailed stone carvings all over the haweli makes this place worth at least one visit! Museum is beautiful if you're the museum kind of person.

title: Beautiful Haveli Indeed
review: Dis place gave us real flavour of royal families in Rajasthan.

title: Awesome place
review: Patwaon ki haveli, the best and worth visiting architecture of Jaisalmer. Build for 5 brothers who were well known for there work.

title: Patwaon ki havelli
review: This Havelli is no less than a mighty kings fort with all amenities of those yesteryears.. very colourful and what a lavish lifestyles were being maintained by Rajas patwa's

title: Really nice
review: Very interesting place. Its fascinating to see the things the trader had at that time. Very different architecture. Bit similar to the pol houses in old ahmedabad.

title: Good place
review: Nice place to visit very well maintained . good place we enjoyed a lot with my familiy . recommended to others

title: Treasure tucked inside the narrow lanes of Jaisalmer!
review: Exquisite stone carvings, richly decorated interiors and well-preserved haveli mark this monument from others.

title: Rajasthan tour with Taj Mahal
review: The Haveli was extremely beautiful! Our guide was very well informed. We had a great experience. The architecture and carvings on the Haveli are exquisit and the inside of the Haveli is very well maintained and the history is extremely preserved. We will reccommend this to any tourist viisting Jaisalmer!

title: Woulderful Haveli
review: One should come Jaisalmer to only see this place. Wonderful design and motifs all around inside and outside of the Haveli.

title: wonderful but too crowded
review: the palace itself is really wonderful but its a pity that there is just so many people there - the amount of the tourist is really annoying there

title: Good Architecture but unmaintained surroundings
review: These are very beautiful buildings built 100s of years ago. But the inside and surroundings are not at all maintained. That's the case with all places in Jaisalmer. Out of the 5 Havelis (buildings) you can actually enter and look around only 1, the rest are either business outlets or closed. You need not even spend on the guide because what he tells you is already marked next to the display items. Great from outside but nothing much inside unless you really like looking at very old stuff used by residents of that place

title: beautiful historic place
review: this is a beautiful historic place near the fort in jaisalmer. one of the must see attractions. hiring a guide may help little more to understand the history here.

title: Breath taking facades
review: These Haveli's were built by rich 18th century merchants displaying their wealth in the richly ornate stone carving details to the doors, windows and balconies.

title: Patwaon-Ki-Haveli - Must see
review: While you are in Jaisalmer, must visit Patwaon-Ki-Haveli. But please take guide otherwise one can't understand the history. guide is available @100 which is really cheap because guide is really good. But don't go by their words to buy some stone materials from a shop, who is charging very high. But the guy who is sitting just outside the heveli is a good bet if you are interested to but stone materials.

title: Not Enough Bang for the Buck
review: This collection of five homes is perhaps best viewed from the street. Although the admission charge is only 400INR, you get a very quick tour through five or six rooms to look at a collection of locks, pots and pans and so forth. The guide is eager to talk about Jaisalmer embroidery and get you to the gift store on the first floor. Put this at the bottom of your "must see" list.

title: Fine architecture
review: Don't drive here take an auto as the lanes are very narrow. The moment you get there guides will come after you no need to take one as the beauty lies outside inside just a normal museum.

title: A travel to the history
review: See and be transported to the past to feel the luxurious lifestyle of the business tycoons. I have gone there twice and still I wanted to come back again to capture more of it through my lens.

title: Beautiful, Ancient Heritage Place and a Must Visit Touristic place in Jaisalmer!
review: It's a certain Must See attraction in Jaisalmer. Depicts the ancient Heritage. Display of erstwhile Patwa's living. Also hosts a Museum and houses Temple and shops. Place of business in those times , as well as now with shops selling Rajasthani items, arts and artefacts.

title: Just the exteriors
review: You can only see the exteriors there. Interiors are all changed and have people living inside, The history is good but it's too crowed.

title: Visit only if you are interested in going to a museum
review: The haveli is good and huge, but not maintained very well. The artifacts look worn out. With the kind of entry fee that they charge they should be able to maintain the haveli in much better way.

title: Awesome
review: The intricate zafri work every where in the haveli is mind-blowing. All are made of golden sand stone. It's a must see place in Jaisalmer

title: Located in the center of the city with a nice view of the fort
review: Located in the center of the city with a nice view of the fort

title: Treasure well maintained
review: Very much architectural work, intereting history behind and well maintained, collection of antiques, furnitures  and fixtures.

title: Amazing work of art
review: The exterior of the Haveli is stunning.We were short on time so didn't go inside. Its a must see and doesn't take too long to reach its in the centre of the city walking distance from the Jaisalmer Fort.

title: Must visit in Jaisalmer
review: Good place to visit, traditional Haweli with large collection of arts and artefacts. Good area for shopping.

title: Better than the fort
review: This is a huge haveli and well maintained. One can easily spend hours here. I found this to be more interesting than the fort.

title: Really intricate!
review: The havelis are in a narrow lane but when you look up, they are breath taking beautiful. Very intricate carvings n jaali work. And so well preserved!

title: Not to be missed attraction while in Jaisalmer
review: Walking distance from the narrow streets of city center and the fort you will find your way to this place which hosts set of five Havelis in a row all built with local yellow stone from jaisalmer. Beautiful architecture from inside and outside, Yellow stone carving on these buildings in a row is just mesmerizing. Situated within the fort one can experience the luxury during the old days and admire the beauty. Standing tall in very narrow lanes within the fort each one needs an entry ticket to visit inside however only the first one is good enough to have a look internally. One should not miss to make a visit while in Jaisalmer. Guides will offer their service but you may choose not to. Remember to shop outside with a bargain.

title: Amazing architecture
review: The balcony and windows strike you as you look at the intricate window screens from below.

title: Exquisite Havelis of Rich Merchants of Jaisalmer
review: Built over a period of a century , by the rich trading merchants of jaisalmer , these are an arcitectural marvels from the 18th century , built by the rich merchants after whose clan it is named - patwo , they have some of the best detailing stone and inlay work on the doors along with exqusitely carved jharokas .ie, balconies. The interiors showcase plenty of memorabilia from an era ago.  A visit her is a throwback to the 18th century lifestyle this rich merchants must have lead and the opulence which was only reserved for the then kings.

title: The Heritage Charm of Jaisalmer
review: Patwon-ki-Haveli is situated in a narrow lane near the Patwa Complex..This Haveli is a cluster of five havelis.There is an office of the Arcaeological Survey of india and state of art & craft  department inside the Haveli.

title: Classical history!
review: First place that I have visited which showcases the history of a business community. The buildings are so rich in architecture and design it takes the breath away. The richness of the inmates through the last century is mind boggling. A must visit at jaisalmer.

title: Fine piece of architecture
review: A rare and fine piece of architecture that is still preserved and shares the living status of those who used to rule the kingdom during those days.

title: A good haveli in the heart of the city.
review: Yake a guide(would not cost you more than 50 bucks) and he woupd explain everything in the haveli with quite detail. It is a good haveli with good photo spots. Outside the girls can get dressed in Rajasthani traiditional dresses and get clicks in the haveli, that would be a memory for a lifetime.

title: Intricate work on sandstone,
review: Its a must visit place. Rs100 is the entry fee. You can take a guide or may opt out. A lot of climbing of stairs is required.

title: traditional haveli
review: Well initially we were reluctant to go but once we visited there you were surprised to see fan and fridge of ancient period which were running on carosin...apart from haveli we really enjoyed  photoshoot outside in traditional dresses. good shopping in haveli itself

title: Beautiful carvings in front
review: There are 5 haveli. Minute stone carved front with interesting stories about the original owner. It is the best example of the traditional ancient Rajasthani workers.

title: The grandeur of Jaisalmer
review: Stunning stone carvings skills of the artisans on view here and the other haveli, and in Mandir Palace. The intricate workmanship, the beauty of the designs and the aesthetic sensibility of days gone by are on show here. Do not miss.

title: Beautiful haveli within the city
review: The city of havelis, they are everywhere with their intricate designs and interesting balconies. A testimony to the taste that the inhabitants had.

title: Architecture mrval
review: Unbelievable sand stone carved havelis. Beautiful stone work. Must see when in Jaisalmer. Surrounded by localities shop keepers. Be careful of the guides, may misguide.

title: good for photography
review: Its good to click photographs with old walls and doors , it has good market . people are sitting and selling things all over at good price .

title: Ok ok
review: Patwaon ki haweli is a ok ok place. Nothing great about it. It is very congested inside. I don't know how pleople stayed there

title: Good architecture
review: The buildings look very nice and has a lot of intricate sculpture work which is eye catching , especially the exteriors of the building . You can understand a lot about the history of the Haveli , if you engage a local guide for both Jaisalmer fort and Haveli. You can also see some good painting inside the Haveli

title: Grand residence.
review: Situated a little away from the fort within walking distance this haveli is an architectural delight for all.

title: Quite nice to see but a bit overpriced
review: Half the price of the Taj Mahal but just a small museum. Was a nice view but the people were a bit pushy and a little too expensive for the experience

title: Paradise of Old Kings!
review: Its simply beautiful! Carved inside the city center. Each and every monument in haveli is well preserved. You can see the famous Old makeup boxes, Utensils, Chess Board and many more...Enjoyed it!

title: place to visit
review: every thing was good no words to describe, just go and visit jaisalmer, don't forget to take camera with you.

title: must visit.
review: very very beautiful . must visit. we all enjoyed it a lot. good to know so much there.  did some shopping also there. overyall enjoyed.

title: Average experience!
review: If you've seen Mehrangar fort in Jodhpur, then you will just be disappointed with this Haveli! Very crowded and not well maintained. The shopkeepers on the ground floor were simply irritating in their persistence!

title: Must must visit!!
review: I cannot stress more that you must see the museum haveli (there are 5 in all but see the museum one). Its beautiful and great for photography. There are shops inside the havelis but quite expensive. Entry is Rs 100 per person. Essentially, the Havelis belonged to the Patwas who dont live there anymore but its good to see their rich lifestyle.

title: Best
review: small museum. Was a nice view but the people were a bit pushy and a little too expensive for the experience

title: royal era of luxury
review: beautiful architectural marvels of history where you can imagine the luxurious era of Indians. Beautiful building built with golden stones is the best example of rich Rajasthan's golden era.

title: Good
review: Nice place ... interesting - olden tim artifacts and articles were quite interesting ... climbing of stairs that are quite steep is required...

title: Intricate, beautiful, real golden
review: Huge decorated building made by four brothers, the history is what is amazing about it.

title: Better than the Jaislamer For , Well Maintained
review: This is associated with the history of the businessman , It is well maintained and the entry fee is Rs.100 per person. I would recommend to hire a guide to better experience. A well maintained haveli and the shop also offer authentic clothes and Quilts.

title: Carved Facade
review: Nice building's with some fine and detailed carved facades on them. I didn't go inside but it's a good place to stroll around and get some good photo's

title: Stunning
review: It was better than the jaisalmer fort for me. Exquisite filigree and well preserved articles of a Manor.  Gives a fantastic glimpse of life 100 years ago

title: Amazing Haveli
review: Patwaon ki haweli is the one of best place to visit in jaislmer. It show old  royal people culture. Very good art in this

title: Heritage villa of times gone by
review: Interesting to see a merchants home from the 1800s. They have preserved it as a museum with its kitchens and bedrooms to depict life of a merchant and his family from that era.

title: Nice place to see
review: It's a typical Jaisalmer royal house. It's  well maintained and the intricacies of the art work are not to be missed.

title: Can visit for a short time
review: Nothing much to see, except the haveli from outside.

title: Must Visit!
review: Hire a guide. Many rooms to visit. Guide makes it interesting. Its maintained & clean. Takes 1-1.30 hrs. for tour

title: A grand Haveli of the Patwas who were merchants...
review: The intricate work done in the Haveli is what makes it attractive. Read the history of Patwas before visiting this Haveli so that you can relate more to this Haveli.

title: Good watch for Rajsthani art and architecture
review: We went to this place through narrow lanes and streets from fort. Sign boards are not available hence one need to depend on local people for directions. Passing through the streets is good experience but sometime dampened due to lack of cleaning  in streets hence need to be watchful all the time. There are 2 havelis, one privately maintained and another one is govt maintained hence buy ticket carefully as per your taste for the architecture as well as to avoid money wastage by buying tickets at both the palaces.

title: Beautiful Haveli but nothing remarkable inside
review: This haveli has a  impressive facade with intricate carvings and artwork but nothing remarkable inside. Beware of the bats hanging from the ceilings of the stairs.

title: Expecting more
review: I was expecting more about this Haveli specially after seems amazing things in other major cities.

title: One of the must see places in Jaisalmer
review: One of the amusing havelis in the city of Jaisalmer. The artifacts and architecture attracts attention.

title: Fabulous Architecture
review: Great architecture and stone works that shows the stages of modernisation in ancient India. For me a old fridge that worked with Keroscene and hard to understand how the fire will result in to coolness in the fridge. Recommend

title: A highly ornate building!
review: This building supposedly built by 4 brothers who were tradesmen is ostentatious and shows the intricate work carried out on windows and balconies - similar to the royal palaces.

title: Patwoon ki Haweli-Old abandoned and sold out princely houses
review: These Old abandoned and sold out princely houses are called patwoon ki haweli and they are situated in the middle of the city. from the terrace you can see the Jaisalmer living fort in the skyline. The haweli has all the old relics preserved on how these rich jain people use to live.

title: Good to See😍 Better than Fort
review: After watching Fort I was afraiding to See "Patwaon Ki Haveli"

title: Nice haveli , but be aware of too active and too nice guides, members of racketting system
review: Via via , you arrive before you realise in a jeweller room with massala tea pushing you to buy much too expensive jewellery! ... Instead of accepting al the nice talk better follow a course 'how to bargain like an indian '!

title: Intricate stonework and insight into past life
review: A large complex of buildings, split 5 ways by the patwon family.  The first is the one to see (made into a museum), they've assembled historic artifacts and preserved/reconstructed rooms to show what life was like.  Of the others, a family lives in one, another is free access but is just a store, a few can be toured etc. but from what I was told the first is the most extensive.  The stonework is amazing.  Beware the crowds!! Come early if you can, like 9am, once the hordes descend into the narrow alleys its impossible to get around or take photos.

title: Haveli visit
review: It was again another example of earlier kings richness. Good to visit but again after seeing so many nice places you won't be excited here.

title: Nice History of this place. Must Visit
review: Nice History of this place. I liked the Haveli Architecture and the story behind it. Must get a guide when you visit it so that you know all details about it.

title: Wow..
review: Superb experience...

title: A masterpiece of stonework!!!
review: The moment you enter the Haveli your first expression would be "wow". Great level of artwork both internal and external. Lot of things to see about India's modern history. Must visit place!!!

title: it is private property
review: at the entrance they collect hefty fees eventhough a tourism dept board says, rs 40 or so , the govt maintains one haveli which is not properly done

title: Nothing great from inside
review: Over hyped location. Overcrowded with tourists and local shop keepers. Overly commercialized and surrounded by residential properties

title: Intriguing stonework
review: This merchants house demonstrates the amazing and intricate stonework the artisans were capable of honing out of a single slab of sandstone.

title: Beautiful!
review: Yes beautiful for sure from the outside. Inside is usual predictable stuff...all forts/palaces and now havelis have museums, this one too is converted into one.

title: Good
review: Located in local city area.good display of Rajas and there culture.Ticket Rs100/-,Children below 12 are free.u have to walk 500mtrs

title: Must visit
review: This is a must visit to know the intricate works and amazing architecture of Rajasthan. The visit is worthy for more than one reason.

title: Grandiose and Beautiful! Experience how Rajasthani Seths lived
review: Jaisalmer is full of Grand Havelis and Patwon ki Haveli is amongst the Grand best!

title: A fine piece of art and carving
review: Excellent stone structure nicely carved out of stones. A grand display of royal life in their era. The haveli is worth a visit and not to be missed by tourists.

title: Traditional house
review: 1. First haveli erected in Jaisalmer and second, that it is not a single haveli but a cluster of 5 small havelis

title: Good place rich in culture
review: This is a row of 5 havelis made by the king for his sons. You will be able to visit all of them but only the 1st haveli is worth visiting.

title: Avoid stampede.
review: There may be lots of heritage paintings/utensils to be seen here but not during tourist season.AVOID AVOID AVOID.

title: Amazing building
review: Breath holding, mind blowing place. You will fall in love with this place in very first sight. The spectacular carving on golden stone looks stunning even in night. Must must go place..

title: Wonderful
review: Wonderful place to visit with family, amazing history of patwon ki haveli. Well maintained and cool place. Love the way things are kept / displayed the historic items. But only half of the haweli is open for public. Wish to see entire building. Very good experience.

title: Beware of the Touts ...
review: This is the last Haveli in the row of haveli's when you arrive at the location. Plenty of touts will push you to visit the initial haveli's (or even the one which has no entrance fee). Best to avoid as either they would pester you to shop in the Haveli or the current owner would have done modern restorations to them making them unauthentic.

title: One of the main attraction of Jaisalmer
review: We realized at the moment we visited this Haveli during the last moment of our trip and its like we were about to miss the awesome monument. I would say this is one of the must visit place in Jaisalmer and just 10 mints walk from the Jaisalmer fort.

title: Gr8 artistic work.... India is rich in cultural heritage
review: Worth visiting place... depicting the fineness of the gr8 artistic work. The road leading to this place is very narrow...hire an auto

title: Very unique place
review: Must visit

title: Best haveli in Jaisalmer to visit
review: We visited many haveli but apart from this no other was worth to visit.. its one of the biggest haveli in jaisalmer, beautiful architect, amazing history and much better museum than Fort.. you need atleast 1 hrs for complete visit in this.. rest all haveli lke nathmal haveli etc are time to waste as you are not allowed inside visit in other havelis..

title: Nice place to visit
review: It is one of those things which everyone visits when in Jaisalmer. So we to went to see this place and it was pretty good. Just beware of the vendors outside. They will try to sell you stuff making false claims. Do not fall prey to it.

title: nice place to see
review: one of the nice place to see while visiting jaisalmer . well maintained showing rajasthani trade welll maintained  loved it

title: Nice experience
review: There are two Haweli in the name of Patwaon-ki-Haweli. The first at entrance Haweli owned as Private property by Mr. Kothari and run Privately. Tickets charged Rs. 100. Another maintained by Government and entry tickets Rs. 50, located next to Private property. The well designed Haweli and collection of old /antique House hold articles are the Main attractions. Need not to visit other Haweli in same area.

title: unique and rich
review: take the help of guide to enjoy the essence of rajasthan, the heritage and the palace in particular.

title: Nice experience
review: There are two haweli in the name of patwaone ki haweli the first owe'd as private property they charged 100  another maintaind by government they charged 50 and looking nice

title: Better than Maharaja palace at Fort
review: The entry ticket is 100 / 250 for Indian/ Foreign tourists and a separate fee for camera (mobile phone cameras were spared).

title: Marvelous Architecture
review: This is a must visit if you are in Jaisalmer. The stone carvings are an spectacle to watch. Further, the artifacts on display here give a detailed insight into the lives of the elites of the bygone era.

title: Amazing architecture and stone work!
review: These havelis are more ornate than some palaces I've seen. These were the houses of erstwhile merchants and traders. Part of this belongs to the government, part is a museum and part of it still has the present generation living there.

title: Beautiful piece of architecture
review: Amazingly beautiful piece of architecture. It took hell lot of time to build this master piece.

title: Must visit , do take a guide
review: Jaisalmer has great history and these havelis showcase the lavish life style of that era. It is must visit, do take a guide.

title: Just an hour here is enough
review: This Haveli is an interesting piece of architecture but we struggled to understand the value of this place for a lack of a proper guiding tool -  Adding an audio tour and some clean will go great things to this place.

title: Also known as kothari haweli
review: At walking distance from narrow galli *patwao ki hawelli* is there.a buisnessman had 5 children he founded 5 hawellies for his 5 sons.area is clean charges 100/ pax.old items used by family is like meuseum.its builtup between two Tekkaries to save from dust strome in summer.dainik bhaskar clicked our pics as tourist.

title: awesome haveli
review: a beautiful haveli by architecture wise and the things kept inside for view is also good.get a guide for 50 rs. he will explain you well.even not there are self explanatory boards kept. very beautiful points to take pics.get your camera ready.

title: Not to miss !
review: Awesome history behind this magnificent Haveli .Must have a guide . We had a guide who took us around explaining the property . The first Haveli with steep stair cases is the one where everything is preserved to be seen and appreciated  .Worth the effort and the walk around the old town of Jaiselmer .

title: Wastage of money
review: It will cost you Rs100 per head, and it's not that much worth. Although it's a great place to see, but rs 100 are far more.

title: Its name says all
review: Place is full of historical arts and museum, city view is just perfect from here

title: Rich haveli
review: This is one of the havelis in Jaisalmer which you should visit. It is better to take a guide with you to know more about the havellis. They dont charge much. This havelli is rich and well maintained. It gives a glimpse of how the rich people of Jaisalmer lived in those days.

title: super rich architecture
review: The haveli is a collection of five havelis. the main haveli is maintained well and is managed privately. This is the best of the five havelis. Take a guide and he will explain you well. other havelis are not managed well there are bats at few places in the unmanaged haveli. but if you really wanna know how lavish the Patwa was, then you must go here

title: Fantastic Arch & History
review: There are 3 houses, one in use by the family and one each with Govt and another owner for tourist visit.

title: A Royal and Artistic Rajasthani Building
review: Beautiful carvings all along the building walls. The sight of the carvings instantly calls you to click pictures of it and you just feel like admiring the beautiful work, better than any of the palaces. A place to view how the lords under king were so wealthy and what all they used in their day to day life. A real eye opener.

title: Great work engravings on stone are excetional
review: 600 years old haveli with great work engraving on stones are worth A Look to admiration  and one must really visit to restore the history  and an awesome experience

title: Simply out of this world
review: Its hard to imagine how many hours would have gone in carving the yellow sandstone with which these 5 houses have been built.

title: Beautiful
review: They're quite small so expect to be done in a 15 minutes but very pretty carvings and nice architecture, so worth a visit.

title: A different experience
review: Rs 100 per person and 100 for camera. Rs 250 for guide. Will take you 45 minutes. He will show you the first haveli out of five, with 17 rooms converted into museum. Each room has a different ceiling. Plus one can see ancient household equipment, especially when electricity was not there. The life style of the rich which was so different and appeared far more luxurious than that of the king.

title: good place
review: its a beautiful pace but do hire a guide to understand the history and the intricacies of the place.

title: Interesting museum
review: Interesting museum inside is worth the few rupees.  It gives you an idea of who these people were and what their life might have been like. The merchants really loved mirrored glass!

title: Not so exciting
review: The area around the haveli is not clean, and is crowded. The havelis are not maintained too well, inside. After seeing the way Mejrangarh Fort is restored, organised and clean, we were a little spoilt. There was no audio guide which would have made a big difference. You can visit it, but we were not so impressed.

title: One of the recommended place
review: This haveli is another museum that has collection of articles around 150 years old. it is a good collection of items and does support the recommendation.

title: Glimpse into the lifestyle of wealthy merchants of yore
review: Jaisalmer has a few famous havelis- seeing any one of them should be good. I would certainly not recommend trying to see all as that would be overkill. The Patwon ki haveli is a series of 5 havelis of which two are open to the public- one is managed by a Mr Kothari and the second by ASI (not sure what the difference is but some folks said that ASI did not do such a good job). We went to the first one which is privately run. It provides a glimpse into the life of these merchants back in the day. The tour is well organized with most exhibits labelled. Apart from the rooms, it  also has displays of clothes, weights, coins, some astronomy related devices, and they had advanced gadgets for the time (refrigerator, gramophone, camera, etc). All in all, interesting. The outside of the buildings is even prettier.

title: Patwaon-Ki-Haveli
review: we some friends again visited jaisalmer w.e.f. 10/11/2016 to 13/11/2016 and enjoyed rajasthani culture and also sightseeing place.Patwaon-Ki-Haveli situated in the heart of jaisalmer Near Patwa Complex, Patwa Haveli, Jaisalmer. very attractive sight seeing points famous for royal historical building indian and foreign tourist . must see.

title: Stunning haveli
review: Our tour guide didn't take us inside Patwaon-Ki but I came back later and paid extra (200 rupees I think) to see the interior. Glad I did, because it's amazing.

title: EXCELLENT HERITAGE WELL PRESERVED
review: This is a well preserved piece of history..the five Havelis constructed  by the Jain Merchants way back in history...the three storied haveli presents the life style and the various colourful aspects of their life..the main baithak, kitchen, dining room, Munim's room, water receptacles, pagris, etc....the Haveli has been bought by a Jodhpur based merchant and is well preserved and presented ..two of the other are with the Govt while the other two are inhabited..must visit

title: Good carving
review: You can visit this Haveli - just a 5 min walk from the fort. Its one of the most grand building around. Avoid museum - just see from outside.

title: Brilliant architecture
review: Located near jaisalmer fort its a must watch.You will just amazed to see the worl on stone.Now part of it has been converted into shopping plaza.Here you can buy variety of rajasthani items but you must burgain before taking a few.

title: Quaint old world charm
review: The life style of the rich is both into sharp focus with a visit to this place. Consisting of 5 havelis all done in intricate stone carving this is a must see spot. A lot of shopping bargains can be got from the street vendors here.

title: Lovely architecture, but congested!
review: This place boasts of lovely architecture and grandeur of history of Jaisalmer- Rajasthan. But the place is located in narrow bye lanes, otherwise it is a must-see while in Jaisalmer.

title: Havelis tour
review: Most of the havelis are same.. you can visit this place to where you can find some good job done by artists on the sand stone ...

title: nice haveli
review: great building in the market. Nice architecture.in very good shape.very good for people interested in ancient architecture.nice place to have memorable photographs.walking distance from jaisalmer fort

title: Very Gorgeous Haveli - Must see in Jaisalmer
review: Total 5 buildings but only one for the visitors. Very beautiful architecture and well maintained museum. Better to hire a guide to know more about haveli. It charges Rs.100-200. No need to hire car, best to hire auto. Very narrow road so big vehicles may not go up to main gate . Then you have to walk more.

title: Not that great
review: Well for the people of India this will be just another thing with carvings but overseas this could've been a hit ..

title: Beautiful Haveli
review: Definitely worth a visit, even if you don't go in.  The architecture of the buildings inside and outside the fort in Jaisalmer is unique and beautiful.  You can visit all Havelis in Jaisalmer easily by foot and you see so much local culture on the way. We did not go inside as we read other trip advisor reviews saying that there was nothing much inside.  From the outside the lattice work is amazing and beautiful... as it is in this part of the country.  I am so glad that the government is protecting these havelis.  definitely make an effort to at least visit the outside of this one... the windows are amazing.

title: Impressive
review: Wonderful detailing in the sandstone Haveli. Well worth a look. Was told by our guide that it was designed by two brothers who took a half each and you can spot small differences (when shown)

title: Patwa 's haveli
review: It is really worth to see. Five buildings are there all together. The architecture is amazing. There are such a intricate designs on those buildings. Patwas are the business community. They made these havelis in eighteenth century. Nowadays they left the city. First building or haveli has been taken care by one Mr. Kothari. Recommended to visit these havelis

title: patwaon
review: It is a nice place.per person 00₹.there are 5 palaces of which we can see  1 or 2 .saw postcards from Mumbai. Living style of patwas.there are beautiful mirror work rooms and good ceilings.

title: An ancient culture and art well preserved
review: It's good to see the well maintained and preserved Carvings, Ancient Art, Jarokhas.

title: Fancy dress & photo shoot!
review: Marvellous architecture! Local tourists come here to take photos of themselves in Rajasthani costumes. I enjoyed taking their photos.

title: Worth a visit
review: This place really didn't turn up in my google searches on things to do in Jaisalmer, but our driver from Agra/Jaipur recommended it and we were glad to have seen it. Lovely insight into the life of the Rajputs and pleasant view from the top. Was convenient to stop by K.B. Cafe next door for tea/dinner thereafter.

title: Kothari's Patwa Haveli
review: The first Haveli is the best. The others under ASI are in a mess.Mohini Vihar mirror work is incomparable.

title: Not to miss
review: Ppl migyt think ..what to see here.. a jewellers home ...2 floor under ground...4 floors above..

title: Best place to go...
review: Pl must visit place ... nice architecture and very good place of historical interest.  Pl take guide to enjoy the place

title: Good place
review: Must visit when in jaisalmer. Good place to visit and see heritage of jaisalmer. Hire guide to know the history..

title: How rich businessman lived few decades back
review: Haveli with modern amenities. First generation refrigerator, still and video cameras and gramophone.

title: Excellent nakkashi on stones
review: These havelis are one of the best stone engravings and nakkashi buildings available in the country which are protected and maintained by Gov.

title: good view from outside
review: we clicked photos from outside as it has entry charges of rs100. and we were tired by watching same kind of place. I already saw city place, and same kind of historical buildings. so just saw from out side. everything costly near to this place.

title: Patwaon Ki Haveli - A Rajasthani Jewel
review: Great Haveli , perhaps the only you can buy the entry tickets and get inside and shoot those lovely Rajputana windows of the Havelies . Real wonder .

title: Wealth of the financier to the king
review: Great experience of visiting the house of one of the richest businessman of medieval India. View of the fort from the rooftop was an added bonus.

title: Fantastic carving work
review: If you are carving lover, it's a must visit place. It's the biggest of all havelis of Jaisalmer and the best of all too. Unfortunately nothing is to be seen from inside of it. They are also not maintained properly as they are privately owned.

title: Patwon ki Haveli
review: Nice place. Beautiful architecture. The museum has some very old things which may be unique and very interesting.

title: Rajasthani style of house
review: Good for the ones who loves the artistic work of stone. This is the only haveli that is clean enough to visit, rest ones are not well maintained at all.

title: Decent Place
review: A good place to see and get the feel of the local city and its culture.  Great carving on the windows and doors

title: Gorgeous Carvings
review: Great history and intricate carvings all around. The places is filled with the things used by PATWA caste in their times when they were traders of opium and other stuff from Afghanistan to Rajasthan. And the class is well depicted in their beautifully designed rooms and the things used by them during those times such as Kerosene Fridge, Noodle Maker etc. Must visit in Jaisalmer.

title: Must visit
review: A great glimpse of history of jaisalmer. Do hire a guide. Don't get fooled by the locals selling stuff out of Harry potter movie. Albeit amazing experience. Carry water and watch your head as lot of walk and low areas. A must watch

title: Not soo preferred
review: There is nothing to see here. As the maharaja stays here.we are not allowed to see the complete fort. But we can see some of the real life activities of maharaja.

title: Over crowded place
review: Please do not take a guide for this. They will charge u rs 200/- it's not worth paying for d guide. You need to pay to go inside. Not worth it. Lol see it from outside n go

title: You gotta visit this magnificent fort
review: If you are an artist, poet, architecture, photographer or need inspiration for your creative mind, just rush to this place. How on earth one can succumb to such details ?

title: A must see place
review: This is one of the best tourist attraction in Jaisalmer.City view from the top of Haveli is just awesome.

title: Famous  Five Havelis
review: If you are fan of stone carvings than you should be visiting these 5 havelis as first thing in Jaisalmer. You will be astonished by the craftsmanship on the stone and carvings on the windows and doors will leave you awestruck. You can take some beautiful pictures here.

title: Average place.Good exterior.Poor interiors
review: Very Run down and poorly maintained.High priced entry.Exhibits were ok. The lighting and maintanence was poor

title: Fascinating displays
review: The haveli offers a fascinating display of lifestyle of the merchants and the wealth they had amassed. Many rooms, each meant for a different purpose are a treat to see - the furniture, and items are unique. The place is a must visit. Best room is undoubtedly the drawing room and the dining room - don't forget to see the fridge!!

title: Beautiful street with all the carvings and stone works
review: We got to see a lot of stone works and carvings. Had good shopping around it. Lot of history around it.

title: Interesting but no so interesting
review: This place is at a walking distance from the Jaisalmer fort. This haveli has some artifacts from that era ranging from clothes used to the utensils used. You also get to see the games played at that time for entertainment. For me, the chaupar game and the game of chess were nice to see. For photo buffs, there are some nice spots within the haveli. The view of the fort from the rooftop is nice.

title: Well maintained private house
review: Built by a wealthy jain trader family, it's a set of  5 havelis built in the 18th century. Distress sold post partition and maintained by a pvt perfusion now. 50rs per person entry.

title: patwaon ki haweli.
review: beautiful architecture. must see. great history of ancient traders. this a must see in jaisalmer. personally i admired it.

title: great carving on stone
review: these were havelis of a wealthy man. great stone carvings.  lots of old articles exibited, including typewriter, non-electric fan, silver sofa, lots of locks, and so on..

title: nice place
review: This is an absolutely great place for history lovers. Also has lot of beautiful design and architecture which will enrich you with historical knowldge

title: well maintained
review: well maintained  haveli of a wealthy man

title: Architecture n carvings
review: Visit once and see the creativity of craftsmanship on stones. Click some for memories. Simple place full of tourists.

title: Haveli owned by RAJA not by govt
review: This HAVELI is a private property...some of the part is used for tourist attraction..and in other part still RAJA's family stay...but u will not b able to meet them..so forget it..

title: Happy life
review: Really nice this Haveli I really like sold wonderful happy life. Very happy to recommend                 ;,;,,'';??'?';;",',';

title: Symbol of India's trading glory of the past
review: Fantastic piece of architecture created by a trading family that was rumored to be 50X wealthier than the ruling families and literally lend money to all the rulers of rajasthan.  The family controlled a bulk of trade flowing through the silk route

title: Absolutely stunning
review: As you make your way around the back streets you cannot fail to be amazed at the architecture. Patwaon-Ki-Haveli is just amazing. The exterior stonework is beyond belief for its age, it's so intricate it's like icing on a cake. And to see the rooms in side , the first completely mirrored tile and very colourful. Well worth a visit

title: Must Visit
review: If you want to revisit the prosperity of Jodhpur years back@pl visit this place.There are five havelies,out that one is converted in the museum showing prosperity of Patwa-Kotharis.Excellent place.Must Visit witg guide,so you can get all tge information.Nicely maintained Museum.

title: Stunning!
review: Stunning haveli, really worth visiting.  Don't miss it!  Interesting to see a snapshot of how the wealthy lived in those times.  Only part of the haveli is open to the public, the rest is still being used today.

title: Good Photo Options
review: This haveli is worth seeing in Jaisalmer and is one of the important places out here. The incricate designs give a feel of the lifestyle of the Maharajas.

title: Worth to Visit
review: If you want to know more about the ancient time and history, must visit this place. Awesome architecture and interiors. One will fascinate that how the people from that time do this kind of miracle.

title: Interesting glimpse into an old haveli
review: Only took a short time to wander through but was quite interesting. The touts outside weren't as bad as I was expecting but the guy trying to make me look at his shop before telling me where the exit stairs were was quite frustrating

title: Great views
review: Patwon ki haveli is a very touristy place and is well maintained. The first and third havelis are museums and the second one houses a small jain temple. The havelis are worth a visit while in Jaisalmer. The museum has good collectibles and worth a look. There are a number of curio shops at the entrance and is a good place to buy souvenirs. Your bargaining skills would be put to test.

title: good
review: Nice beautiful haveli giving nice view of the traditional lifestyle.. Worth the visit.. enjoyed it...

title: Worth a visit
review: 1 of the 5 havelis. One of them is privately owned and open for public. Entry ticket - 100/- per head. Worth a visit. A complete house with house amenities. 1 hr walk through.

title: Awesome
review: The Best experience I had in India. Padam picked me up from te station at 5:00am and this is just The

title: what a home to build for 5 brothers
review: intricate carvings and lavish mirror work....very interesting place to visit in Jaisalmer....see the opulent living of the brocade merchants

title: One must visit this place
review: This place is worth a visit Very few places in the  world are so beautiful  One should see it to believe Carvings on the walls are too good

title: Worst characters on guard
review: The ticket guy said no photos even from outside. Inside every one wanted to see if for mobile phones also did we take tickets at 30 per phone to take photo. Absolute frauds and crooks just worth half a dozen photos for carvings not worth the effort and pains

title: Intricately designed havelis are a must visit
review: Patwon ki Haveli is a cluster of 5 havelis in the city centre and is said to have taken 55 years to complete. The carvings on the exterior walls are just unbelievable. You enter in the 1st haveli and visit the different floors housing the artifacts of the Patwaon brothers. This is more like a heritage museum and allows you to appreciate the lavish lifetsyle of its original inhabitants. It is a must visit on your Jaisalmer tour.

title: Highlight of Jaisalmer
review: We visited the 1st Haveli and had a real nice time seeing how lavishly both the exterior and interiors were done.

title: Jaisalmer
review: There is a Three haveli in the jaisalmer. The Patwa Haveli is the one off the best haveli in one off them it has a fine work off art of carving on the send stone.From Patwa Haveli you can visit great view of the Fort

title: Boring place
review: Not that much exciting place. Weather was so hot there. Not much worth . it was just an average place.

title: Awesome piece of architecture
review: Good place to visit if you are fond of stone carvings. Five havelis made of stone with real good carvings. Now its been maintained by archeological department.

title: Very beautiful architecture
review: There are 5 brothers in this haveli. All are same. If you visit one, then it would be fine. There are some ships inside this haveli for jaipuri hand work things.

title: Old and gold
review: All the architecture of rajasthan is so beautiful and unique...that they will take you in a different era and dream. This old haveli is such a place to be. There are other havelies also nearby.Go visit them.

title: Jasilmair
review: Very beautiful  architecture where you visit real india history. Each line designed very well and match with the next line to drow a very beautiful picture.

title: Not much to see, can be improvised for tourists
review: We went there during daytime after visiting the fort, but all we could see inside was a deserted haveli where bats have been living for generations. These can at least be added with pictures, stories and history related to such big mansions now haunted.

title: Heritage
review: Well maintained and worth a visit if you like art,architecture,history and culture.it is better if you hire a good guide who will take you around this wonderful haveli and let you know about it all the more but you have to walk around to get to this place for the streets are narrow but not difficult.

title: Worth visiting
review: Patwaon ki haveli is a cluster of havelis with only the largest open to public. It showcases the abundance and ostentetiousness of the Patwas, a trading class. It has amazing architecture and mirror work. We had a very good guide who showed us everything with all the connected tales.

title: Set of 5 havelis
review: It's a set of 5 havelis in a stretch. 2  of them are owned by Govt as paid museum and remaining 3 are private and converted to shops. You can visit any of it as the architecture are similar to each other.

title: Happy life
review: Happy life the patwo haveli really nice old fantastic imagine I hope so proud people like..    (  thank you so much enjoy life..)

title: Mast
review: Very good forr here to visit.  It's. Surprised me to open.  24 hours.  And a good cultural in a sounding Donal fort

title: Happy life
review: Happy life the Patwa Haveli really nice old fantastic imagine I hope so proud people like.            ""'''( -: thank you so much enjoy life.           """"""".    """"'

title: Most famous Haveli
review: This is the most popular of many Haveli in Jaisalmer city. If you have limited time you should cover Patwaon ki Haveli atleast.....

title: Beautiful
review: The structure is awesome and different when compared to other buildings in the city. Worth a visit, go for it.

title: A royal home
review: Auto not required, you can visit all the local places by walk. Do visit this place. This haveli is really beautiful and after watching it you will feel like having one.

title: most famous haveli in jaisalmer
review: the structure is awesome and diffrent compared other buildings in the city.worth a visit,go for it.this haveli is really beautiful.

title: where many movies were shot, for photography lovers and solo visit
review: this is a collection of 5 havelis in total.

title: A History of Gold and Opium
review: This place is best seen by foot. A rickshaw too would be stuck in "traffic" here.
