It's got plenty of stories attached to it, from gold thread producers to opium smugglers; truth of the same hardly authenticated.The cluster of almost five hawelis is worth a look, in case one has got additional spare time while at Jaisalmer.

title: Awesome
review: We visited to this haveli and amazed the interior and all... there are also thing and letter before 1947.... must visit this haveli to explore the old time and there culture

title: Even better than the King's Palace
review: The first haveli out of the five, which is actualy worth visiting, takes you aback with the solemn display of the lifestyle, the residents once had. Separate rooms for playing cards, with chairs made up of silver, who has that ? Numerous valuable articles, to stare at, like an array of locks, multiple racks of beautiful "Pagdees", there was even a milk cooker, or so I re-collect. Guys were once 6 times as rich as the king, and sometimes would loan him money. Brilliant aristocracy !

title: Fine ART!!!
review: These havelis are simply beautiful. You can see the fine details in carvings and the symmetry in assembling them. They seem to be old but very well maintained by a government body.

title: Lovely piece of architecture
review: Don't miss this, these are old (haveli's) mansions of the rich. I'd suggest to take a local guide. You can even go inside one of them. The balconies of these building are especially exquisite in design.

title: Beautiful Haveli
review: Beautifully built and well decorated Haveli by the then business person of the state  gives immense pleasure while visiting.

title: Nice !
review: Artistically build and good place for sight seeing !

title: Good Place
review: Best place to have a view of the city from the terrace. This place is popular for historical engagement of business of clothes, though I would suggest don't buy anything from here, I bought a saree for my mother and when I gifted it we found that it had a cut. Must see the city from terrace.

title: Good place
review: It is one of the best place in jaisalmer..this haveli Architecture and miniatures balconies are extremely good

title: mesmirizing architect
review: its really beautiful..one must visit here when in jaisalmer...and the shops outside are good to purchase some local handicrafts and u can bargain too...

title: Average Site seen
review: This is a average site seen, but photograph we have taken here are excellent. As there not much for site seen in Jaisalmer it is also a attraction.

title: Very intricate carvings, a must see Haveli..
review: Build by the yellow sandstone, its a great haveli made up of so many exquisite designs. It's maintained very nicely. The surroundings are also very cool. A must visit haveli. You can opt for getting clicked in rajasthani costume in front of the Haveli. You'll also find a jain temple beside the haveli. There are several shops to buy rajasthani dolls and other traditional art outside Haveli

title: supper work of stone art
review: when i go dowon to city was good walk in nerrow street i found a huge old building the local told me that its make by 5 brother who are good bushiness men in past ,work on stone is so details  i visit only one part pay litle entry fee beacouse its from govt

title: Dont take guide
review: Visited at 9 AM .Just at parking got one guide asking for 300 rs for showing Nathmal and patwaon ki havali.fixed deal at 200 rs.This haveli has 5 parts. 2 are open for tourist. first one is private to see it u have to pay 100 rs ticket.last one is  government for that u have to pay 50 rs.Guide told us government part is having bats and foul smell and is not worth visiting so we went to first one i.e private one.After going through all the parts of haveli i found that taking guide is not worth there.Just display of various household thing of royal family.Though they are not much older like u can see fridge,gramphone,dressing table sort of things  models which were imported from london at that time.Just go see will take 30 to 45 min.Best Architecture is what is visible outside so be frank didnt found to pay 100 rs worthwhile to go inside.

title: Real richness of Royal days
review: A must visit place....Jaisalmer visit is not completed if this Haveli is not seen.

title: Magnificent
review: Beautiful workmanship . Also you find some interesting exhibits of utensils and household goods used by patwas or ministers . A must visit

title: nice place
review: The traditional courtyard homes in South Asia is built on the ancient principles of Vastu Shastra.[4] which state that all spaces emerge from a single point, that is the centre of the house. Courtyards are common feature in south asian architecture. The earliest archaeological evidence of courtyard homes in the region dates back to 2600–2450 BCE.[

title: This is a must...
review: If you are in Jaisalmer, Patwon-Ki-Haveli should be on your list of places to visit. Open: early morning until 5 pm. Patwon-Ki-Haveli is in a cluster of 5 havelis. Once there, learn its history - it is quite interesting. It is an interesting piece of architecture and it is one of the most important havelis in Jaisalmer and one of the largest in Rajasthan.

title: For architecture lovers
review: The 5 havelis are beautiful buildings of which you can visit 2. From the outside as well as from the inside it is worth spending some rupees for the visit. The rooftop allows a nice view over the city and the fort.

title: Patwaon ki Haveli
review: Intricate designs and the wares used by the Rajas and Maharajas were beautiful and lovely to see. Had a wonderful time.

title: "What a carving "
review: Visiting patwa haveli was truly a wonderful experience... You will be able to see the luxuries & great example of carving .Must visit...

title: Beautiful beyond words
review: Out of all the Havelis, this one is preserved best. Guess 100 bucks entry tickets goes a long way :)

title: THE BEAUTY BEYOND DESCRIPTION
review: Visited the haveli on 01.01.2016. The outer view of haveli was so beautiful. the walls having stone intricate carving by a gold smith. even the interior of the haveli was marvelous. the haveli comprises 5 parts.

title: see the richness of indian
review: "wow,fantastic" this were the words spoken from my mouth when i saw Patwa Haveli in jaisalmer . it is a  rich heritage site whom no one should miss when he visit Jaisalmer. Jakkaaasssss carving on yello stone. good place for photography. though they charge around Rs.50 per person  but it is "paisa vasul"

title: Not worth it
review: This place is not a fort or a Mahal. Its just a havali of same rich family of jaisalmer.

title: Takes you back in time
review: This is an old mansion which reveals a lot about the people who lived in it and the customs of their times. There are rooms that have kitchen utensils, cookware; turbans (pagdi); accountants' room, musical instruments; hookah etc.; in addition to the living, dining, entertainment and bedrooms. There is some modern stuff as well like baby cribs, strollers, turntable and what appeared to be a gigantic radio.

title: The Haveli is not less than a fort!
review: Like the entire golden city, this haveli is also golden, bearing the same architectural carving as the golden fort. Having visited the Jain temple and the golden fort, walk down a little to this place and you can rest on the benches which have been built near to the haveli, as if keep sitting and keep watching to beautiful architecture.

title: This is the place where time stop
review: You have to visit the place with a good guide, otherwise it will be only a haveli museum at jaisalmer. You can feel that the time stops here..indeed a very beautiful place.

title: Small but Worth to Visit
review: This regarding to a family's own created Haveli in earlier 19th century or before. The stone work of the Haveli is quite autistics rather inside was a Mesuem. There is one good photo shoot point between the Jharokas..

title: worth the visit
review: Do take a guide while going to this place else you will miss out on details. Its worth a visit and this one of out the 3 haveli is worth going

title: Great stone work
review: Ideally King's palace should look richer than any one but in this case, the finesse of stone work and the marvelous exteriors makes you advise the king- way to go! This is the place where the chief Trader used to stay it has five different havelis for 5 brothers and all are a treat to your eyes. Hard to believe the stone work 600 years back was so good. But there is not much inside the houses. One has been turned as museum but you won't miss much if you have seen it from outside. Approach roads are too narrow and dirty. May need locals to guide.

title: What a mansion?
review: It's a unique haveli with very nice carving jharokhas and it's very big and historic haveli. Must visit if you are in Jaislamer..

title: Showcases the lifestyle 100yrs back
review: The haveli has nice architecture and it showcases the lifestyle that existed some 100yrs back. It has on display range of things that was used in daily life of rich. It displays the bedroom, entertainment room, dinning room , cooking utensils..etc.

title: amazing architecture
review: It is an amazing piece of architecture in the heart of the city. A must watch for all travellers and shoppers.

title: Must visit
review: Amazing artistic work in Haveli.the guide is must for the visit as it makes it more interesting charges are only 100 rupee. The view of Fort from top of Haveli is awesome. It's walkable distance within Jaisalmer city. So no need for taxi too. Thanks Jaisalmer..

title: Nice
review: Was nice, beautiful but nothing exceptional, worth the trip but also something to not worry about missing if you have time pressure

title: Bad and smelly
review: Smelly lane with depleted building. No maintenance and top of it the whole lane smells of cowdung. They need serious improvement else building might crash down in cowdung one day

title: What an Architecture...!!
review: These havelis were owned by the business community during that time. The architecture and the finish is excellent. The carvings are so beautiful that you can stop appreciating it. These havelis were made using the Stone found locally in Jaisalmer hence it looks golden. Must visit place when you are in Jaisalmer. We identified some good artisans for Kraftbuy who can provide on demand Jharokhas made from Jaisalmer stone.

title: Re : Patwaon ki haveli
review: Awesome.  I could not believe my eyes when I saw such excellant structure.  Really wonderful.  Everyone should visit atleast once to see the buildings and surroundings.

title: patwaon ki haweli
review: wow...what a lovely place...the patwaon ki haweli was so peaceful and that peacock painting present inside the haweli was so good.....and dat showed that yes...rajasthan is the most royal place in india...

title: Outstanding carving
review: Once occupied by the patwas now the haveli is tourist centre. It gives us insight in royalty that the family have established. There is a hand loom shop in premises which is expensive but good.

title: Scenic experience
review: Very nice views and also well maintained bulding. Interesting decoration and interior (dressing rooms,kitchen,...) Definitely worth a visit for 30-60mins.

title: Wonderful experience....
review: Thus was truly a wonderful experience... You will be able to see the luxuries....Must visit...

title: Must visit in Jaisalmer
review: Intricate carvings in yellow stones is the main attraction, and is really superb.

title: The richness and beauty of old Rajasthan
review: A very beautiful haveli with loads and loads of mirror work. It contains a bed room, drwing room, dining room and kitchen with old dresses, euipment and utensils. The mirror work is very beautiful all around and the carving on the outside is very intricate and amazing

title: Traditional and beautiful
review: We hired a guide who took us around and explained the intricate architecture and history of the place. Beautiful and traditional.

title: Avoid going inside the over priced haveli and feel satisfied
review: The haveli looks good from outside but is not worth the 100/- per person if you are planning to go inside. Since it is accessible only through narrow streets, so you have to walk a while before reaching this place.

title: Not worth but can be visited
review: Just repetition and it is very dark . Lack of Electric fittings. Though can be visited if you dont have any other place to visit

title: Nice traditional work on walls
review: Its was great view from outside. There are 5 havelis. One is open for public site. The art work is great on the windows & walls. We walked from fort to haveli through the roads of jaisalmer....nice

title: Patwaon Ki hawveli must watch in jaisalmer
review: Visited Patwaon ki haveli this march. there are in total 5 haveli's however one can visit only one haveli remaining 4 are closed. however the exterior of the haveli is exquisite with minute detailing. The interior as well are well kept. We hired a guide who charge Rs.150. The tour guide is not needed if you have read about the haveli and are indian as most of the stuff you will know. I preferred the haveli to jaisalmer. fort.

title: Sweet little heritage site
review: Its not a very grand structure, however its small collection of artifacts and mirror room will not disappoint you. Youl leave with some great photographs inside and outside the haveli. Do spare some time for this little place.

title: Haveli enriched with history
review: >> Nice haveli with excellent exterior decoration

title: patwon ki haveli
review: one of the best haveli..but entry fees of Rs 100 is more.It should be around Rs 50 so that it feels worth.

title: Good heritage place
review: Visiting this place with friends made me realise what rich life these people lived who stayed in patwon ki haweli. A well maintained place with items which have been managed well.

title: Nice But entrance fee is high
review: While there is every bit of it one would like , at the same time the hefty entrance fee charged by the owner can be given a thumbs down. Nowhere in the country Rs 100 is charged for seeing a museum.

title: it is a architectural marvel
review: The palace is made in steps. It is less in the base and The volume increases as you go up yet it stands firm and still as real work of art.

title: Must visit haveli
review: It is really good haveli to see there are total 5 nos of haveli only one you can see other are occupied or having govt. control which is not opened.These haveli looks better that than the fort. Nice Glass work inside haveli. Also having old antique things to see. Take one guide there he will tell you things in detail, about history and things inside haveli.

title: Best thing to see inside jaisalmer fort.
review: Visit it and must have a picture in thus haveli dressed in traditional rajasthani costume. U can find them on hire near the haveli.

title: Bad
review: No use to go there nothing special only time and money waste  nothing special in this haveli so many other place is good expect this

title: Not worth the entry fee
review: They charge rs 100 per person, the visit is not worth for the amount, when group of monuments @ Hampi, pattadakkal charged with Rs 10 only.

title: Nice
review: nice art, architecture is captivating, beautiful carvings , mirror work, museum ,everything keep you in trance

title: Must
review: This is outstanding Haveli u must visit. Carving in stone is spectacular. It's just incredible! No point explaining the details here-u must go n see that.

title: magnificient!
review: just made me feel that people were indeed rich back then!

title: Not worth climbing the steep staircases
review: There are 5 havelis of which we visited only one. It was worth nothing at all. The best part is the view from top from where you can view the jaisalmer fort. The second best part is the facade. And thats about it. Its dirty and not maintained at all. The shops opened all over the haveli are a big drawback as it is too commercial. Visit if you have spare time. Its walkable from the fort.

title: Excellent to see. Do take Guide with you.
review: I found this Haveli very beautiful.

title: alright
review: this place is just alright see it from out is enough. inside there isnt anything much. the architecture from out is great. if you miss this you havent missed anything.

title: Havelli to See
review: This is also one of the best attraction of Jaisalmer after the Fort. One must visit this haveli and see the architecture.

title: A beautifully restored haveli furnished, good guides and thoroughly interesting.
review: Definitely worth a visit its in tact and furnished and one gets a very clear idea of how people lived in the haveli.  I highly recommend you visit this haveli

title: Very good spot
review: Good to spent short time over the old haveli with lot of reflaxtion the history located close from the center and got touristic because of it's popularity.

title: Gorgeous, but unkind.
review: The exterior of the haveli makes me wonder. The carving art on the door, windows and wall is fantastic.

title: Interesting haveli
review: This beautiful architectural haveli has many beautiful miniature balconies. The wall structures is made with yellow sand stones of Jaisalmer. Haveli is adorned with jaalis and elaborate facades. Its interesting history of this rich merchant brings out the beauty of this haveli. A set of 5 houses adjacent  to each other makes up this huge haveli with many courtyards and terraces. There are remnants of exquisite paintings on some walls. The terrace offers a great view of the fort. There is a entry fee for local Indians and foreigners plus camera charges.

title: Intricate carving all over
review: Beautiful piece of architecture. This was the house of the accountants there. It's massive and beautiful. This is a must visit place. When we went there half the haveli was closed as it is very old and the structure is becoming weak. Beautiful for photography.

title: Real piece of art and architecture
review: Its really a good place having an example of art and architecture of ancient rajasthan. Its also a good place for shopping

title: Patwaon ki haveli
review: the architecture and the carving on  facade of the haveli is very intricate and well maintained. A set of 5 havelies built by the rich and prosperous  merchant of the region . strongly recommend a vist

title: Nice haveli
review: Vary good carving of this haveli this is world famous haveli and this haveli made by guman mal bhafna. if you come jaisalmer please do not forget to visit this haveli and lot of things to see in jaisalmer

title: Open air Air Gallary
review: Wonderful work of carving on stone and history. Can spend hours just watch the intricate work on stone.

title: Amazing location - engage the services of a guide to take you though here
review: This (and the building next door) are amazing examples of architecture and what can be done when money is no object.

title: Wonderful architecture
review: Haveli is located in a narrow lane - walking distance from the Jaisalmer Fort.

title: Intricate work of art
review: The Patwon ki Haveli is one of its kind. The intricate details with which it has been built is definitely a treat to the eyes of even a layman, and to those who understand art and culture and appreciate history and photography, this is something they have been longing for. A photographer surely finds his paradise over here and his camera the rightful justice to its job. The small jharokhas and the tiny doors, the rooms depicting the then luxurious life of the patwon, the clumsy staircases one after another leading us to some more interesting unfolding history; all leaves a mark on your memory. The complex itself has got a touch to Rajasthani culture with the haveli on one side and on the other side musicians playing harmonium and singing rajasthani folk songs. It makes up the mood for you and lets you seep into the Rajasthani culture.

title: Loved it
review: Loved the tour to this havelli . Showcasing the rich heritage , the great stone carvings , the elephant tusk job

title: Good place to visit
review: These are the havelis owned by Patwa's but now a days those r run by partially government and some of they privately owned. Govt owned havelies are worst maintained but privately maintained havelis are must to visit for royal Rajasthani Style

title: Worth a visit.
review: There are 4-5 havelis nearby and all of them are majorly same. These havelis are one time visit. These havelis are in small by lanes and are easily accessible by walk.

title: Worth a re-visit
review: A beautiful late 19th century building, well renovated with a host of artifacts on display - I enjoyed the second visit as much as the first

title: Well built - insight into lifestyle of wealthy people in late 1800s & early 1900s
review: Its  beautifully built with typical jaisalmeri style of carvings. The interiors and the articles kept in the rooms gives an insight into the life style of wealth merchants.

title: Splendid
review: The Jains as usual needed to show off their wealth and have built these temples from yellow marble. The carvings are good.

title: Learn about the rich... back in the day..
review: It was a good experience to walk along the haveli and get a glimpse at the lifestyle of the rich people back in the day..

title: Must visit in Jaisalmer
review: It is a fascinating tour.  If you are lucky, you will find a good guide as we did. He will take you along and add a little bit of spice to history with humour and good cheer.

title: Intricate Architecture
review: We reached this haveli by walking through many lanes in the jaisalmer fort. The haveli has most intricate and beautiful architecture. With extremely fine work on the walls, the haveli has a very grand effect. Amazing place for shutterbugs.

title: Grandeur!
review: Patwa Haveli - One of the grandest piece of architecture that i came across in jaisalmer. Each and every piece of stone carving is done by hand and they say it took 60 years for this marvel to come alive. If you appreciate history and architecture, this is a must visit when you are in Jaisalmer.

title: Mind blowing intricacies of carving
review: A short walk from the Jaisalmer Fort (you can take an auto but roads are narrow) is the breathtaking intricately carved patwaon ki haveli. A set of 4 havelis. Actually the main beauty is on the outside. If you happen to be too tired, & you skip going in it is ok. Entry is a bit pricey.

title: Nice palace
review: Beautiful palace with some nice architect if you like old palace you should visit this. One of the nice place in Jaisalmer to visit

title: Good place to visit but a bit expensive
review: This place is actually combination of 5 havelis, of which one is a musuem, the entry to which has a ticket, and a bit expensive. 2 havelis are under govt control and closed. One has shops and one is used by the original family. We had a guide who did make the visit worth.

title: You'll not regret missing this
review: Okay so some traders used to live there, maybe they did and maybe they didnt trade opium, now their descendants live somewhere else, and these are 5 old buildings connected to each other. So?

title: Super Nice
review: After going there one will realize the richness of architecture and skills our culture holds. Out of all Havelis this one is the best !!!

title: Nice and beautiful
review: Was nice in architecture... amazing curving.... only few minutes from fort and worth visiting please go there and no need for guides.

title: Solid piece of architecture in an un-royal wonder.
review: Exquisitely carved. Architecture that talks of using natural cooling for a city that can go over 50 degrees Celsius. Upon entering one can feel the temperature difference of up to 5 to 6 degrees. These techniques need to be learned from in modern green buildings. Most of the architecture is better seen from outside than inside.

title: Amazing art work.
review: A must visit place with great art works on wall. Must carry camera. main attraction is from out side. Must click the art works on close up for better view.

title: nice Arthitecture close to palace
review: this haveli belonged to a business family , it has amazing architecture. the Haveli has various small rooms and the exterior is covered with intricate carvings. the carvings in the yellow stone look like being done in wood.

title: Stunning carvings
review: The best view of the fort is from a clearing opposite the fort gate...there are 2 benches where you can sit and take it all in. This is a good place to look into your guide book and observe the beautiful carvings of the haveli and learn more about the history. A few wooden handicraft artisans were sitting in this area too, working on their craft which was quite interesting. There is an entrance fee to go in some parts of the haveli, but there is a store which is free of cost and houses some beautiful original stained glass/gold work. must see in jaisalmer.

title: Overpriced
review: We got just as much or more info from our tour of fort museum. If you choose to sit through a sales pitch you can see some of the place for free, but not the interior or museum area.

title: Must see attraction for Jaisalmer.
review: Jaisalmer is famous mostly for the Thar desert and the Fort. But Patwaon ki haveli is certainly one of the places you should not miss. Decorated walls,ceilings, colored glass windows, exhibits of a glorious past.. this place has it all. Photography is allowed inside the mansion turned museum. There is a lot of history and art to be observed here. I visited this place in March 2012.

title: Exquisite Carvings
review: Its not to be missed haveli in Jaisalmer.

title: Ornate architecture
review: A visit to this place is a must to see the typical haveli styles of this region. These are a collection of residential units of Patwas built on yellow sand stone. Intricate carvings, very ornate balconys and doorways along with usage of mud, belgium glass and gold brushed painting  make them a visual treat. They have preserved them well, have observed few renovations in progress. Charges are quite a bit to see inside the premises. A place to admire the artistic styles of architecture of rajastani havelies

title: Beautiful peace of architecture
review: What a place Patawa Ki Haveli , It is truly a one of beautiful peace of history. which should be visited by a tourist.

title: discover the fine architecture at Patwaon ki haveli
review: A fine traditional rajput style palace or haveli,it has museum inside the building,looks lik carved with golden stone another milestone of Jaisalmer

title: Nice place
review: Nice place from architecturAl view.

title: Beautiful Haveli
review: This is one of the best place to see in Jaisalmer.The haveli is very beautiful,very finely crafted.Enjoyed the trip there.Get a proper guide who can explain the history and make the experience memorable.

title: Amazing!
review: Being a history lover,I was quite amazed when i entered in the area of patwaon ki havali.It was nicely built and attract lot of tourists and travellers.There is a meuseum also which will guide you about the history of Golden city.You must visit it if you are coming to jaisalmer,its quite near to Jaisalmer fort,walking distance of 10-15 min.

title: Lovely place
review: Visited this place this afternoon. Well maintained,  and clean and gives visitors an insight into life as it was a few hundred years ago. Wish I'd hired an official guide. I absolutely loved the intricate wood work and the details within each room.

title: Excellent old Havelis
review: The Haveli's offer a great architecture and not very far from Jaisalmer Fort. In a narrow lanes are 5 building which was estate of Patwaon caste people. A good watch when in Jaisalmer.

title: Haveli with great artefacts!
review: This was the first monument where we went in Jaisalmer. It had a lot to see. And even some places to get clicked.

title: Most beautiful
review: What a sight to see this illuminated old time structure at night. It was just beautiful. Did not have much time to visit all the havelis in Jaisalmer but what we saw would remain with us forever. One must visit it twice, during the day and again when it is lighted at night.

title: Wonderful
review: This is a private property and they charge Rs 100 per person.Totally worth it. Provides great glimpse of the lives of the richest & well maintained, unlike Jaisalmer Fort.

title: good place for history & Ancient collection lover
review: good place for history & Ancient collection lover

title: A Haveli which is well maintained
review: This is one of good and must visit place in jaisalmer. It is well maintained and good example of architectural.

title: Patwaon ki Haveli- beautiful yellow stone art
review: Its a beautiful building of yellow stone, fine architecture and delicate work. We were not allowed inside the building, may b bcoz its still a private property and people live inside. So we just sat outside and stared at its beauty. I could only imagine how much hard work and fine art people must have given to build it.

title: Worth a visit. But entry fee is high.
review: The building is built in the traditional way without using water. It has an excellent architecture having many entries for different people those days. The haveli still hosts things such as furniture, utensils, various turbans used by different community people etc of those days. It gives an idea about the local life. There is an entry fee of 100 rupees for Indians, which is expensive. Thus the only negative point.

title: Patwaon ki haveli must see
review: Made of yellow stone it's beautifully carved ... Amazing work! Must see the inside. It's like a museum. All the old furniture and decorations are maintained. Transports you to a different era.

title: Stoned marvel
review: Delicately carved, extrinsic art, a must in jaisalmer fort area. The path way need development and commercialisation. Tourist marvel

title: Jodhpur
review: Must visit....amazing walking down the narrow streets of jodhpur and did a lot of shopping...the haveli is beautifully constructed

title: Magnificent architecture!
review: These havelis have beautifully decorated rooms inside, and there are exquisite carvings on the outside as well. Don't miss this if you go to Jaisalmer. Lots of vendors peddling all sorts of stuff - while it's good stuff, be sure to bargain well with them if you do want to buy.

title: Classic Royal History
review: Wonderfully built up Havelis.

title: Royal Haveli !
review: The haveli is fascinating but is now owned by private individuals and shops are opened in the royal haveli.

title: Great n beautiful architecture
review: Very beautiful architecture with amazing history. Get a guide for 100rp that will last for half an hour. Have to see it with your own eyes. Picture doesn't do justice. Whole tour will be about less than an hour. Be careful that the tour guide will take you out of the Haveli n to their textile shop nearby. Just say no for that.

title: Beautiful architecture
review: Beware of rascal vendors who can mislead an unsuspecting tourist to their shops rather than the Haveli. Having suffered such, had to forego a visit inside the Haveli due to paucity of time. Externally, the structure is magnificent with very intricate architecture and probably worth visiting.

title: Wow!!!
review: What an architectural building! Excellent. How the artisans have made this hundreds years ago without any modern machinery. All designs are handmade with perfect measurement. Amazing....

title: So majestic
review: Visited at 5pm, an hour before sunset and got the best view possible. Exquisite carving on the monumental facade will leave you wanting for more.

title: Must place to visit
review: Excellent place and witness the ancient art while making this Haveli. we captured lot of photos during our visit.

title: Mr
review: Superb and intricate interlocking Architectural marvel, adorning the stone masonry. Typical courtyard Architecture with highly detailed jharokhas and jaalis. Beautiful door ways with carved wood. The beauty and opulance of the builf form was a reflection of wealth and prosperity of the owner who got 5 of these havelis built for his 5 sons. Indeed the most memorable of the various attractions Jaisalmer has to offer.

title: Amazing Architecture
review: beautiful place to visit for those who are interested in stone art.... i visited with my friends and just loved it beautiful building with amazing art. i would highly recommend it to everyone who visit jaisalmer,only few minutes walk from fort

title: Best monument in of Jaislemer
review: Haveli is a must visit, it is beautiful. I liked it better than the fort which was way to over crowded for my liking

title: Very Interesting Architecture
review: Gives you a feel of Rajwada!!! Well made Architecture.... One can really feel the how in past our Kings might have lived a royal life!!

title: good
review: this is  one of the very good architecture.must be visited once when you are in jaisalmer. this is for max 2 hrs trip.

title: Best place to see in Jaislamer
review: This is one of the best place to see in Jaisalmer, since it is maintained. We can see one of the haveli's. better to take a guide so that you get to know the history.

title: Good architecture
review: Except for very old architecture there is nothing to see there . Two of the three are closed and you can see only one from inside and that too is shop and mandir . Dirty from outside . Not maintained . You need car to reach there .

title: its like any other haveli but with more mirrors and colors
review: Doesn't make worth the money you spend in visiting this place - but since its a tourist attraction - your guide will definitely make you visit this place. Do not forget to eat the pain-puri near the car parking

title: Amazing example of how we lived ....
review: The Patwaon were the business man during the king days and actually managed multiple kings businesses...i was joking to the guide they are like the Ambanis/Tatas of those generations dictating a lot on what happens in the country and kingdom :)

title: Beautiful Place
review: There are 5 haveli made by a business man for his 5 sons. Out of that only one is allowed to be seen by Indian tourist and two by foreign tourist.  The Haveli is well maintained and it describe the way the people used to live in earlier period and the their life styles.

title: A nice walk in the narrow galis of Jaisalmer
review: Its an interesting walk to the fort while you experience the local market and appreciate the symmetrical way every local resident designs its home even today. It talks a lot about the heritage that runs from old times to today's generation living there.

title: Overpriced and overrated
review: The visit costs 250rp (not 50 as stated in the lonely planet 2015) and is not worth this price. Do not expect a nice view on the rooftop. The best view is actually from outside the building, so no need to pay for it. As for the items and information about Rajasthan history or the haveli itself, the Wikipedia page will be definitely a better and wiser choice.

title: Palaces of Businessmen of lost era
review: These exquisite havelis tell a story of wealthy business family, central to silk route. The carvings are intricate.

title: Excellent interior and decor
review: It is an group of about 5 havelies. Different people own these havelies. one of them got renovated for public access with ticket. But with the help of guide we could get the access to non renovated haveli. It was a good experience to watch them without renovation.

title: Great architecture and carving
review: Five Havelis back to back constructed by Bafna family ancestors...of which one is museum, two are taken over by Government...one is rented out and last one where the Bafna family offspring stay (this was what was told to us by the guide)

title: Good place to visit
review: This Haveli is great from both architecture and historical standpoint. Enjoyed the trip there with family. Get a proper guide who can explain the history and make the experience memorable

title: A good place to take a glimpse of Jaisalmer Haveli
review: If you wana have a close look on Jaisalmer haveli  then this ia the place to be . Place is 5 mintues walking from Jaislmer fort so both can be covered on the same day

title: One of the main attraction in Jaisalmer
review: Consists of 5 set of havelis, initially owned by traders and now only one remains with the family. Two of them are with Govt (currently under renovation). Just one of them open to public.

title: The Haveli
review: Well preserved piece of history. A bit difficult for old people as the stairs are steep and narrow. A good look at life in those times.

title: Beautifully crafted and well maintained
review: This haveli is very finely crafted and is very overwhelming. It makes you understand ow rich Indian culture has been and though being crafted hundreds of years back when there were limited means and machines available, it has been designed and crafted with excellence. Its a must visit in Jaiselmer. Outside the haveli there are local shops which sell traditional craft works at very reasonable price,

title: History is preserved.
review: It's one of those places where the history is preserved while keeping pace with the times. You can find extremely well kept antiques and even buy authentic Jaisalmeri textiles.

title: One of the main attractions
review: The haveli has been properly maintained and there are people who ensure no one is littering. The architecture and intricate work on the walls is mesmerising. They have preserved the lifestyle of that time in the form of the furniture, clothes and kitchen ware.

title: Mesmerizing
review: Could not believe the beauty and height of this haveli. We also took inside tour. It had designed roofs.

title: Good museum to visit
review: Wonderful place to visit in Jaisalmer. Hire a guide to explore it to the fullest. Have a walk through the market and its close from the fort. One can see the lifestyle of Patwaon Although artifacts range from different periods of the last century.

title: Nice
review: It is a 3 storied haveli with 16 rooms.Beautiful carvings can be seen in the haveli.It is well maintained with ground floor having probably 3 shops selling handicrafts and

title: Another must go place
review: This is a private haweli famous of its architecture and amazing carvings. Must go place while you are at Jaisalmer.

title: Better than the king's place
review: This place is home to one of the big merchant families. This is constructed beautifully similar to royal palaces. But this is more authentic than the place where the king stayed. This probably might be the best of Jaisalmer excluding the desert and safari.

title: One of the most beautiful designs to see
review: Must visit place in jaidalmer. Open from 8am to 6:30pm. You can hire a guide here too for as little as 100/. It has a rich history. Lot of local shops to buy from and the stuff is also good. Do check for a shop in Chidia haveli. Plz walk down to this place it 5mins from Kanak chouk or the fort entrance.. will take 20min by auto rickshaw. Ask for direction and walk the narrow path ways.. its an experience.

title: Remarkable work without water and cement!!
review: Must see place if you are interested in architectures built in centuries ago.

title: Amazing structure with much detailed craftmanship.
review: Stunning! I've visited it twice, once in the afternoon and once early in the morning.

title: interesting
review: a visit to the patwon ki haveli is interesting. definitely worth a visit. the in house shops look nice. i did not really ask the prices so dont know re expense

title: An insight into the community
review: There are totally 5 havelis in the close vicinity lined up in a row some opposite sides as well. Only the first one has the museum and open for public. The immediate next one has a jain temple and commercial complex with shops. One is closed and the rest two are under conservation and repair work. Again the fee charged for the entry of museum is exorbitant, looks like it is under the care of private parties. Patwaon is a selling community in the business of fabric. Looks like they had good command on the erstwhile markets their lifestyle and the belongings are worth watching.

title: Not worth the Time
review: This ~200 years old haveli is supposed to describe the fantastic living of the rich traders. However most of the items inside are either renovated or new.

title: must visit
review: Very good place in jaisalmer,must visit once in life to see the stone work of haveli. Very beautiful from inside.

title: Nice decorative fort
review: Fort is nice with attractive interiors.

title: totally commercial
review: Do not waste your time here. you can see the haveli from outside. two brothers build the haveli simeltaniously. so two parts are different. apart from this chakram there is nothing much to see... the owner is after tips from foreigners..

title: Good
review: A good start to a day in jaisalmer is from patwaon ki haweli. Intrinsic work that would have stood apart in the city during those days. Now however on every other building you can see similar sculpting work done.

title: Nice place, great architecture...
review: Good place to visit.. its a bit expensive in terms of tickets (Rs 100 per person), in-house shops..Don;t miss its history..

title: Above mughal Era
review: If you think that royalty is only with the kings and emperors, you would feel that you were wrong after visiting this haveli.

title: Very good
review: It's must visit place. You learn how despite being filthy rich if you can't maintain your money it takes very little time to become pauper. You can only visit one haveli out of five. Two havelis is being owned by original owners who live like very ordinary people and you can't visit. Two havelis owned by government of India which can't maintain so are shut down. One haveli has been purchased by some person named kothari which you can visit. It's average by any standard. But should be visited

title: Well maintained
review: Well maintained and projected. But nothing great to see in it. No past history. But great artistic framework. Very smelly and bad roads.

title: Intricate carvings - worth a visit
review: Beautiful carvings in the facade of the buildings and interiors. Just a walking distance from the fort. Really worth a visit to see the intricacy and the fineness of the carvings - balconies pillars etc. Offers some great photo opportunities. Short but interesting history. Can easily do the fort, Havelis and the War Memorial in a day. These 3 would be the sites I would keep on the top of the list.

title: Lovely
review: Lovely haveli with 16 rooms.we got a great guide who told us all about the history of the place. Took lovely pictures there.the intricate stone work is beautiful.

title: Ripoff
review: Unfriendly, pushing staff and totally overpriced. Foreigners have to pay 150 more than indian tourists: that's racist.

title: beautiful stone works
review: if you go to jaisalmer dont miss this, the designs of the haveli is wonderful to see. We enjoyed a lot and taken lot of pictures. You can buy Rajasthani wooden Doll here

title: Visit it if you have spare time
review: Five havelis in a row. Mind your steps carefully inside. You don't need to have a guide here. Everything is well displayed with brief description . You should go on the roof top also to view the jaislmer fort from here.

title: Well preserved property
review: Patwon Ki haveli is one out of the 5 havelis which is open for general public to visit. The haveli has got 16 rooms in total. They have preserved old and very rare articles well and they are kept on exhibition. You must hire a guide in order to know what each thing is and the uses of it to people staying there. Also notice the roofs in each room as it is different in all - some made from wood while some have metal work on it. The most posh of the rooms is the living room which has silver furniture on the exhibition. Must visit place while in jaisalmer.

title: Brilliant Artwork
review: The artworks that can be seen here are exquisite and priceless. The colors used are very different. The craft of the building itself is also incredible.

title: Great architecture marvel but needs more care
review: This is a great architectural marvel , but  poorly managed. Horse dung stinks all over the place and nobody gives a damn. As far as architecture   is concerned , its a great mix  of Jain and Hindu architecture. It has exquisite mirror work inside and will strike an image in your mind.All in all nice place to visit if you can ignore the little things.

title: Nice Place within city
review: Area is in between city, Person cant reach by bus. bu auto or by Car it is comfortable. less area for parking.  we have not seen museum due to short of time but.. out side it is good one should visit this, there is no charge without museum. articles and some items are good u can purchase from roads which is there inside haveli. worth visiting this place

title: Rich family's luxurious house
review: This is a house of a rich merchant family. The articles stand proof of their rich life. There could be more efforts to keep this place cleaner. It is worth a visit.

title: Great historical place with amazing work
review: This place has art work which is quite different from Jaipur and Agra given it is fairly new. However it does offer a unique experience of seeing a different style of Rajasthani experience. Beware of guides as they don't offer much insight into the truth behind the real history. Must visit if you are in Jaisalmer.

title: Patwon ki haveli - palace, flee market...average experience
review: The haveli was like any other haveli or mahal that you find in Rajasthan. Not many specialties about the place.There is a flee market at the entrance to the haveli, if you are good at bargaining, you will get some handcrafts at good prices.

title: Nice but relatively expensive
review: This haveli is a large and popular one with plenty of interesting rooms inside. The price felt expensive relative to other tourist places in Rajasthan,

title: Must visit
review: Amazing work on sandstone. No need of a guide. Save money & explore the interiors on your own. There are two handicraft shops inside which can be avoided.

title: Worth seeing
review: A bit of culture. Some lovely artistry. The view of the fortress from the top was very nice and there were some kodak moments. Besidesv2 shops inside the haveli, did not feel like a tourist trap.

title: Amazing Collection
review: Patwa's were rich traders of yesteryears and there are 5 Havelis in the centre of town. Out of which, only one which has been bought over by Kothari's is open to public - the ticket is Rs 100 per person.  One can see the luxurious life style of Patwas over a century back. Some rare items like - kerosene oil operated Fridge, Kerosene Fan, etc are at display. Intricate carving on the facade and windows is worth admiring.

title: Nice ancient building with remarkable innovative things
review: There are 5 buildings. Out of this only 1 we can see. Nice one time watch. Ticket is 100 which I seems quite high.

title: Beautiful Haveli
review: There are many Havelis in and around Jaisalmer Fort.

title: Delicate, decorative architecture
review: Patwaon Ki Haveli is a pleasure to visit.  The building was constructed in 1805 and is a work of art both inside and outside; with the most detailed and exquisite design etched into the sandstone and colourful murals and frescoes inside.  A definite visit.

title: Not Worth
review: Not Worth for the money. A just another simple Haveli to watch. I dont recommend this as it eats up money & time.

title: Beautiful chattris
review: A tourist destination just a few kms from Jaisalmer fort. It has a museum which shows the ancient articles. It's main attraction are the chattris.

title: Wonderful Haveli
review: It is very close to the Golden Fort. You have to walk for 3-5 mins. It is really amazing. You can see the Golden Fort from his roof which is a excellent.

title: Place really Worth visiting
review: This is the only Haveli, that is partly open to public. It is worth visiting to see the architecture both outside and inside.

title: For those who love slow pace life...
review: Simple...nothing exciting. You see old architecture and fine glass work and gold studded ceilings...architecture is fine..but entire location and ambiance makes it little dull

title: A good old house
review: Intricate narrow rooms and beautiful jarokhas ...Only one part of the Haveli is maintained and accessible to people.

title: Beautiful Haveli
review: Patwaon ki haveli is a beautiful Haveli just a few KM away from the Jaisalmer fort. You can find very fine art crafted on red stone here.

title: Entry fees too high
review: Nothing special... New items have been added to make others fool...

title: Nice artwork, not a corner was left
review: We viewed this Haveli from out side which was down side as going inside was not permitted. One of the best thing about the Haveli is that each and every part of it is crafted. The guide told us that craftsmen were not paid salary and only food and shelter was provided of which after hearing was little surprised.

title: If you love Carvings and Architecture, this is where you should be!
review: Great place to visit. The carvings and architecture of this ancient haveli is awesome and makes you think how they would have done is considering the instruments available at that time. A beautiful masterpiece of architecture.

title: Fine jaisalmer architecture and a peek into a lavish life-style
review: The title says it all.Situated just a five minute walking distance from Pleasant Haveli, this wondrous piece of a museum like quarters displays all the artifacts of what some of the rich in Jaisalmer lived like. A 100 Rupee ticket gives you a peak into a life-style that is perhaps rapidly disappearing. Recommended.

title: Ordinary attraction nicely packaged
review: There is nothing special about the place. Out of 5 buildings, only one is open to tourist-visit. Though the place houses many artifacts, these are very ordinary and not very old.

title: Fairly interesting and nice Haveli
review: Haveli has been well maintained and offers a nice glimpse into its past. A must do for anyone visiting Jaisalmer.

title: Sneak Peek into the Indian Lavished Lifestyle
review: The Haveli is again a must visit but only if you are interested in architecture and history fascinates you. The Haveli gives you a brief glimpse of the lifestyle of Indians when India was a Golden bird. Not even a single corner or wall in the Haveli is left barren without carving and paintings. Each room and each artifact maintained has its own story to tell and all it requires is little patience. Visit even though the entry fee is little expensive and dont forget to take your cam if in case you lack time and want to capture history and relive it later.

title: Must visit
review: This Haveli is the example of how well to do our ancestors were. So royal and beautiful and that too it was belonging to a business family and not some royalty. Amazing carvings and designs on the outer façade and in the inside as well.

title: Interesting peek into history
review: Interesting and educational experience to go round the halls looking into a frozen bit of history. The lil lanes around the haveli have a lively character of their own, with hawkers peddling their colourful rajasthani goods.

title: A Beautiful Piece of Art
review: While the havelis have changed ownership, one of the Haveli is opened by the new owner as a museum. Although most of the artefacts in the museum do not belong to the original occupants the collection is good. In any case the original architecture of the Havelis is worth seeing. The Peacock painting in Haveli number 3 is very beautiful and can be seen without a ticket.

title: Symbol of Richness of Old Indian Traders
review: Five Haveli's built by five brothers. Beautiful Stone carvings, Old Utensils & furniture also kept for display in addition to the clothes etc.

title: Dirty
review: very dirty with lot of bats and really stinks.........surprised that its not well maintained cuz a lot of tourists visit this place.

title: Looks like wood but it's stone
review: Walking around the streets of Jaisalmer to reach the Haveli's was interesting as you saw much of day to day life in and around the narrow streets.  The Havelis are beautiful buildings and I chose this one as my favourite.  The history behind them is interesting too. Well worth the investigation.

title: a must see
review: a great visit, must visit. takes you to how they lived and did business. well maintained and has a lot of beautiful stone work. lovely jharokas, one must visit .

title: good
review: all should visit here . very interesting place, jaisalmer is the best place i have ever visit, must go

title: One of the best places to visit
review: This is one of the best places to visit. The amount of details and design is awesome. It has great history and can spend almost 1-2 hours minimum going through the details

title: Un imaginable carvings amongs all attraction in Rajsthan
review: Minutely carved and detailed net type carving maket it amazing attraction for all including foreigners, much betyer place than Fort Jaisalmer. The location is very compact and in residentoal area. The Archeological department should put high frequency noise devices to keep pigeos away defacing the Haveli and to prevent excessive maitainance.

title: A must see in Jaisalmer
review: A nice way to spend an hour or two, this haveli can be visited without the need of a guide. There are many signs which explain the various rooms and the staff are happy to point out the best direction of visit. It is 250 rupees per person which includes camera allowances. With intricate detail in the archetecture and furnishings as well as interesting antiques on display, this is one of the best tourist sites in Jaisalmer.

title: Finest Architecture of India
review: One of the Finest Architecture of India . Must Visit in Jaiselmer. Though this place is not easily accessible by car, one can take a auto to visit this place.

title: Very good
review: It has beautiful architecture.after 5th floor we can see the beautiful view of jaisalmer fort.all the floors we can enjoy the haveli architecture.but some rooms faded now.

title: Excellent Haveli capturing the life of olden times
review: This Haveli was the residence of the richest trader of his time Mr.Bafna. The new owners of this place have renovated it very well and you can sample the various aspects of life more than a century ago through well preserved exhibits. Guides are easily available and you can buy bandej textiles also in this place. A Must visit.

title: Nice Haveli must visit
review: This is one of the must visit place in Jaisalmer. An old style Haveli. If you want to go inside the building then here will be a ticket of Rs 100. But if you want to just roam around the alleys and see the haveli from outside, then no tickets for that.

title: intricate beauty
review: once the residence of brothers, now is a tourist attraction, typical haveli with small rooms and corridors, very intricate carvings, balconies with shops on the ground floor

title: Beautiful havelis
review: Intricate designs all around. Well maintained. Won't take much time. Neat history. Guide will explain in detail.Must visit place.

title: Mind blowing stone carvings
review: This place is straight out of dreams... the carvings can only be dreamt of... not only the attention to detailing but the sheer minuteness of all the carvings.

title: Patwon ki haveli
review: Archealogical Monument, good for people intrested in history. It has commercial activity inside the building

title: A life of luxury
review: This is supposed to be the largest haveli in Asia. Unique living quarters built by 5 brothers who were traders/merchants. One gets a sense of the life of luxury led by the brothers. The museum is well structured and maintained. There is a local street market just outside the haveli too.

title: Average
review: Not as oustanding as the fort but to visit it for sure if you are in around... Amazingly carved haveli with beatiful structure...

title: old haveli
review: there were five brothers who built this haveli and one of them is open for the public. the place is very crowded with peak season it becomes difficult to see it properly. you should visit it if you like to see the old cultural things.

title: Interesting but not unique
review: Interesting to visit these for the overall ambience but there isn't anything spectacular as such. There are innumerable Havelis in Rajasthan at the end of the day.

title: good place
review: good place to see. very historical place. different kind of haveli. center of the city. shopping market is very near from the haveli.

title: Attractive place
review: Visited Patwao ki haveli in Jaisalmer, a very good place to visit in d desert.. We hire guide and knew history of this rich people.. In past owner of these havelis were so rich and in difficult time of kings,they used to land moneys to d king..very well crafted stone walls with splendid example of architecture... We spend half day there & is worthy.. Must visit...h

title: superb architecture!
review: what an experience. The haveli from both inside and outside are a mervel. ticket cost of Rs. 100 for indians and Rs. 250 for foreigners is a tad too high, but should not be missed.

title: From a superior
review: According to the guide of the two brothers went to work in the contest.

title: Haveli of past now a museum.
review: A nice place which have antique things to have a look on.

title: Very good Haveli
review: Interiors are stunning and very decorative ... the place is  brimming with tourist and shopping activities

title: Exotic!
review: After visiting Palaces and Forts in Rajasthan one would wonder that the houses wouldn't be as magnificent but that's not true.The Patwaon ki Haveli is an attraction which needs to be seen to be believed. The intricate architecture and design with which these havelis were made leaves you spell-bound. Mainly owned by rich merchants and landlords of ancient era, these havelis look exquisite but are fairly smaller in size by way of rooms. Also each haveli is located in zero proximity to the next one making it like a cloistered neighborhood of enthralling carvings.

title: marvelous piece of art
review: really beautiful havelis. each one is perfect but one, owned by govt. is really in bad condition. a must visit place in Jaisalmee

title: Excellent
review: what a beautiful piece of architecture, royalty etc. the intricate gold carvings, layout of the haveli, glass work are really fascinating. wonderful memories to take back.

title: Must visit in Jaisalmer!!!
review: Spend some time enjoying the displayed artifacts. A guide might help. The building itself is a great work of art...

title: Exotic architecture
review: This is the house of an affluent business family but is more like a palace...exotic architecture, intricate carvings etc. There are also some lovely shops within this haveli that you can try out. The streets adjoining these houses are also very beautiful and you can enjoy the puppet dolls and sometimes live music while you are walking through the streets

title: Lovely
review: Very very nice haveli. What an excellent collection of antiques. Just loved the place but again a clean toilet missing from a historic place

title: Nice old place
review: Its a nice old property to visit. around 1-2 hour is ok to visit this place. We hired a guide for 50 rs to get the detailed info about the place. Actually there are 5 such havelis out of which 1 is open for public.

title: Really worth seeing
review: The place is amazing. Amazing collection and carvings. Must visit this first! The guides here are really sweet, and they do not miss on any details about the Haveli.

title: Old Is Gold
review: this place is one of the best place in Jaisalmer, best visit time is off season, in november so much crowed. hotel rate is very high in this time. otherwise place is superb.

title: JUST HAVE A LOOK
review: nthing is different than other forts rooms and all the carvings and all is great you r reqd to pay 100rs/person

title: Kothari's Patwaon Ki Haveli
review: A treat for those who love colours, ethnic interior design and architectural splendour. Located in the heart of the city of Jaisalmer and built about 200 years ago, the haveli offers a fantastic glimpse of the private spaces of the fancy, affluent and elite Marwari courtiers. The unidirectional tour is well organised, well-lit and well explained through elaborate info-plates at every juncture. It is a complete thrill to tour through the winding staircases into the beautifully decorated haveli.

title: Well maintained
review: Beautiful haveli 15 minutes from the fort. Lots to see. Entrance fee is Rs 100. For a guide you have to pay extra. lots of intricate work. here also there are shops selling thing.

title: intricate carvings- nice place
review: Out of 4 only one is open fir viewing at present. Its quite pretty inside as well as outside, with colourful glass settings on the walls . The carvings are wonderful and tell a tale of wealth and riches. This was apparently the haveli  of traders who sponsored the kings !

title: Gorgeous and Majestic - Patwon ki Haveli
review: Easily reachable place within Jaisalmer city by car or auto rickshaw. This Haveli, is distinctive because of its unique combination of colored stones used for the exterior design of the building. The ethnic built, wide Jhrokhas on cantilevers, neatly contrasted windows with ultimate craftsmanship are overwhelming at the very first sight. Bright and brilliant colors had been extensively used for interiors in combination with glasses, mirrors, gold and silver plating. Ceilings and walls and wood crafted with gold coatings and vegetable colors. Ivory statues, precious utensils, the then-modern appliances, musical instruments, arenas, room furniture establish richness, sophistication and aristocracy of lifestyle and test of the owners. A very nice experience is assured for any tourist.

title: Must watch
review: An old haveli with lot of interesting things on display. One can feel how people in bygone eras lived. Must take a guide for proper understanding. Guide charges Rs. 50 only

title: Old Architecture - A Class
review: Must visit attraction. Suggest visit to only this place and can leave rest havelis. very fine architecture. a pleasant very of fort also.

title: must visit!
review: Beautiful building, well maintained and tells the story of the past well. Don't bother with Jaisalmer's other Havelis!

title: Very well maintained
review: Beautiful haveli with excellent carvings.. A peek into the lives of the opulent in those times! Can get really crowded, though, during peak season.

title: Intricate work and good shoping
review: The place has excellent photo opportunity due to the intricate stone work and mirror work.

title: To see actual work
review: Visited same found very good art work but clealiness is very poor but once is it mist see how haveli should be

title: Nice architecture
review: Quite nice place for the architecture and look of the havelis.. If you are not with a guide be careful of touts. Saw people there trying to issue token to fleece money as entrance ticket, whereas there is no such thing.

title: Five Havelis
review: This is the place where those Jain merchants lived who were permitted to construct the temple within the Fort. In fact they wanted to construct their Havelis within the fort but the ruler refused thinking that over the period of time they will have more importance.So all these Havelis were constructed outside. Excellent symbol of wealth with intricate designs though many of the concepts may not be acceptable in the modern architecture but considering their time period it has its own importance.

title: Fantastic-- Must see
review: Very well maintained architectural beauty. Takes around 1 hour to visit. There is a entry fee for this place. A lot of shops outside for collecting the gift items, memoirs etc. at reasonable prices.

title: Worth visiting this haveli
review: Jaisalmer is famous for its havelis and this is the best haveli out of all the havelis so recommend you visit Patwaon ki haveli.

title: Beautiful
review: The architectures are beautiful and great to see the old monuments. Beautiful to see the stay of the kings rooms and kitchen.

title: Extremely intricate carvings
review: A bit hyped and nothing much to see apart from the carvings and architectural magnificence. We did not visit the museum in the complex. Otherwise we saw the other buildings from the inside, nothing great from the interiors.Exteriors are breath taking.

title: Awesome
review: Oh this haveli is better than the fort ,too beautiful, you can wear the rajasthani dress and take pictures there is a person who does that opposite to the haveli.

title: Patwan ki haveli
review: House of King with their 3 sons. Architecture is beautiful. Inside there is a museum.location within the city of jaisalmir

title: Ornately carved Mansion
review: Ornate Haveli near the Jaisalmer fort complex. Saw it from outside as it was converted to a shop.. Can visit in Auto

title: Interesting house but mostly about the gift shop
review: Loads of history behind this place and old photos of viceroys and princes abound but essentially it's a large gift shop. Probably worth a visit if you are done with the city palace and Jain temples but only just.

title: Magnificient..but crowded
review: Similar to Rajasthan Havelis & Palaces, Patwaon Ki Haveli too oozes grandeur & magnificence. The Haveli is basically divided into 3 sections & enclosed within is a Museum & a Private Collection. It is a must visit site in Jaisalmer. The only put off will be the fact that it is is cramped up in a nook in a congested part of the City near the fort. If the route is better, Patwaon Ki Haveli will draw a bigger crowd than the current trickle.

title: awesome art
review: a visit to this haveli shows the cultural heritage of rajasthan, only thing negative is that it is charged heavily and even for cameras but still then it is crowded and worth a visit

title: beautiful architecture
review: built painstakingly over 60 years, the 5 havelis stand out as architectural marvels. also a sobering reminder that nothing stands the tide of time. local shops inside the haveli have some interesting fare...bargain as much as you can.

title: Brings out the life of rich trading community & its co-existence with the Rulers
review: The Haveli with its intricate work on the ceiling & walls brings out the culture and art of the times gone by... impressive. Worth spending about 45 mins.

title: A beaiutiful building cum Museum with great architecture
review: Haveli means a Large Bunglow used for residential purpose. True to its name "Patwaon KI Haveli" is a great piece of architecture which is now converted into a Museums.

title: Stunning carvings and architecture
review: This is a very impressive building of rich traders in the days gone by. It is a museum now and contains artifacts used in those days which gives glimpses of the life of the rich businessmen. It's on several levels. On the ground floor there are stores which sell traditional saris, clothes, leather articles and other handicrafts. The whole haveli as everything else in jaisalmer is of golden sandstone and the carvings are spectacular. The interiors and ceilings are embellished with Belgium glass and gilt and doors are magnificently carved. This is one of the attractions in jaisalmer definitely worth seeing. There is a entry fee of 100/ (250/ for foreigners) which is rather steep. There are 4 other havellis like this one.

title: Looks awesome from outside
review: Great architecture from outside. Very intricate carving on the golden stone. Inside museum has good antique collections of dress, kitchen, etc.

title: Super intricate carving in the jharokas
review: Really awed by the beautiful and exquisite carvings in the buildings.

title: Great Wall work
review: This haveli is inside the city residential area. very good works on the walls and the wooden doors. Lots of shopping can be done. You can even take pictures in traditional attire at a very nominal fee.

title: Nice Stone & Glass work
review: We had visited the place on 18th October and found the entire experience worth a visit. There are 5 similar buildings of which you are allowed to visit only one. Various items used by the house owner who had got these structures built for his 5 sons were on display.

title: Good Haveli reflecting the excellent jazz and splendor
review: This is a nice haveli in the city. Excellent work on the walls and ceilings, very colorful and vibrant. The jazz and splendor of the Patwaon is clearly reflected in such a setting.

title: Must Visit Place
review: If you are going to Jaislmer, its the must visit place, the building so beautiful that it keeps you think how it was made. I advise you to take guide to understand every details

title: GREAT!
review: This one is a WOW property built with very intricate architecture and should be visited in case you have the sight seeing time available!

title: Worth a visit
review: Worth seeing to understand some of the more recent history of Jaisalmer. Good written explanations of the contents of each room.

title: Way beyond expectations
review: The haveli is very near to the fort, so not much traveling required.

title: Must do!
review: This is one Haveli (dilapidated mansion), infact a cluster of 5 Havelis that is really beautiful inside out! The Haveli has some rich colorful mirror and colored glass work on walls inside, while the outside has intricate carvings. Really a must do!

title: Great architecture
review: Enjoy the architecture. Visit in day light.

title: Historical perspective
review: Good original way and maintained well. Wish the archaeology deptt maintains the buildings under their control

title: Nice havili to visit
review: Cost rp 250 if you need guide plenty outside the door only need rp 100.

title: Average Place
review: If a person do not like to visit Museum the place is not good for them... but yes a photo in Rajasthani dress is must to do at this place

title: awesome place
review: Must visit and you should take guide at all the heritage place .. the guide beautifully  explained this main who built these 5 haveli was richer er than the king i heard what style and intelligence in building .. very well preserved artifacts inside

title: A must if you like Antiques.
review: The era that was before time but still relevant today. The Patwas were indeed known for lavish lifestyle and its nice to see the remains from bygones.

title: Haveli for Commercial Purpose
review: This is a huge Haveli which was sold by its original owners and now being managed by the new owners only for commercial gain...You can find some old stuff here but there is hardly anything which you find unique...

title: A wonder!
review: Well for starters there is an entry fee of Rs.100/- for Indians and you start wondering if the place is worth the money you are spending at almost every place in Jaisalmer. But trust me if you have any interest in art and architecture or for that matter history do not hesitate. The place gives you a glimpse of what India used to be...the real merchants who lived in the times of the very famous 'silk routes'. Their lavish lifestyles will throw You into amazement as it is nothing less than that of a King ( so u would imagine). The paintings on the wall, the intricate patterns of the windows, the memorabilia on display will all take you back in history. This is not just one haveli there are several others just like the one you would have seen. There are shops inside the Haveli where you can buy ethnic clothes, dupattas and torans at a very reasonable price. Place is a must go.

title: Commercial haveli
review: Almost every tourism place in jaisalmer is paid and minimal amount is ticket is to be paid to see the place, this haveli has a good architecture and rooftop view is really very good, inside the haveli there are shops for purchasing clothes and other stuff

title: beautiful haveli
review: this haveli in the center of the city with fabulous arch on walls, private museum is better and well maintained.

title: Must visit in Jaisalmer
review: It is a must visit in Jaisalmer if you have a day or two to spend in the city areas when you visit Jaisalmer. Apart from the stinking pigeon smell I totally loved walking around this haveli. Plan for a visit during oct to Jan to escape scorching heat. We visited end of September and yet the sun was unbearable. The entry fee is around 100 if you visit above the first floor otherwise you gain a free access only to view around the ground floor.

title: A Must Visit!
review: A must visit in Jaisalmer, the carvings is totally out of this world. Entry fee is pricey but worth it!

title: Worth visiting
review: After visiting all the palaces in Rajasthan, this doesn't wow you! But it does show you how the wealthy (non-princely) people lived back in the day! Beautiful architecture and artefacts. However, the price to enter this haveli is almost as much as any of the palaces and their museums in Rajasthan!

title: Good place and well maintained
review: Nice place but better if u hire a guide along with to give u the detailed information about the haveli. It also help in clicking pictures together if u r travelling as couple. J

title: The Indian History Speaker
review: It reflects the real haveli's history, very good sight seen during your visit of jaislmer and not leave without seeing it if you are on cultural or indian history trip this will be the best around india. Must see once if you are in jaislmer

title: This is a must visit place!!!
review: This gives a very nice idea and depiction of old days of the kings/queens. This is a museum kind of. They have reserved all the old weapons, clothes, utensil etc from the old days.

title: The munims abode
review: The Patwon Ji ki Haveli is an interesting piece of Architecture and is the most important among the havelis in Jaisalmer. This is precisely because of two things, first that it was the first haveli erected in Jaisalmer and second, that it is not a single haveli but a cluster of 5 small havelis. The first among these havelis was commissioned and constructed in the year 1805 by Guman Chand Patwa and is the biggest and the most ostentatious. It is believed that Patwa was a rich man and was a renowned trader of his time. He could afford and thus ordered the construction of separate stories for each of his 5 sons. These were completed in the span of 50 years. All five houses were constructed in the first 60 years of the 19th century.

title: TRINKLETS OF HISTROY STICHED TOGETHER AT PATWAON KI HAVELI
review: An amazing piece of history wrapped in to one lane. Each house a unique collection of art and craft complete with pieces of history shouting out loud. Each house championing its ware along with its blend of past. They sell all the wonderful fabrics, table linen, stoles, etc etc hand made from the villages of Rajasthan. Wonderful , beautiful!

title: Nice architechture
review: Nice but nothing much to see. Just spent merely 15 mints over there. Should visit as it is major attraction of Jaisalmer

title: Nice Haveli
review: Spend half a day if you want. Very nicely built and you can really feel that you are roaming in the past. A must visit place while you are in Jaisalmer

title: Biggest Haveli OF Jaisalmer.
review: Patwon ki Haveli is a cluster of five small havelis.This is one of the biggest Haveli in Jaisalmer. If I remember it right it’s made of 6 floors of which two are underground.

title: Patwa brothers haveli
review: a royal haveli built by 5 brothers .nice architectures and stories behind it. Good place to watch other havelies have same type of structures

title: okkk
review: its an ok place,when on jaisalmer city tour do visit lots of history and quite place,lots of steps to climb.

title: beautiful haveli
review: Well restored haveli and none of the attitude of Salim Singh ki Haveli, also in Jaisalmer. Worth the visit.

title: Next to a Fort!!
review: We can makeout that in old days how a business man flourished. Even they used to Finance the Kings working capital. To make huge palatial place in old days is worth seeing

title: Lovely Architecture. Lavish Lifestyle.
review: Amazing view of the Jaisalmer fort from the roof top. Also proof that traders were wealthier than the king! In summary - Lovely Architecture. Lavish Lifestyle.

title: Pat wagon ki haveli
review: Wonderful architecture. Old world charm beautiful designs. Shows how the merchants lived 300 years back.

title: Historical place
review: Historical place with old construction style to see.  You can visit but should not give much time. Do not forget to take photos.

title: A Gem in Rajasthan
review: Visit Jaisalmer last month and Patwaon-Ki-Haveli was a suggested by our tour operator. The whole complex is made up of lime stone and is quite ancient. I mean if you are kids then its not a destinations for you. But is you love to travel alone then Patwaon-Ki-Haveli is a must see place for you.

title: historical place and museum
review: Just like several other places in Rajasthan, this Haveli also takes you back in time. It was interesting to see how a rich family lived in this grand house.

title: Magnificent!!
review: Beautiful, beautiful structure with richly decorated rooms filled with beautiful furniture and artefacts.  It really gives you a great insight into the world of the wealthy Jaisalmer merchant families that built it and those who subsequently occupied it.  This a must- visit place for any trip to Jaislame!!

title: Beautiful home
review: Really interesting private home with some very interesting decor and antiquities, but it's the outside that is most interesting as the building is carved in seemingly 'lace like' patterns. I think it's a bit pricey, but definitely worth the visit.

title: A historical haveli
review: Excellent stories regarding this palace you can hear from any local people or guide.This architecture and the jharokhas of this palace is superb

title: the glamour
review: really great place to visit. while we were visiting there was a movie shoot happening at the same time.

title: Located in a very dirty place
review: Vistpited this place in December'14. Located in a very congested lane. However the beauty of this haveli is unique. This is a historical place. So always take a guide. The architecture of this building is magnificient. A must visit for all the visitors at Jaisalmer.

title: Looks like someone lives in there
review: When i went there, i just saw from outside and could see some clothes hanging to be dried up. I said to myself - What the F***. I am not getting in there.

title: old glory of patwaon ki Haveli
review: This is one of the largest haveli in jaisalmer which was built by a jain very rich famous man called patwa. this havali is 5 stories high and is extensively carved it is divided into six apartments There are remnants of paintings on some of the walls inside as well as some mirror work.

title: heritage haveli
