review: Nice place to visit & see..it is heritage place & complex.. Some of the part is only open to visit... In other part some of people are still staying...

title: Not to be missed
review: One of the largest havelis in Rajasthan, Patwon ki Haveli is a cluster of five small havelis. The haveli is dipped in an enchanting shade of gold and instantly draws your attention to the intricacy of its architecture. It is most famous for its fine wall paintings, beautiful jharokhas (balconies), archways and gateways. A walk through the haveli should not take more than an hour, and this can easily be covered in a city tour.

title: Awesome place to go
review: Very well maintained and lot of old times articles and house hold items to see. Very beautiful structure.

title: Good
review: Nice to see big havelis built by stones being inhabited by people from old times.Its magnificent from inside.

title: A Grand depiction of Rajasthani architecture and carvings
review: The Havelis we visited represent grand workmanship of Indian artistry of Rajasthani architectural display which are several centuries old. The hand carved facades of interlocking stone window panels and entrances are truly magnificent. The surroundings are unclean as it is in most of India and are not preserved well as it is done in the West. However it is a must see if you are a history follower or simply a person who appreciates the grandeur of our human heritage.

title: A very unique Haveli
review: I haven't seen too many Havelis myself. But this one was a good experience. How the people used to live in early days. The architecture is very good. we took photographs standing in the jharonkas. A guide is required to explain to you the history of the place, otherwise you would be just looking at the Haveli without understanding anything. Getting there in the morning time is good. There are some street shops to buy souvenirs. A must do on a trip to Jaisalmer.

title: Why the charges?
review: Why the charge of money for visiting the temples? Isn't it against the religious belief? Just loot the tourists?

title: Nice architecture
review: Very nice architecture. Gives an excellent introduction to historical Indian designs specific to Rajasthan

title: if you have time...go and see
review: a wonderfull place to see. However make sure you do not waste time at the end waiting for the tea they offer...they only use to sell their "expensive" stuff. Politely move on if you are not interested

title: jaiselmer
review: A heritage place..where you can enjoy and look the haveli..beautifully maintained...the least cost varities of cloth available there...you can shop.

title: beautiful haveli
review: beautiful haveli but should have been more cleaner as some section were stinky

title: Great Place. Must Visit.
review: Excellent Haveli's telling tale of the rich history of Rajasthan. They have now been turned into a museum as well and absolutely a treat to watch how the affluent of the times lives.

title: Work on the walls is beautiful and lovely historical stuffs!!
review: Patwon-ki-Haveli, is a set of five houses adjacent to each other -one of the most ornate residences I have ever seen.The entire haveli is made of Jaisalmer sandstone, and these are adorned with jaalis and elaborate facades. The most skilful stonework is done on the outside.The chief glory of all the havelis are the facades, which are freely visible.Two of the Patwa havelis are government- run and a ticket grants you access to a few empty rooms(the place opens around from 8 a.m and remains operational till 6 p.m). The interiors are bearable even on very hot days because the haveli is made entirely of stone which heats very slowly, and because of the good ventilation. The third haveli has been turned into a crafts shop, which sells brocades and embroidered textiles mainly to foreign tourists. The fourth haveli is simply a private residence. Finally, there’s the privately-run Patwa Haveli Residential Gallery. It is worth a look.

title: Exquisite
review: Rising above a narrow lane, we found ourselves in front of a magnificent building, a true delight to watch. Every window, balcony, arch is a work of art.

title: great experience
review: nice haveli in jaisalmer,it locate heart of the golden city.the way is very good and guide are wll to decribe history of this palce.

title: The amazing work!!
review: The Haveli is located in the interior of the streets once you reach their, The beaty and the work is unmatched.

title: Great museum
review: There is an interesting story about the origin of this building and the subsequent owners. it is full of collectibles and well maintained....really makes it a heritage. do take a guide to get the full essence.

title: WOW What carvings
review: The Patwaon-ki-Haveli has rich carvings in stone which leave you gaping in amazement. The shops within are no great shakes.

title: Intricate
review: Got a chance to visit a bit late in the day but nevertheless could see the fine and intricate carving done all across.

title: Art n craft delight
review: You can see only art and craft across the building.. really artifact to see in Jaisalmer... well designed and every corner you can feel craftsmanship.

title: Bygone Era
review: A truly outstanding piece of architectural work in terms of intricate designs, mirror work as well as coloured glass and tiles. Throws light on the living standard of well to do people in those days. Senior citizens may find it a bit daunting due to steep stair climbing.

title: jaisalmer
review: get to know about the history by seeing the instruments kept here,moreover it a huge havelli one will thoroughly enjoy the visit.

title: Amazingly intricate architecture
review: The level of expertise involved in the construction of these havelis is difficult to find now. The beautifully carved walls are fine to the minutest of details. Indeed a marvelous piece of architecture that is worth visiting. There are roadside shops selling local handmade jewellery which is worth buying.

title: Royally Yours
review: If you love the history of India and heritage culture of it, Do visit this place. It has that royal feel and ethnicity that you crave for. I love going to such places and experiencing that rich connection :)

title: Fine little home museum
review: This is a grand home, now preserved as a museum. It's on many levels, and has bedrooms and living rooms and even, if I remember right, a kitchen, preserved. By Indian museum standards, this is a treasure. Definitely go up to the roof, and spend a bit of time with the pigeons at sunset.

title: Must not waste time & money
review: Though a very beautiful gali and can be maintained as a beautiful place for visit. Very dirty & poorly managed place.. Must not waste time & money.

title: Trip to patwaon ki haveli
review: Nice place. Beautifully designed haveli...mesmerizing view from the front. Entrance is midst of a conjusted network of roads but easily accessible.

title: Peek into Marwari History
review: This is a nice place to get a peek into Marwari History and how they lived many years back. Lots of exhibits and hiring a guide is strongly recommended. the view from the top of the Haveli overlooking the fort is a definite must! We had a real good time indeed.

title: Very picturesque
review: Old building with very nice sand-stone carvings. Old building with very nice sand-stone carvings. Old building with very nice sand-stone carvings.

title: Huge than expected
review: It has total of seven floors of which 2 are underground.

title: must see
review: This place has got so much rich history about trading of Patwaons...The artifacts are truly fascinating. Please take a guide and you will not be disappointed with the amount of historical info this place has to offer..

title: beautiful!
review: amazing carving n construction...if u enjoy old antique classic construction this place shud b on ur itenary for sure...spend gud 2 hrs here & its sure to b gud value for time spent!

title: “Nice place”
review: The haveli is a living examples of how lavishly people lived in ancient times. It is a must visit in Jaisalmer. The place is very well kept and clean.

title: Golden era of Jaisalmer
review: I have never seen this type of Have lies in my life. Stone cutting was to good, It was talking about wealth of those people during those time and capacity to built such kind of expensive buildings.

title: A Heritage visit
review: The haveli is well maintained and organised. Some very beautiful workmanship to be seen. Also the collection of furniture and other items of daily use are interestingly displayed.

title: Amazing place
review: This is like house of Patwa who were very rich and their architecture of house is remarkable, its open for all till evening and it has 3 or 4 floors and from top of it u can see surrounding and palace in background

title: Worth visiting once.
review: This is a good and well maintained Haveli by the owners themselves. There is a entry ticket to the haveli and inside haveli is a sovereign shop, from where you can buy traditional things.

title: Excellent piece of ancient architectural woek
review: Situated in the middle of the city and exhibits excellent ancient architectural work.. Must visit sight..

title: heritage property
review: patwaaon- ki- haveli is very big haveli and beautiful heritage property in jaisalmer.musium is also very good ane historical.

title: A Grand Haveli: the best among the rest
review: This is the most prime, the gorgeous, the largest and the prominent of all the Havelis in entire city of Jaisalmer. The Architecture is marvelous, clusters are imposing, grandeur of the stone carvings all over the exterior are seen to be believed, elegant mirror work inside, ornate balconies are an attraction for photo opportunities. No wonder, the Haveli is an ostentatious display of richness in every sense.

title: Incredible display of wealth
review: Haveli was residence of the richest merchant of Jaisalmer hence everything in it speaks of the wealth they had. Very ornamental on the outside and inside decorated with beautiful paintings, mirror work and decorations. There is good collection of the household items preserved in the rooms as they were used at those times.

title: Excellent Work
review: A must see for the sake of its jaali / carving work.

title: If you have more time, then visit this place
review: We heard and read a lot about this Haveli but was nothing as such in it. It was really congested and was not worth, but if you have time, then you can visit this place.

title: Good but needs work
review: Yes you should go. It costs a lot 200 pp and says there is audio guide but not. The row of houses is incredible and the wealth of these people . Crazy money! The artifacts are entertaining - you'll get to see a variety of turbans and feel a day in the life of the ultra rich Rajasthan.

title: A home and how!
review: I couldn't believe the intricacy of the work done on the outside when i first laid my eyes on this haveli. It looks so pretty, i wish it had a little more space around it to view it from a distance. Take the audio tour, the guides are mostly lying and will just compensate by taking pictures of you. Even if there are many of you, and dont want to spend on so many audio guides, take one and the story teller in the group can retell the story to the rest. There is so much to see here, from the way they dressed to their cooking and lifestyle. Special mention to the collection of betel nut cutters and pagdis :) Try catching the sunset from the roof before you leave.

title: Historic Valu
review: old time reach people say Banya was living there and Haveli showing very rare art work on sand stone

title: heritage home
review: the intricate architecture of the havelis is worth spending hours there.do go in month of oct to feb.

title: Worth a Detour, Short Walk from the Fort, Great Rooftop View of the City and Fort
review: We paid for a guide (had to haggle him down a bit), but it was worthwhile as I doubt we would have tried to climb the terrifying suspended stairs to reach the rooftop, which had an incredible view.  He told us there was a (100 INR per person!!) fee to see the museum, but when we said we wouldn't bother to see it at that price, that fee suddenly was waived in its entirety and we were let in for free.  I'm sure he got a small commission when we bought some stuff from the shop owners that operated and housed the museum.  Probably less than the entrance fee that he probably made up on the spot though.

title: A rich merchant's home
review: Each of the havelis has different carving. But would recommend visiting the private museum. It gives a feel of how rich merchants lived from their bedroom to their utensils to their Beaty products and costumes. They even have a non electric fan and a water heater.the room with glass inlay work is mesmerising.

title: Worth a visit
review: Nicely built....recommend a guide as they can make you understand the haveli better....and can click good pics....nicely maintained

title: Can be seen if the schedule permits
review: The place (private haveli) is more about how things were in 1800s and not older. Much of the haveli has been refurbished. If you are acquainted with Rajasthani culture, you will find it OK, else you will find it good. You can also click some good pics in and around the haveli.

title: A businessman's residence fit for royalty
review: The approach to this monument is an inconspicuous narrow lane.  This is a cluster of 5 grandiose mansions built by a business family over 200 years ago.  They were financiers and traders of silver, brocades and opium.  The architecture and carvings of these 3 storey homes are incredible.  Now it is home to the government offices of the Archeological Survey of India and State art and craft department.  The first and third havelis are fully restored and must be visited.  The second and fourth are closed for restoration.  The fifth is occupied by the most fortunate owners and hence out of visitor purview.  Budget at least 2 hours here.

title: Mind-boggling details
review: I have never seen a mansion/palace/whatever you want to call it that has this much detail on the facade. There are of course a lot of other historic buildings one can think of, but no, this is really one of its kind. And when you think how much time it really takes to carve details into sandstone! Impressive!

title: Golden city ride continues
review: After visiting the Jaisalmer Fort we reached the Patwaon ki Haveli. This place was the residence of the richest merchant of Jaisalmer. And his wealth is remarkably showcased in the building and the objects that have been preserved.

title: You must go there !
review: First, Patwa ki Haveli is an absolute wonder of architecture. Then, if you want to purchase craftwork from Rajasthan, the shop there is the best one : Of course, it has always been the place where the caravans from the Silk road used to stop, and to make comerce with, since hundred of years... The quality there is the best you can find in the whole area, and the prices are fair.

title: One of the best Haveli
review: This is one of the best Haveli you can find in Jaisalmer.I found it very nice,beautiful designed and crafted.You can go inside and top of the haveli thereby visiting all floors.The best part was wall design done to perfection.You can spent some time visiting all floors.I recommend to visit this haveli when you are on trip to jaisalmer.

title: Picturesque
review: The intricate carvings on these  havelis are mesmerising. The stone walls of the havelis glisten like gold in sunset. The havelis are multi storied. These were inhabited by ministers close to King. One building still has a resident. Don't forget to see the secret chambers where precious things are stored!

title: Stone carvings
review: The structures are in stone carvings of intricate designs. There are five havelis or buildings of which two are occupied by residents so entry is prohibited. There is a museum in the first haveli which has a collection exhibiting the lifestyle of the years gone by. The entry is with a fee. Approximately an hour is required to see and there are timings for entry.

title: just took a glimpse from outside
review: Since we saw the fort and was not at all impressive or intersting looking at this haveli from outside only did not interest us so we did not go inside but the outer builing was again very beautiful work of carving i guess

title: Patwaon Ki Haveli = Carving + Shopping...!!
review: Its all about carvings and shopping.

title: Nice place
review: If your are visiting the Patwaon ki haweli then my recommendation is to visit the private haveli .You need to spend more bucks .Take a guide with you. The private haveli is having museum so all the people who have interest in history or want to revisit the earlier time they will enjoy it.

title: Beautiful Mansion
review: The haveli is a living examples of how lavishly people lived in ancient times. It is a must visit in Jaisalmer. The place is very well kept and clean.

title: Mesmerising.....!
review: if you have not seen this Haveli then you have not seen Jaisalmer....! The carving and also the history associated with it is very interesting...

title: No regret if you miss
review: The place is good for those who are highly interested in historical stuff. For others, nothing much to miss.

title: Awesome
review: all the Manson were a show of there wealth and the the skill of the artist of that age..  do pay up and go to the one run by the private firms they actually have some artifacts the  government owned building only has bats and art for company....

title: True and life time experience
review: Very colorful, artistic, innovative.

title: Worth visiting
review: It's definitely worth a visit, each room and ornaments within are described well by small posters, we thought this was a nice touch. Intriguing to see how the wealthy lived in this era. Particularly liked the explanation of turban colours.

title: Life of the Kings
review: Amazing and magnificent architecture all around the palace . It starts at one place and gets over on the other side of the road. The Kings have taken care of the place to the minutest detains .. The place has one of the best rock carvings on INDIA . Each floor is different and the plug cards explain them in detail. The paths are very narrow and crampy .

title: Beautiful place
review: This is the haveli which looks the most beautiful from outside, though the inside is stuffed with shops which sell merchandise. Once you climb the narrow stairs, there is an opening from where one can get a good view of the Jaisalmer fort and the golden city. Must visit while in Jaisalmer.

title: A heritage site worth visiting
review: The haveli is amazing! the carvings in yellow sandstone are magnificent, a royal residence to die for! Wonder how the rocks have been carved to create such beautiful designs. In the city, just about a kilometer from the fort,it is a must visit place.

title: Splendid stuff...must visit
review: Royal residence of kothari patwas of jaisalmer ,such stone carvings are rarest to be seen. ..gud to see a very well maintained heritage site....picturese site...must visit fr all...

title: fascinating look into traditional life in Rajasthan
review: Haveli life stands apart from living in suburban Rajasthan.  Families feel they must maintain traditions.  Seeing some of these traditions is fascinating, and this haveli is one good place to learn about them.

title: Patwaon Ki Haveli
review: one of the many havelis in Jaisamler...just about walking distance from Jaisalmer fort...can get some good photo opportunity here...if interested can go inside haveli and see...

title: A merchant house in the middle of rajputs
review: If you think Rajasthan is all about warriors and their forts and their weapon collections come visit this household near the fort . This haveli consists of chambers where business meetings took place where account book ledgers are kept . Hookahs chess board thick account books . Less weapons. That's something different . The museum is good . Awesome collection of combs and turbans and crockery. No canons or swords but more ledgers and hookahs

title: Good art work
review: It is 5 havelis which have amazing work  Beautiful work and looks good as all havelis have fine work

title: Glimpse of traders' lives in bygone era
review: The complex consists of five old 'havelis' built in 19th century which belonged to a prosperous family of traders. One of the havelis has been converted into a museum displaying various artefacts. Most of the rooms have been restored and well maintained giving a glimpse of life. Visitors must hire services of an experienced guide who can explain various facets of life in good old days in a desert town devoid of modern facilities. The story of how water was reused several times by the people living in the haveli is specially intriguing.

title: Really a master piece
review: You must visit this place. Its at the foothills of the fort. It best to visit this place with a guide so that you really know more about the reason of its existence. There is also a museum in 1 of the 5 havelis, but we did not visit it.

title: Impressive piece of history
review: Walk around the lanes and bylines of Jaisalmer around the fort and you are sure too see some beautiful pieces of architectural history of which one is Patwon ki Haveli. The beautiful architecture will leave you spellbound and some stories from the guide will leave a smile on you face. Browse the shops around but bargain for sure before you buy anything.

title: ART AND ARCHITECTURE-----
review: PATWON KI HAWELI---Once it was residential houses of rich business men of Jaisalmer---art and architecture of this building is as rich as the richness of business men lived here in bygone era---made of local yellow stones it is constructed in way so give a natural cooling in this desert city where temperature in summer goes too high----thanks-SSS

title: Awesome experience
review: Patwon ki Haveli is the must see destination of Jaisalmer. A jaw dropping experience. The carving work in yellow stone is outstanding and it has withstood the 200 years of weathering too. It also tells a lot about the richness of this place, which was due to the strategic location of Jaisalmer on Silk Route, which lost its importance due to increasing trade through sea routes and a final full stop due to Indo-Pak partition.

title: Beautiful Carving
review: I visited this place on Feb 14..Superb piece of Architectural front.

title: Worth visting
review: The haveli is very nice with good museum and nice collection. It is located little inside the main market.

title: class
review: A must see place !! These Haveli's are one of the historical and architectural genius..Its huge and crafted amazingly..

title: idea of living
review: these haveli gives the idea about how peoples lived in earlier days. how they use wooden logs in ceilings to reduce the hotness of rooms!!!

title: Magnificent
review: This is the most magnificent structure in jaisalmer and is a must visit. It is only half a mile from the fort area and offers a stunning view of the fort from its roof.

title: Awesome architecture
review: Patwaon ki Haveli is set of 5 havelis each aking around 12 years to be built. The architecture and carving work on yellow sandstone is astonishing.

title: In search of history
review: Haveli's are the reflection of history and when you visited them, you can drive back to past history. Patwaon-ki-Haveli is one of the finest Haveli in Jaisalmer. Unfortunately very narrow paths with crowded roads full with people, cows etc. etc. makes you a memorable journey to remember.

title: A great display of wealth... and class
review: Our local tour guide was not too enthusiastic about taking us there, offering to show similar places elsewhere. We are glad we insisted; this is a superb piece of design and architecture. Miss it at your own peril.

title: Very beautiful architecture and worth a visit
review: We really like the way this has been built. We found a guide of 50 rupees and we should go there with a guide to understand the place.

title: Must see
review: The haveli is made with excellent works of stone and the collections of various thngs is also very impressive.

title: Just another majestic haveli
review: The outside of the haveli is majestic. Inside it is just another huge haveli. Not very impressive. My suggestion is do not buy rs 70 ticket to enter the haveli.

title: Awesome
review: The havelis are built in the narrow lanes of Jaisalmer and there's no clear directions which lead you there. So if you're of foot this can be a bit of a maze to solve and get there.

title: A must visit in Jaisalmer
review: Its one of the best Havelis we visited in Rajasthan. The architecture was great with beautufully curved stones and and decorations in the rooms were awesome. They have maintained almost each and every items of the 18th century Haveli. You can have a glimpse of the 18th centuary living style from this place. You can also have a great view of the entire Jaisalmer city along with Fort from its terrace. Its a must visit in Jaisalmer.

title: Beautiful exterior
review: The intricate details in the carvings are really beautiful .however found not much substance inside . Was disappointed

title: Just Old architecture
review: Just a old architectural building with the minute hand made works on the walls & bricks worth seeing.........

title: Nice designs
review: Nice designs done on wall. However be careful, there are about 3-4 of them which claim to be original haveli. But find out the govt owned one and visit it. The govt one is the only one worth visiting

title: Superb !
review: Superb piece of Architectural front. WOW is the word. exquisite pieces of works with yellow stone. Luv the parking system - u pay once at any one location in the city & it's valid through out !

title: Beautiful!
review: This is celebrated as the best haveli in Jaisalmer and it lives true to this. It is a marvelous piece of architecture. You can keep gazing at the intricate carvings.

title: Haveli tells Patwaon ki wealth
review: That was a golden age for Rajasthani traders to gather wealth and wealth reflects evey where in these building - Patwaon have perfectly copied the Mughals, but the buildings are congested, multi-storied stiff with narrow stairs

title: A true reflection of Royal Living and Power of Money.!
review: Time spend would be 45 mins.

title: Marvelious Worksmanship
review: Marvelious Worksmanship. A must visit when at Jaisalmer. The minute work done on stones is really amazing and anyone who loves art would be happy to be here....

title: Beautiful Haveli
review: Patwaon-Ki-Haveli is a fine example of the amazing craftsmanship that was involved in Haveli construction.

title: Beautiful private wealthy home
review: These are actually 5 private homes built by a rich merchant for his sons. The merchant used to lend money to the king. Imagine the richness of his homes. The stones that adorn the palace on the façade and also inside are majestically and intricately carved. The rooms are richly adorned. The palace gives a hint how a wealthy family was living and the kind of environment where they were living. Very interesting and beautiful. You don't need a guide because there is lots of written information inside.

title: Architecture treat
review: A must visit . There is a entry fees but the architecture is a treat .Its been wonderfully constructed.

title: Knockout Jaisalmer architecture
review: Jaisalmer, that splendid city near the Pakistan border, has fabulous architecture.  Some if shows up in the old havelis (former homes for large families).  The stonework looks like lace, but it isn't!  Fascinating stuff--like the entire city.

title: Fantastic.
review: Fantastic ornately carved haveli. Absolutely gorgeous to look at from the outside, but also very interesting inside, with museum exhibits. We had a guide to show us round, and he was good.

title: Could be cleaner
review: Interesting, though not too different from any other havelis you would have seen anywhere else. The surroundings are very cramped.

title: Patwaon-ki-haveli Jaisalmer Rajsthan
review: It is a beautiful haveli in entire Jaisalmer.It is five stories haveli.Each and every window,door,balcony,Rooms are beautifully carved.The jewellars are called patwa in Rajsthan.It is a wonderful place.Once upon a time jewellars were reacher than king.The jewellars community were gifting to king on ocassion and festivals,gold,ornaments,diamonds to king.There ws a big business with Pakistan and gulf countries.It is a must to see who visit Jaisalmer.

title: Excellent
review: Great architecture highlighting different rooms used for cooking, dressing, playing, finance department. Items on display include historical stuff that keeps you engaged and enthralled.

title: Nice place . great architecture
review: Very nice place. Great architecture. Must visit while you are in Jaisalmer. Its heritage site and expeditions got to be realistic if want to enjoy it.

title: Best amongst 3 Havelis of Jaisalmer
review: This is the biggest and most grand of all Havelis of Jaisalmer. Do visit the place to observe how beautifully the houses were made at that time..

title: fascinating interiors
review: This is a row of 5 grand townhouses originally built for members of the same merchant family. The exteriors are covered with gorgeous rich carving. Starting at the top of the street at the west end the first one is run by a trust which charges for admission, and is largely furnished as it was, or might have been, for the c19 merchant family, with some further small displays of, for example, turbans and musical instruments. The interiors were fascinating and one gets a real impression of the how the house worked. It was a really good visit.The second and fourth houses were not open to visitors. The third one, which is more modest, was open in return for a donation. There is less in it but it was still worth wandering round and there is some elaborate decoration. The fifth house is very large and seemed to be run as an official museum. Again it was fairly bare inside, but the architecture is very interesting and there are fine views from the terrace on the roof. Altogether they were a great treat, especially as we found few other opportunities to see inside havelis elsewhere in Rajastan.

title: Nice architecture
review: The Haveli tour was also great, one should definitely not miss it. Although there was only two furnished Havelies in jan 2015 but the visit is worth. You get a view of the city and the fort and also enjoy the old architecture and traditional objects the families used to own.

title: All that Money can buy!!!
review: Great piece of art & architecture. Detailed work is un-parallel. Really Beautiful. A true reflection of all that Money can buy even at that time.

title: Shabbily kep
review: Havelis are currently being used by the dissidents of the Raja's ministers.  One cannot go inside but see only from outside.  Very shabbily kept place. What a waste if we are not able to protect these wonderful heritage structures from falling apart.  The carvings on these havalis are beautiful.

title: Beautifully Carved...!
review: It is the first haveli which have been erected in Jaisalmer. This haveli is a cluster of five havelis,

title: one of the best place....must visit
review: Beautiful work of art and culture. Lot is there to display the lifestyle of traders...centuries back. intricate work.

title: Words can't describe it
review: It is very beautiful. There are beautiful curved pillors, corridors, roofs, etc. The exteriors were also curved beatifully.

title: its ok
review: Haveli architecture is good, you will be amazed to see the work and will be surprised how they may have done in past. Not much to see inside. worth visiting if you are interested in history and art.

title: Magnificent Work
review: The art work on the walls is mesmerizing, couldn't find better than this. Each and every stone is carved so well that you just can't stop clicking images.

title: Great architecture
review: Its a group of 5 buildings next to each there (for 5 brothers). This place is great to study the architecture and planning capabilities more than 400 years ago - recommend that one visits this place just to see this. Visit the one manned by the government - its the 5th building.

title: Old era royality and charm
review: Must visit place in Jaisalmer, you get see will see marvelous architecture of India. These Havelis are symbol of Royality of that era.

title: Okay...
review: Too hyped by the locals as one of the best places to be...Although it is built with lots of carving and old engineering...some portions of it looks scary..

title: Architectural beauty
review: You will find many havelis in this area. We went in one of those. Beautiful architecture  both in interior and exterior. Really these havelis are architectural beauties. Do visit.

title: Exceptionally grand
review: Amongst so many breathtaking haveli in Jaisalmir, this one is the grandest.  Fortunately there is a courtyard opposite its façade, giving you the ability to step back and admire its intricately detailed carving.

title: Great architectural work
review: One of the most beautiful carvings on the windows can be found here... its really a piece of art which will make you question how can someone be this immaculate in designing!

title: Intricate designs
review: Its a well maintained haveli. Though the the whole jaisalmer city is build with detailed and fine designs, this haveli gives you the insight of royal living. Each and every room, which served the purpose back then, is shown with the same beauty. The entrance has Indo-persian architecture. It is a set of five buildings which were build by the brothers -first one is the main, rest are the museum,shops etc.

title: Please avoid
review: We went and found its a waste of money and time, its not maintained at all and please do not pay to guide its again waste of time and money

title: Main attraction of jaisalmer
review: One will be surprised to see such a stunning piece of sculptor and finnesse, must see, such a beatiful piece located in such remote desert areas

title: A Unique architecture
review: Located in the main city, it was built by a trader named Guman Chand and his sons. The massive five-storied construction, made of yellow sandstone, has five havelis - all intricately decorated with excellent representations of the art form that prevailed during that era.

title: Good to visit
review: Should go to Patwaon ki haveli  which is one of main attractions of Jaisalmer. Very good collection of old items in haveli, good architecture.

title: Nice architecture
review: Good architecture with rare artifacts. It is located little far from the parking and the roads are not very clean. So, be patient until you reach there.

title: Very beautiful carvings
review: The history of the Kothari’s Patwa Haveli dates back to early 18 century, when the patwas were struggling to set up their trade and business. On the advice of a priest at the Jain Temple, the patwa brothers left Jaisalmer with the intention of never returning (they were advised by the priest that their business could not flourish in Jaisalmer). The legend has it that the patwas were immensely successful thereafter and their business spanned across banking & finance, silver, brocade and opium trade.

title: Remarkable Houses of Noblemen
review: There is more than one house that makes up the Patwon Ki Haveli complex (I think 7) each belonging to a rich nobleman during the hey day of the kingdom. We visited a couple of the houses and they are remarkable in their architecture and luxury.

title: Not less than the Taj Mahal
review: wonderfully architected,excellently built with all aspects,salute to madons of that era who worked with stone which is not possible even on paper or wood, for food not for money as tradition of that era.vow

title: If you only visit one haveli, let it be this
review: "Possibly the finest in town" describes one tour book.

title: good for those who like to explore life in bygone era
review: certainly rated as one of most sought after places to visit in the city, the havelis are surely a work of art. with intricate work, jharokhas, murals and paintings it is one of its kind.

title: Awesome!
review: Loved the stone work in these hawelis. The hawelis are maintained really well - especially the one owned privately by the Kotharis.

title: Must visit
review: The Havelis is a must visit place. The work on the exterior and the interior is commendable and something which must be seen.

title: Not too great
review: Had been to this Haveli about 15 years ago and then visited it again last week. Looks a bit run down and did not give a pleasant vibe. Though it is in far greater shape than the ones which are either with the family or the government!

title: super architecture
review: simply unbelievable art on stone and woods mind blowing stuff do visit this place for sure. its situated in center of city

title: Patwon ki haveli
review: Pls visit the Kothari haveli (one of the 5 patwon ki haveli). Its beautiful with the glass work. I am sure you can appreciate the beauty. Its a bit more expensive than the archaeological society of india managed haveli.

title: Must visit
review: Its a nice historical place. Needs to be bit more well kept, I think its very crowded and needs to be better maintained. good celings to be seen . Nothing much to eat . A good cafeteria would be good

title: grand residence
review: I bought the entry  ticket and visited this Haveli(residence of Patwa

title: Out of the world carvings
review: An antique Haveli where presently nobody lives. Its amazing how at that point in time it was constructed.

title: Beautiful, intricate carvings
review: The havelis are a series of homes of the trader community which are really beautiful because of the carvings and the architecture. However each house has an entry fee which is quite high....

title: great work
review: still in use by people to stay, still it has many architectural wonders and history. Needs about 3 hrs to explore the complete place.

title: total 5 haveli
review: must visit....love to see the carving done on stone....guide a must....people around are arrogant and use sharp language...

title: Beautiful Haveli
review: Nice place to visit in Jaisalmer walking distance from the fort. Though the entry charges with camera is very high. I dont understand the concept of entry with camera for still pictures and camera for video. People have mobile phone with cameras they can click pictures with that. its highly disappointing to pay so huge entry charges at every place in Rajasthan if you want to carry camera with you to these havelis and forts. Apart from this Patwaon ki haveli is beautiful and you get the feel of how people lived in past.

title: Super ... Carving and Stone cutting
review: Its unbelievable .. I am not sure how many month the work was going on but it simply superb so much carving and detail design and symmetrical. I like it very,  actually could spend more time.

title: Opulence
review: These hovels are opulence personified. Such wealth and splendor mesmerizes you. But the Patwas didn't heed to the curse and returned to Jaisalmer to lose all their wealth, as prophesied by the Jain priest

title: Must visit
review: This place has amazing detail and intricate work... The ambience is great. Its best to sit in between in the court space and absorb all of it. This place has a narrow street on which all these havelis are.. and it gets a bit crowded so watch out. Cannot miss this.

title: Good to see from outside
review: Located in Very crowded area in city.... the guide was not well informed. The art inside is appreciable.

title: Nice to see
review: It's a place where you click few memorable clicks for you to frame for life. The stone work on walls and corridor is exceptional. It does not belong to any king. Someone made these five havelis to be famous. And indeed he is successful for many years.

title: Nice museum
review: these are five havelis,but the 1st one which is converted to a museum is only worth visiting.This has to be one of the best museums i've visited in rajasthan.

title: Beautiful visit palace
review: Patwon-ki-Haveli is at a walking distance from the main gates of the Jaisalmer fort and is quite magnificent.  The first haveli is open to the public, rest of the haveli part, which is a cluster of five havelis, ca be seen only from outside.The collection of the patwas is really wonderful and stylish, shows how the patwas lived even during those times.

title: Overhyped!!
review: There is not much to see here...this place is too over hyped to make money out of travellers. It doesnot take more than 15-20 minutes to visit this place. Waste of time!!!

title: Must visit this place
review: this place is must seen for jaisalmer visit near to fort and market area. they charge INR 70 to vew the haveli.if you have seen this in jaisalmer you can skip other two Salim singh and nathmahal both these do not allow to enter inside.

title: time travel
review: this haveli is amaaaazing in size and content. so much to see and absorb. great example of the historical way of living and photos are allowed. yay!

title: Patwaon ki Haveli ( Patwaon - jain community business family / Haveli - palace)
review: this is another place about 3 kms from the fort, you need to park the vehicle in the parking lot and an auto at rs 10/head would drop u at the entrance of Haveli...

title: Awesome Haveli
review: the architecture was brilliant.  The intricate work done was amazing and well maintained after so many years . Little more help needed to make this more touristy,

title: awesome carvings
review: the building is quite majestic and well kept...really frustating story behind the legacy of this place; very near to the fort and can take auto for to and fro.

title: Good workmanship
review: Good architecture work can be seen in these havelis. Only 1 can be visited from Inside without a charge, one more is chargeable and rest are closed.

title: Over hyped
review: Good architecture but a bit over hyped. Surroundings are dirty and smelly (so is the entire town) - reminded me of the galis of Benaras

title: Must visit
review: This is a Must visit place when you are in Jaisalmer, beautiful artistry capturing minute details. very closely located to Jaisalmer fort. Lot of shopping can be done around this area.

title: Better from the outside
review: This haveli is really impressive from the outside but the inside didn't live up to our expectations. I would recommend to see it from the outside only and to skip the museum completely.

title: Awesome heritage
review: Beautiful heritage haveli of famous business family of the city. Patwa is a surname/tile in Jain community. This community is into business/trade mainly (vaishy). In beauty terms, it looks even more beautiful than palace of queen. Its a must visit place if you are in Jaisalmer. Haveli has a museum too. There are separate entry tickets for haveli and museum. I could not visit museum due to paucity of time. One can have full view of Jaisalmer fort from balconis of this haveli.

title: memorable visit
review: its absolutely must visit .. remarkable architectural work ...  its sad to know that the owner Patwas could retain only one Haveli out of five ... The approach road must be improved by local bodies ..

title: GOOD EARNING BUSINESS
review: I request foreigners not to take these sturctures to seriously. These buildings are of erstwhile servants or helpers to the king. Today they show it too public and earn while just 45 km away in the Thar Desert you will find poor kids of 13-14 guiding your camel, better pay them instead of these havellis.

title: Beautiful memories of the era gone by
review: The haveli or house of the old & wealthy Rajput merchants stand beautiful in all its glory. Each room & floor remind you of the royal lives. The display of pagrees, clothes, weapons, kitchen utensils etc are a treat to the eyes. The adjoining markets are great to pick up souvenirs & Rajasthani crafts like dupatta, white metal jewellery etc

title: Wonderful architecture and
review: Its a collection of 5 houses or haveli's of merchants. A few of them converted into museums.

title: Just beautiful. .
review: The 2 havelis are exquisitely beautiful. Ths intricate work and detailed architecture is breathtaking specially considering how old it is.but do take a guide here to understand completely.also the 1st haveli is restored so not much there is authentic.

title: Wow!
review: Some of the most intricate designs, and a fun place to walk through in/near the Fort. The locale is surprisingly inexpensive as well.

title: Beautiful carving!
review: In the olden day more carving suggested more prosperity! It is clearly a house of a very rich person! beautiful carving. The haveli can be reached easily on foot and will take about 10 minutes from the Forts main gate. Keep asking people on your ay for directions and you will be fine xxx

title: A historical wonder
review: This is one of the oldest haveli's in jaisalmer. out of the 5 haveli's this is the one which is open for public viewing. its recommended to take a guide who will take you through the whole palace and share the history of the palace. the architecture is amazing. from the roof top, you can see the whole view of the city. a must visit place. there are also two havelis nearby which you can skip as there is no entry inside and one can only see from outside.

title: nice architectural / beautiful carving
review: you should have to visit this place in jaisalmer.

title: Architecture Marvel
review: Small compact place but is an architecture marvel. Jaisalmer is a small city so all the attractions are very close to each others. Another gem is Shamsher singh's Haveli

title: What a beautiful structure
review: For sheer grace, intricacy of stonework and sheer grandeur as a dwelling...these took our breath away.

title: Royal Family
review: Even the Business Man had a royal life you can see this when you visit the Haveli which is now converted in to a museum there were other haveli along with this.

title: Must visit if you are a fan of Indian Heritage
review: It is worthy of being there in the top 5 attractions of Jaisalmer. If you are travelling with elderly or an infant this place is good only to enjoy only from outside. We took the 70 rupee per person ticket and inside was nice.

title: Old world charm
review: the staff has managed the haveli quite well and showcased the old world living of banias beautifully

title: A fine piece of Art & luxury
review: I was mesmerised with the exterior & the interior of the haveli ... fine blend of luxury & art ... a must visit if you are there in Jaisalmer

title: Beautiful
review: An ancient architecture that is carved to perfection. Fine carvings and designing that highlights the skills of people from the past.

title: just breath taking
review: no words can describe this as it will put even best of the best places to same in terms of elegance and richness. the cravings and architecture is un believable. use guide as he can explain you the finer details

title: Beautiful old havelis - well worth a visit
review: I really enjoyed my visit to this set of five old havelis. The buildings were stunning - so intricately carved and designed. And inside one of them, you can see all the old furnishings as they might have been in the early 1900s, which is fascinating. From the rooftops you get some beautiful views of the city and the fort. Another of the havelis is empty, but worth a quick wander up through, and one in the middle is full of handicraft shops. Outside, you can try on traditional Rajasthani costumes or shop for puppets and trinkets, and there's a great cafe round the corner called KB Cafe for when you need a rest, up above the tourist crowds.

title: beautiful architecture
review: The Havelis have a beautiful and intricate architecture. I wonder how wealthy the family was! We liked it much more than the Jaisalmer Fort.

title: Must see place in Jaisalmer
review: Its a must seen place in Jaisalmer.. it has great collection of clothes, utensils & architecture. It is a well maintained place.

title: Magnificent architecture
review: Architecturally most Beautiful building of jaisalmer. But should save urself from visiting govt undertaken part of haveli as u'll Not find any guide there & will be welcomed by bats only. Very saddened by govt attitude of managing monuments. But the privately managed haveli is magnificent. Must visit.

title: Beautiful
review: The most beautiful buildings in Jaisalmer. The Haveli is very nice and the craftmaship is amazing. Must see in Jaisalmer.

title: Must visit in Jaisalmer
review: This Haveli is a must visit in Jaisalmer. This is a cluster of havelis and the intricate stone work through out the haveli is mind-blowing! The place can get claustrophobic if the crowd is more, so try going earlier in the day to this place.

title: Real jewel at Jaisalmer
review: Patwaon ki haveli is a reflection of the beautiful and Royal History of Rajasthan, it is very well maintained and probably the most mesmerising monument in Jaisalmer .  There is a museum set in the the haveli, which gives an insight in the lives and Times of Maharavals of Jaisalmer.

title: What amazing handiwork...
review: Must visit to behold the creativity, the talent and the marvel that were the craftsmen who adorned these havelis.. Please do go with a guide.. Incredible!!! No fees to see the havelis from afar but there is a nominal fee to enter 1 of them.. Can take pics framed in their porticos...

title: Very artistic but not well maintained
review: There are 2 havelis which can be visited. We visited the one maintained by Govt.

title: Beautiful architecture but can be avoided...
review: The Havelis have some history to it. The local guides (1 or 2) will try to jostle to explain the history of the havelis. They are completely avoidable. The architecture of havelis is good but apart from the first havelis the rest are okay. There innumerable bats hanging from the ceilings. Once you are through them and the stink, you can admire the architecture. The first haveli has been bought off by a wealthy family called the Seth's. They charge you a fee of 70 per person.

title: Excellent mansion of old era's merchants.
review: There are total 5 mansions in Patwa haveli complex. Haveli shows wealth of Patwa brothers perfectly who are the merchants of old era.

title: Heritage preserved
review: This place is still maintained by an Ahmedabad business man who owns teh havel there is an entry ticket, has old stuff like utensils, fans ledger books, daggers etc, if you have kids and wanna show history do visit may click good pics here to in the mirror room

title: Patwa Haweli
review: Patwon-ki-Haveli is at a walking distance from the main gates of the Jaisalmer fort and is quite magnificent. It is a group of five havelis, one each for the son of a wealthy jewelry trader who made money in money lending.

title: Royal Feeling
review: One more attractive place within the jaisalmer fort is the patwaon ki haveli. This place is known for its design, and taking your picture with this haveli in background would definitely be an envy to those who watch it. Details the life style of the royal family.

title: Nice carvings
review: Me and my family  visit  this Haveli !This house  is situated in midtown  of jaisalmer  and it's famous  for nice carvings on the yellow  sandstone  We visited  this city with  guide sumer singh sodha,he is locked baced guide and knowledgeable

title: Brilliantly designed Haveli
review: Its one of the most beautifully and intricately  designed structure I've ever seen in my life.It truely represents the city its located at. Walkable distance from Hanuman chawk and The Golden fort,its a must visit place if you visit the city.It has amazing jharokhas and wonderfully decorated rooms with out of this world ceilings..a thoroughly spell-bounding royal haweli..:)

title: Nice sculpture.
review: Best of all havelis in Jailsamer.

title: Intricate Havelis
review: The havelis are very intricate and the architecture stunning. Kudos to the Rajasthan Goverment for preserving these stunning buildings built hundreds and thousands of years ago.

title: Impressive
review: Built in 1800 and 1860 it is an impressive mansion with fine carvings.  Five stories and the largest haveli.

title: very beautiful
review: there are 5 haveli's each one amazes you more and more... great architecture and each room is so beautiful... the haveli's are so well maintained... do climb to the top of few haveli's you will get a nice view of the city and the fort.

title: beautiful architecture
review: The Haveli is a society formed by five buildings which the owner build for his five sons.. beautifully craved exterior indeed reflected the wealth of businessman of those time...

title: Exceptional
review: The entry ticket is Rs. 70/- but its owrth it. The first haveli is open to the public, rest of the haveli part, which is a cluster of five havelis, ca be seen only from outside.The collection of the patwas is really wonderful and stylish, shows how the patwas lived even during those times. Each and evry room is beautifully decorated with stylish things, drawing room, dining room, sitting room all exclusively decorated, the colours and old paintings are great, a treat to watch.

title: Architectural marvel and intricate carvingd
review: Sarfarosh movie scene of mirchiwale is shot here as naseeruddin shah stays here !! Very good architectural marvel !! Mm

title: Well maintained, and reflection of royal history.
review: Architectural beauty is too good. The whole haveli is the reflection of  royal history of Jaislamer, Rajasthan.

title: Ok to visit
review: There are lots of bats in this haveli & they have a stinking smell. But the view from the top of this haveli of the fort is awesome.

title: Wonderful piece of heritage
review: Just visit and see. It cannot be explained. Its a wonderfully preserved haveli showcasing the lifestyle of wealthy merchants 200 years ago. There are 5 havelis in all forming a group. Only 2 are open to public. One privately managed, one government managed. The private one has a steep entry ticket, but is worth the money. The government managed one does not have any furnishings and fittings and has been stripped of everything except walls and roofs.

title: Serene
review: We visited Patwao ki Haveli with a group of friends. It was very serene and it is nice to see the way people lived in that dynasty.

title: A Peep in the 1900 lifestyle
review: The haveli carvings are best seen and appreciated from outside. However, one of the Haveli has been converted into a house museum and a walk through the few storeys helps us understand lifestyle of the people a few generations back. People who have themselves lived in ancestral large houses may find resonance with their own homes when it comes to places like kitchen and family rooms. But a few other rooms are specific to the Marwad lifestyle. Do not expect magnificience inside the havelis since the rooms are of average sizes but the collection of items and their arrangement definitely calls for appreciation

title: Beautiful
review: Wow this was beautiful! the carving and the colours of the haveli. really impressive! Definitely worth a visit.

title: Nice experience to spend few hours in the haveli
review: You will wonder seeing the minute art works inside the haveli. .The museum is maintained in a very simple way but its richness is very high. .tourists will get themselves clicked with local traditional outfit at a comparatively cheaper price inside the haveli.

title: Good architecture
review: There are many haveli's in Jaisalmer city, of which I felt this has the bet architecture. Good to visit place.. Not very fa from the Jaisalmer fort

title: Very Nice
review: It is walk able distance from the fort  and nice one to visit when you are in Jaisalmer. The Auto/Taxi drivers will say that this is far but do not trust them

title: Fascinating  haveli in sandstone with intrecate designs
review: The patwon havelis are testimony to the rich  and well designed heritage  architecture  that Jaisalmer has upto date.You feel no different to Alice  in wonderland  when  you enter the havelis. The cute little  windows  and dors..the intrecately  done walls and niches and colourful  decoration will leave  you  spellbound! The best thing is you will get a breathtaking  view of the Jaisalmer  fort from the haveli.

title: Avoid
review: Nothing much to write about. Not well maintained. Bats all around. Stinks. Can be a few photo ops.. Nothing more

title: Haveli for relaxing
review: Its not really like a big haveli where you can spend whole day but yeah we did enjoy by getting our Pics clicked in rajasthani Outfits which became the main attraction of the haveli, They give you prints also which make up a good memory...Can go if you have free time in the evening...

title: amazing
review: I would definately love to have it as a home. The intricate mirror work, the celing, gold, doors, jarokhas, silk and all. The haveli has been maintained quite well but again horded by little shops.

title: As expected
review: Nothing much to say not as great as we imagined. .. the place was not kept well not much details provided by our guide, so it was lacking

title: Exuberance!
review: This place is not a part of the fort. It was a residence of one Patwa family who were one of the few wealth Jain families that had come to Jaiselmer and settled here. Its quite good in terms of depicting the wealth and the lifestyle of the people at that time.

title: Beware of crooks posing as Govt offiicials & ticket collectors
review: Had a very unpleasant experience there - the Haveli supposedly has 5 buildings, when we visited the first building the ticket collector told us each building needs separate ticket as they are maintained by different trusts (some are family run and some are Govt undertaken). Accordingly after completing the first Haveli (which later on we got to understand is the ONLY visitor attraction) a local man posing as Govt. guide pointed us to a next haveli (in the same by lane). There was a ticket collector sitting and he sold us same archaeological survey ticket (the one you get in all Govt. undertaken archaeological sites) but when we entered the building we realized it was infested by thousands of bats and no human being can cross beyond front porch without having bitten by the bats (it was dead scary even in day time).

title: A haveli so big.
review: We never thought a haveli could be so big,contructed in a well planned manner and so well stocked.Situated in the middle of Jaisalmer,it attracts a lot of visitors.A must see.

title: Lost in time
review: the havelis are superb .gives u a glimpse of long lost time . Gives the insight on the lives of the people   long back .and preserved. The views  from the  terrace   are

title: Amazing Architecture
review: Free of cost guide available inside the Haveli, do take his services to understand the very interesting minute details of the building.

title: Beautiful buildings
review: a little letdown especially seeing the prominence this location gets. But all said and done the haveli's are a must do at Jaislamer. The art work in nothing short of brilliant and the visit requires less than an hour of your time.

title: Very beautiful
review: Very intricate architecture on sandstone..amazing colours and decently maintained.. Did not take a guide, saw everything ourselves as it was quite well explained ..Brilliant!

title: Quite a place
review: This place is quite amazing when you know it belonged to a trader. The intricacies inside were worth it and so was the stuff inside. This perhaps had more stuff worth seeing that the Jaisalmer fort.

title: Another side of Jaisalmer
review: Patwon Ji ki Haveli is worth a visit,  as it is the first Haveli erected in Jaisalmer by Guman Chand Patwa, a trader,  in 1805 and it is actually made up of a cluster of 5 small havelis built for each of his sons over a period of 60 years.  It is an interesting part of the city set amongst narrow lanes and shops, which adds to the atmosphere.   Beautiful artwork and intricate, mirror work on the walls.

title: Amazing
review: The haveli is over 200 year old and in excellent condition. Got a sense of lifestyle of rich Rajasthani Seth. Worth a visit

title: Beautifully architecture
review: 5 Jains brother havellis built next to each other. The first haveli is under private ownership, next one is shop and last one is under government control. The place is not maintained at all. Lots of bats everywhere.

title: Beautiful Carvings
review: Beautiful carvings and architecture done by ancient people. Lack support from government. It basically a street with 5 houses designed with finest architecture..... out of those 5, two have been sold to govt, one being housed by themselves, one converted to shop and one being made into private museum. Can see the difference between Private and Govt Museum - Private museum charges you Rs. 70 (Indian Citizen) while govt charges you Rs. 20 (Indian Citizens).... private is far worth the money.....

title: Beautiful architecture
review: One of the major attractions of the fort, Patwa ki Haveli is the major haveli (out of several others) inside the complex. Once inside, the route takes you through the life of the maharaja right from his games hall to relaxation rooms. You also have a small market which provides some exquisite artwork. A must visit.

title: A beautiful haveli that gives you a glimpse into the lives of the elites of Marwar
review: The elegant haveli with its intricate carvings and its beautifully done up interiors, alongwith items from the past periods is not to be missed if you are in Jaisalmer

title: Kothari's Patwa Haweli.
review: Kothari's Patwa ki Haveli is the major haveli, among others inside the complex. Once inside, the route takes you through the life of the maharaja right from his games hall to relaxation rooms. You also have a small market which provides some exquisite artwork. The carvings are a sight to watch and photograph. Go early to avoid crowds.

title: Nice Place
review: yes you can give a short visit to this place with great architectural walls. Close to city with nice photogenic views to be clicked in your camera. Do visit this place and see the man with big big Mustaches also.

title: The facade is where it stops
review: slightly overrated, this sandstone haveli is a marvel in sandstone and is worth a visit for a view from the outside.  There is a charge if you want to see it from inside, but I don't this it is worth it.

title: Brilliant
review: LOVED it! This is a must visit. We actually like it more than the fort. The work and skill of the artists is out of this world. Must visit.

title: Great haveli experience
review: We walked through the haveli and did some shopping in the top floor. The architecture and style of the house is pretty unique and it is one of a kind experience. We dressed up in local costumes outside the haveli and took pictures which was also a fun experience.

title: Even Better than fort
review: Supep interior.

title: A beautiful Haveli in the Golden city
review: Builyt in the 18th century and located in a narrow lane on the uphill vicinity of the Jaisalmer fort, stand the Patwa Haveli. The Haveli has one of the finest art work on display and also is very well planned and decorated. The haveli is famous for its decoration (art work on pillars, glass work and balcony called as Jarokas locally. The architecture of this haveli would be of interest to special interest in old architecture. Definitely visit this haveli if in Jaisalmer.

title: Master Crafted.
review: Five of Three are available to view and one can find the Great art and hand craft.

title: Nothing much to see
review: Commercialized. Nothing much to see here. The museum is just average and you can avoid this place if you dont have time.

title: Best Place
review: Nice carving on the buildings ,narrow lanes takes back in time . Shops to shop near by. Nice place to visit.

title: Better than most palaces I have visited in Rajasthan
review: This guy, Patwan, has a great sense of taste. He has constructed a haveli which is much better than most king's palaces. It is well maintained and a must see attraction in Jaisalmer.

title: A neat museum
review: It is a neat experience to see how some of the rich people of the area used to live. A nice collection of artifacts and worth seeing.

title: Nice place to visit
review: Been here during one of the evening.. Gives u a brief idea about a history of Jaisalmer and kind of people living around earlier.. don't forget to see the entire fort area from one of the terraces..

title: The only Haveli worth having a look!
review: It is well maintained. There is an entrance fee of about Rs.100 per head.

title: Marvelous piece of architecture
review: a cluster of 5 small havelis built for five sons of Guman Chand, a trader. These haveli are so rich that it was filled with instuments like Gramophone and Telephone. These traders are so much wealthy that even they help the king with their money. Their trades include banking & finance, silver, brocade and opium trade. Unfortunately traders fortune takes a u-turn and he leave these havelis to care takers and care takers sold first haveli to  Mr.Kothari. So it was renamed as Kothari’s Patwa Haveli.

title: Beautifully carved walls
review: What makes the haveli remarkable are the carvings on the walls and windows. Beautiful carvings and paintings on the walls make it a must visit. The haveli provides a great view of the Jaisalmer fort.

title: Amazing craftsmanship
review: Really leaves one gaping at the delicate and fine craftsmanship used in building these 5 havelis. Please go there with enough time in hand to really view these works of art. Hope they will be preserved properly for the generations to come.

title: worth a visit
review: its well worth visiting this place for the achitecture . The views from the terrace are spectacular.. especially of the fort

title: Magnificient - from outside
review: The haveli looks magnificient from outside. However, inside of the Haveli is not remarkable. Looks that they used to put all emphasis on decorating the outside of the havelis, but somehow did not do so on the inside.

title: Awesome
review: Went to visit this Haveli which consisted of 5 havelis built inside the premises which was made in such a way that you can dismantle the all the Havelis and built in some other place. The carvings and the things used at that time was kept very well.

title: delicate carvings
review: There are 5 buildings in the complex for the 5 sons of the owner. The jali carvings are exquisite and the place is a must visit.

title: Beautiful
review: Amazing place. It is one of the finest places I have seen. Beautiful architecture and carvings. Must see from inside too.

title: Glimpse of the Past
review: Located in a very narrow lane (you will have to walk to reach the Haveli!!!), adorns a fascinating past, it was constructed by Guman Chand Patwain 1805 for his 5 sons in a series if 5 stories. Today it attracts tourists offering a glimpse at Patwon family’s lifestyle.

title: Better than the Palace
review: It has better details than what is left in the jaiselmer fortress palace.Do not buy stuff like saree from the haveli shops, they charge you more.

title: Must see
review: Whats not to like about this place. One of a kind haveli in Jaisalmer, well maintained a beauty to behold.

title: Most interesting haveli of Jaisalmer
review: The Patwon Ji ki Haveli is an interesting piece of Architecture and is the most beautiful and visited among the havelis in Jaisalmer. This is precisely because of two things, first that it was the first haveli erected in Jaisalmer and second, that it is not a single haveli but a cluster of 5 small havelis.

title: Amazing craft
review: The glass work in the Haveli is amazing.Excellent carvings and a good museum.To me its a must view of Jaisalmer

title: do the rajasthani dress thing
review: Dressing up in traditional Rajasthani dress and getting photographed is the highlight of this place. Nice for shopping

title: Grandeur personified
review: This is a must-see in Jaisalmer. We managed to see one out of the five and were awed by the architecture and the lavish lifestyle of the rich in the 19th century. The arches, the decor, the silk bedspreads, the kitchen, the secret safes behind panels - all worth a dekko.

title: See from outside
review: Visit this place if you have time. The intricate work in the haveli is amazing. There is a ticket to go see the inside of the haveli's but my recommendation is to avoid that. Most of what you will see is on the outside.

title: Ambanis of that time!
review: This haveli is a must see and is different from the usual forts of Maharajas. Here the normal life of a prosperous businessman is well shown. You can compare the architectural structure and see for yourself why its a must see.

title: Best stone carving ever I saw...
review: This town is architectural dream from 12th centaury made by yellow sand stone. The carved sand stone Havelis is mind blowing. The workmanship is unbelievable.

title: Must visit.
review: Great heritage place with a fascinating facade. The interior in one of the rooms has been restored with mirror work and looks too gaudy and modern. But overall the beauty of the building itself is breathtaking.

title: Definitely worth a visit
review: It's like being a part of the oriental fairy tale... Very beautiful and impressive! The furniture, the decor, the atmosphere - everything adds up to create a kind of magic.

title: Nice Architectural haveli
review: There are five havelies together and the main thing to watch is their architecture and sculpure of havelies which was hand carved from Local Silavatas .

title: Interesting history
review: Take a guide - there is nothing for you to read, so some history/context from the guide is useful. They are actively funding the upkeep of the haveli from the ticket proceeds - so do visit, if only to keep this place alive and improving. The carvings and architecture are quite nice and provide great photo-ops, so that itself is a good reason to go.

title: Good example of ancient architecture and carvings
review: In the city of Jaisalmer its great tourist place other than fort itself. You can spend 1/2 hours . It also has maitained musium. Parking space available. The achitecture and carving are great. There are lot of shops on the way. Take guide if interested in history.

title: Poorly maintained
review: The haveli is quite big and has articles from early days.Certainly worth visting. It is a private residence. Though they charge tickets, very poorly maintained (pan spit marks , scribbling on walls...)

title: Amazing artistry
review: Displays how pompous the patwa's were in those days. The Silk route merchants who traded in Opium and other products were unbelievably rich and their haveli's show it. From gold plated wall designs to silver beds and what not... lovely place and well preserved!

title: Intricate carving
review: Very nice architecture, intricately carved. A lot of climbing up and getting down. Many people will offer guide services, but you don't need one.

title: Perfect place for Photo shoot
review: Nice place for Photography and I love the rough tarrain. Again as I always suggest to hire a guide (will not charge more than 100 Rs.) after checking his credential coz that will provide the soul (story) to the body (to you tour) and help u take Photographs if you are a couple or even with friends :).

title: Beautiful showcase of ancient art and architechture
review: The Patwon Ji ki Haveli is an interesting piece of Architecture and is the most important among the havelis in Jaisalmer. This is precisely because of two things, first that it was the first haveli erected in Jaisalmer and second, that it is not a single haveli but a cluster of 5 small havelis

title: Not well maintained
review: A private Haveli, Kothari's Patwaon Ki Haveli, with tickets of Rs.70/- per head, one expects proper maintenance of the display items, which were kind of in a dilapidated condition. Average look.

title: Really beautiful
review: We spend our evening enjoying visiting Haveli, It was superb and amazing.

title: Get transported to the erstwhile business paradise
review: Series of 5 havelis or business hangout places owned by 5 brothers originally. Mind blowing stone carved work in windows and thoughtfully planned interior layout. We paid a guide and he showed us around the havelis and shared all the stories and gossip. Without a guide, you will only be admiring the architecture itself which is not bad either . A couple of havelis are owned by families selling traditional clothes. Take time to visit. It seemed like the havelis aren't well maintained by the government which is quite a pity .

title: Ancient merchant house of Jaisalmer
review: I visited this haveli basen on a tourist guide recommendation and indeed it was worth the effort. It is big haveli with some of the most exquisite red sandstone carvings that you would see in Jaisalmer. It looks like each other square meter is covered with a totally different carving pattern and ones mind cannot decide which part is more beautiful than the other. The courtyard is dusty and sandy and in the middle of it lies the stone market place where people used to buy and sell everything from fruits to vegetables and from animals to precious stones and textiles...and everything amongst roaming chickens, hens, cocks, goats, donkeys and camels.

title: Havelies
review: long back these hawelis are owned by five brothers.doing business on this border town.now two are taken over by government. one is still owned by a brother

title: Good architecture but not well maintained.
review: Good architecture but I wished it should have been well maintained . On of the haweli I believe is not clean it stinks .yiur choice!

title: Nice from outside
review: The haveli is very nice, especially from outside, with a very detailed facade. We wanted to visit inside and had trouble to understand which of the three parts of the haveli we had to visit. One of them was very expensive and included a museum (we didn't go to that one). Another was free and shown by a local person and had some shops inside which they wanted you to look at (that is the one we visited). The last one we found out after our visit and seemed to be the right one, regented by the government. The one we visitied (in the middle) was somehow interesting but not very well taken care of and didn't smell very good (due to pigeons or bats). They asked us to go in their shops after the free visit, but didn't insist when we said no, so that was nice. The boy who showed us around didn't ask for money but we gave him a tip.

title: Refurbished haveli: Good but skip the audio tour
review: Some lovely restored rooms in this haveli, with opulent glasswork and furniture showing how the haveli would have once looked. The audio tour is a TOTAL waste of time though unless you can't read English as it simply was someone reading the signs. For this reason I have lowered the rating. Other than that fine to visit.

title: "Very nice Architecture"
review: One of "THE"places to visit if in Jaisalmer - the stone work on the havelis is out of this world. I could have spent hours just looking at the facade without even going in. It's barely a 10 minute walk frrom the fort

title: Average experience
review: Not much to see, but the approach  to haveli is different experience. Drive till last point and take a Auto from there... will charge Rs 20 one way.. stroll around haveli and do enjoy petty shopping.

title: Nice Museum
review: The museum in the first haveli is good but the guide fools u by saying he will take u to a tour of 5 havelis. right after the first one he say good bye to you. so just take care of that.

title: EXCELLENT FILIGREE WORK
review: This is one of the most breadthtaking examples of filigree work on stone. Do ensure that you see the two havelies, one which has been redone by a private party and the other in original of the Govt. Do take an audio guide if you are inclined, would be worth its weight in gold. An amazing visit.

title: Average
review: Very average is what I would rate, just for the maintenance of the property and its surroundings. Otherwise a good place to visit and understand the history of Jaisalmer.

title: Poor maintenance
review: I was visiting Jaisalmer for the 3rd time and found that the maintenance of the Haveli is very poor. I was told that not enough staff are deployed. If not taken care, it will deteriorate fast.

title: Rich with history
review: The Haveli has been converted in to a museum of sorts and is quite interesting. The history is facinating but the best part is the panoramic view of the Jaisalmer Golden Fort from the terrace os this place.

title: Time travel in the desert!
review: Enter  a different zone.

title: Must watch
review: 5 havelis are there.. we met a guide (i forgot his name ).. wat a good photographer he is... havellis are reall good ...

title: gr8 architecture
review: if u art lover u must go this place or else its jst waste of time,

title: A hurried visit
review: Liked the curvings of the famous Jain temple inside the fort. Fort is not at all maintained in view of so many Indian and foreign tourist flock in with some expectations.The local authorities and Rajasthan State tourism department should take some extra care.

title: Worth a visit to this Haveli (Mansion)
review: This is group of five Haveli together... Worth a visit to these marvel... Don't miss the Terrace of this Haveli.... It has a beautiful view of the fort... The Carving and Detailing is Wonderful.. Don't miss this if your in jaisalmer.

title: Impressive exterior
review: The exterior of the building at the entrance is certainly the most impressive part of the visit, but the views from the roof out over the fort make it worthwhile to visit. Bats can be a problem inside the building.

title: A piece of beautiful architecture
review: These 5 adjacent hawelis are beautifully sculpted from outside. The attention given to details is amazing. Try to go not later than 4pm and you will get a chance to go inside one of these havelis

title: Intricate carvings
review: Not very far from the fort.  Intricate carvings...don't miss the guy with the longest moustache...take a pic with him.  Also, view of the city from the roof top is not to be missed.

title: A must visit at Jaisalmer
review: Beautiful intricate exteriors, detailed interiors..the havelis are an architectural delight. The view from the roof top is most impressive. Beware of touts. Many Bollywood moves have been shot here. The 5adjacent havelis take about2 hours so try to reach before 4.00pm if you want to go inside.

title: Art and Heritage
review: While roaming in Golden city, you will find these five huge, beautifully carved structures erected together which used to be residence of renowned families of the city in old times. One can immediately fell cooling effect due to architectural designing of the structure while entering the street with the same name as monument.
