Every Haveli has separate entry ticket so you can choose any one of these to visit and can save on time, money and energy as all Havelies are somehow same from inside with multiple stairs to climb. We like the view of the golden city from Haveli's top. Exterior of Haveli deserves your few minutes time to be spend on appraising beauty of place.

title: Well
review: interesting to visit home, as maintained in good condition and with furniture, the other two houses are unattractive

title: Minute Architecture
review: Built by the erst-while Prime MInister of  Jaisalmer, these haveli's are worth visiting for their minute architecture

title: Its cool
review: Its a beauty. All the five houses are just amazing. So beautifully carved and jus tbreath taking. We only got to see them from the outside but wow. The bandini store in the fifth house has a great collection .I would suggest if you can..go there without a guide since up save money as they charge extra cz they have to pay the guides commission. There is also an old guy selling handicrafts.. Some of his stuff is cheap and really interesting. We bought two salwars from the store and one musical instrument from the old guy.

title: amging patwaon best
review: haveli very nice all very good very clean i have some mixed reviews let me start with the GOOD part- 1. if you are an adventure lover you will definitely love...

title: Beautiful old Haveli
review: A beautiful old haveli in Jaisalmer with lots of history.  The scale of the intricate carved exterior and interior will leave you mesmerised. Some of the rooms are beautifully decorated with painted mirror work and detailed wood carvings. Be aware that there are six storeys of very steep stairs here. The view of the havelis on both sides of the lane is unforgettable. Well worth a visit.

title: Impressive haveli
review: I visited the Patwaon-Ki-Haveli with Don't Complain Travel. I only went inside for a few minutes - I find it to be most beautiful from outside. Definitely worth the visit and easy to combine with a short walk through Jaisalmer.

title: BEST PLACE
review: Best attraction throughout the palace,they used sandel roof, walls are painted by gold,so many things to be attracted in salm singh ki haveli,guide  took rs. 100.,entry fee rs. 30 camera fee rs.Few other buildings in India can give you the feeling of awe that you get when you enter the narrow lane where these havelis are situated. Just the scale of intricate carving on the stones leaves you wide-eyed. It makes you wonder why you've never ever met a real stone sculptor before. If you do you'll surely give him more respect that a rockstar after you've witnessed the work here. The Havelis also demonstrate how our well-off Indian ancestors used to live. A private haveli even showcases an ancient refrigerator made of multani mitti (Fuller's earth). Go there to get pictures clicked that'll make you quite popular on Facebook :)

title: Worth seen  beautiful architecture
review: I enjoyed my visit to this Haveli,  a historical monument.  Ancient period of Patwas, their livlihood, their way of trading in the far Asian places too, their way of living together and having a nice and cordial relations with Royal families at that time, all in one impressed me a lot.

title: One of the few options to visit
review: The Haveli is intricately made but clearly over-rated. Took a photo with the man credited by Guinness book to have the longest moustache.

title: Beautiful architecture
review: Its a gud place to see but is located inside d galis(narrow roads)..beautiful bldg..i suggest dis place to those who r intetested in history n architecture others not interested can bargain n shop at d market alongside d haveli. haveli is present in extremely narrow roads.

title: ARCHITECTURAL DELIGHT
review: The construction, the early use of science to uphold the structure then and till date, the feel of being transformed into those times, the smell of the 'bats'...it was a unique experience for sure!

title: Beautiful
review: 5 storeys high but only see three - part of it is a textile shop but the views to the fort are very good. Impressive paintings.

title: Must visit site
review: if you are in Jaisalmer and miss this then your trip is incomplete.

title: Must view this
review: The arts on the stone is terrific. Do not miss this place if you are a true art lover. Arts on every wall inside and outside too. Hats off to the worker who made it

title: A real haveli experience
review: It was a great heritage place to visit. Where we come know how the old royal people lived. Their dressing,entertianment games all we can know.and what a work done in haveli.thw windows, doors,walls.

title: when sculptors were rockstars
review: Few other buildings in India can give you the feeling of awe that you get when you enter the narrow lane where these havelis are situated. Just the scale of intricate carving on the stones leaves you wide-eyed. It  makes you wonder why you've never ever met a real stone sculptor before. If you do you'll surely give him more respect that a rockstar after you've witnessed the work here. The Havelis also demonstrate how  our well-off Indian ancestors used to live. A private haveli even showcases an ancient refrigerator made of multani mitti (Fuller's earth). Go there to get pictures clicked that'll make you quite popular on Facebook :)

title: Lovely but could do with a clean
review: This is one of the most amazing buildings you will ever see but it is not being well looked after...

title: Not so good
review: Normally used to have concerts of famous personalities from Music and Dance  that day was Rajasthani Dance As we have already seen in Malra heritage .................

title: Stone carvings.
review: An ancient haveli ( rich man's house) in a narrow street called Hanuman street of Jaisalmer. The outer walls are covered with very intricate stone carvings. The designs vary from wall to wall. These walls have windows closed with stone lattice work called jaalis. Its amazing when you consider the amount of man hours gone into making this.

title: Beautiful haveli but need maintenance.
review: One of the best havelis in Jaisalmer and must see haveli.

title: nice...
review: the haveli s in and around here are nice, quaint, find a good guide who will be only too pleased to tell you about the haveli s.. it was great wandering in and about the area..

title: Not a bad place
review: This is one of those places that you would visit if you had a little extra time on your hands.

title: Quite interesting, but disgusting service
review: I visited Patwaron-Ki-Haveli a couple of weeks ago. The building itself was quite nice, although nothing really special compared to other havelis in the area. I would recommend visiting one of the havelis in Jaisalmer, though for reasons I will soon explain I would stay away from this one.

title: Englih have gone, but left behind some illegal children.
review: We took a guide called Mustaq from outside the lake entrance. He said he will charge 400 rupees for showing the fort , havelis. This particular haveli he said we can not enter because we are indians. We saw foreigners inside the haveli but we being indians, in India are not allowed. This made us realise how much we Indian love to run behind the non Indians.. its quite disgusting attitude by one indian against another indian.  Wont recommend this place to anybody  unless you are white skinned.

title: Nice havelis a short walk from the fort
review: After visiting a large number of havelis during our Rajasthan trip, we were tired by the thought of visiting another haveli. But, the Patwon ki Haveli was worth the effort.

title: Good one
review: It's nice to see the grand luxurious lifestyle of the super-rich people of olden days. Well preserved buildings, with excellent architecture.

title: Beautiful
review: Well worth spending time here. Cost Rs200 each (we are not indian) Lovely facade with other houses nearby. Beautiful paintings works of art , signs and guides to point the way. Compared to many this is in good condition

title: Must visit place in Jaisalmar
review: We visited jaisalmer this February for two days...this place was on must visit list as it has got amazing history and architecture...please make sure to hire a good guide to understand and enjoy this place...

title: Very nice complex
review: This complex of 5 havelis is simply wonderful. take your time to visit and enjoy it, inside and out. hiring a guide is a good idea

title: Nice Haveli
review: Near to the Jaisalmer Fort, this place can be visited once if you have time to spare. The Haveli showcases the wealthy lifestyle of the merchants and traders who lived there. There are beautiful paintings on the wall. Various rooms shows the way the merchants and their family lived. I personally liked the postal stamp and envelope collections of the 19th century.

title: Haveli - A peek into the treasurers' life
review: These havelis in Jaisalmer are a must visit; not only if you are interested in history but also to understand the architecture and lifestyle of noble men/courtesans. Do not be ashamed to ask for directions if you are on foot and believe me if you are the sorts who prefer it that way then you don't really need even a rickshaw since all the havelis are quite close to the Jaisalmer Fort. There are extra charges for using camera inside the premises - I did n't pay honestly since I was not too keen on the pictures part. You could also get some for free; basically the facade and outer structure which is what is the crux for me. Overall. unmissable. Visit and enjoy!

title: Nice haveli
review: Museum is excellent.It is well maintained.There is a sheesh mahal which is excellent.Rather than the museum there are nothing too much too see.However the rajastani architecture on haveli wall is simply fantabolous.

title: Nice Haveli!!
review: Almost every Guide will take you to this place. This is business for them. You have to pay the money to get in. Ancient architectural examples can be found here. I found this haveli Ok Ok type. Only outside or front view is very nice!

title: Something worth seeing
review: If you are interested in old Rajasthani relics & dresses etc, this is a place to visit. This is house of Munim of Royalty. Although they charge entry fee of INR70 for Indians & INR 200 for foreigners, the place calls for much better upkeep. The lanes are dirty as at other places.

title: Well furnished and well laid out private museum.
review: This is the first Haveli on the right as you enter the complex. It is well worth the entrance price. There are plenty of appropriately furnished rooms that give you a good idea of what it would have been like to have lived there. I am a sucker for a museum arranged in room sets! I think they could even go one step further and have people engaged in appropriate activities using the exhibits.  This museum has learned much from our National Trust - including obliging you to exit through the shop! It's a worthwhile visit however.

title: Rich Splendour
review: Patwaon ki haveli is a walkable distance from the Jaisalmer fortress. These havelis are 5 different Havelis constructed wall-to-wall next to each other. Two hovels are taken over by ASI (Archaeological Survey of India) and three are private owned.

title: superb haveli memories..
review: Liked the place well..These are another proof of the outstanding skills of Rajasthani artisans. The jali-work is superb. A must for lovers of Rajasthani architecture and art. Guide did his job well..

title: Don't miss
review: Don't miss it for your life. However, I think just doing the govt. one (which has Rs. 20/- ticket) is enough. There is another private one too with ticket price Rs. 70/-.

title: Must see
review: Haweli in which the patwon ki family still lives! I was sad seeing that interiors are being painted white and being ruined of its natural golden apperance

title: An old abandoned haveli
review: There is absolutely nothing I can think of that I remember about this place! Not that my memory is bad, but because there is nothing I can remember this place by. Its a haveli, like any other haveli, that sits inside the fort, which nothing special and unique. Its two adjacent buildings that belonged to a very successful merchant who abandoned it and relocated elsewhere.

title: A beautiful piece of Architecture
review: Patwaon ki Havelli is one of the key attractions and visit makes it clear why its famous. These 5 havelis are really a piece of art with really detailed architecture and carved balconies and ceilings. Three of these are now managed by private companies and 2 are owned by govt of India. Its a must go for ppl who can appreciate the details of art work and for others, you can check it out from outside... without paying the entry fees.

title: Work of Art
review: It is an easy walk thru narrow streets from the Fort.  You get a glimpse of local life and the Haveli is stunning.  Carved, yellow sandstone so fine it looks like a wooden balcony.  You cannot go inside but just sitting outside looking at the architecture is enough. Don't miss it.

title: Heritage jaisalmer
review: Exotic Heritage set of buildings but very poorly maintained especially those taken over by the Govt. In one building, the owners are staying, so no access

title: glorious HIstory
review: The master piece of art and sculpture. The art work at the windows and jhorakas are awesome. All the artifacts are preserved in perfect conditions. A good market to buy local rajasthani leather shoes...

title: Breathtaking Architecture !
review: Patwaon ki Haveli is a must visit for any tourist in Jaisalmer. They were built in order to generate employment for masses who were having a difficult time with droughts. So on king's request Patwas had built five magnificent havelis which employed hundreds of artisans from the area.

title: Nice View of City from This Place
review: Prime minister of Jaisalmer's King made this Property for his family. He lived their with his family. It's Famous for it's Good carving & designs. It's world famous Haveli, Without this trip to Jaisalmer never complete. One of the, The Best Haveli in Jaisalmer out of Three havelies.

title: Definitely Visit
review: lot of history is hidden inside these 5 havelis ( houses ) out of which the guide ( if you take one ) will show you only 3, as the other two have people living in them. Recommended to get a tourist guide, as he knows secret spots inside this which youd never find on your own.

title: Excellence in stonework
review: The set of havelis is another manifestation of the outstanding skills of Rajasthani artisans. The jali-work is superb. A must for lovers of Rajasthani architecture and art.

title: Great haveli
review: This is one of the havelis in Jaisalmer which is in better shape. The exterior architecture is great and some portions of the haveli still run businesses. It is at a walk-able distance from the fort.

title: Interesting Haveali
review: Worth seeing while in town for the amazing room decorations. Plan on about 1 hour to see all the rooms and some picture taking.

title: Make the effort, climb the stairs
review: Also, be aware that if you go further down the entrance way there is another Haveli of the complex that is operated by the Government Staff and costs almost nothing to enter compared to the first private property.

title: very nice place
review: very treditional and historical place definitaly liked by the lover of history... people who want to to discover always something nes should go there.

title: Real haveli of rajasthan
review: It is my first likes in jaislmer ... real ancient haveli is completely superb structure of the building is good to see and exciting to read about. Because of it's looks it becomes a popular monument of jaislmer which is completely right don't miss out this haveli if you are in jaislmer.

title: Very nice Haveli
review: The visit is very interesting. Walls, ceilings, windows, are unique example of ancient architecture. The visit with a guide is wortwhile.One must-see in Jaisalmer.

title: Incredible ! A must see.
review: Extraordinary fine carving on stone. Guided tour inside gives a good insight of the historic significance and the life during the era.

title: Fabulous slice of history
review: This beautiful Haveli is well worth a visit and is crammed full wiith interesting exhibits and furniture, quite apart from the stunning architecture.  A very interesting insight into the life of a seriously wealthy merchant in the 18th century through to the 1930s.  Worth the entry fee

title: It's ok - nothing great
review: Too much hype for something not that great. Its a good time pass for half an hour - but nothing more than that.

title: Good haveli with lots to see
review: I would rate this haveli among all the havelis in Jaisalmer as the best place to visit. Have lot of exhibits on display and one can see many old items which are no more seen elsewhere. A must visit for every visitor to Jaisalmer.

title: A must visit
review: One of "THE"places to visit if in Jaisalmer - the stone work on the havelis is out of this world. I could have spent hours just looking at the facade without even going in. It's barely a 10 minute walk frrom the fort.

title: Businessmen Built Better Haveli Than Fort
review: Sheer work of excellent craftsmanship, just wow one of the finest work on sand stone with execute carving and fine artistic work, a place to visit and indulge in air of Rajput era, they had made this wonderful palace & heveli's as good as The Taj. worth visiting....

title: Charming Haveli, Worth a Visit
review: A series of 5 haveli’s, 2 of which have been taken over by the government and 3 are still owned by the ancestral families (yes, you can see families still staying there).

title: Awsom
review: I had never seen such an outstanding architecture in my life. The stone carvings is mind blowing. It is really hard to believe that it used to be someones residence once. Nice atmosphere around and a good vibe.

title: Delicate and Beautiful Stone Work
review: Great place to visit the intricate architecture is simply awesome to look at, also considering how old those are it is mind blowing.

title: A must visit for all !
review: One visiting Jaisalmer should take a round of Patwon ki Haveli for sure. My God, what architecture ! Mind blowing ! Well maintained property indeed.

title: Recommend to see from outside only
review: Well preserved exterior is worth a look from outside. Detailed carving is excellent. Did not pay and go inside, so will not comment on that.

title: Good Haveli but costly entry fee
review: Nice haveli to visit in Jaisalmer specially for photographs. It has a seperate place to take photos in Rajasthani folk dress.

title: Monument of prosperity in earlier days
review: The Haveli is a monument that demonstrates the prosperity of people of those times, apart from the Royal families. Well maintained and intricately carved.

title: beautiful haveli
review: This is a must visit. It is a beautiful haveli. no fancy stuff around ...it is located at a simple place, free of thugs. so it gets a five star. no to forget  the Guinness book record holder for the longest mustache sits quietly outside the haveli to be photographed. it is saddening to see someone like him living a life of penury.people pay him small amount for being photographed.

title: place to see stone architecture
review: we visited this place on 24 Dec 13. Patwaon -ki-haveli stands out from the rest due to the number of havelis and their outstanding architecture. there are 07 havelis, all are in various degrees of maintenance and have different entrance fees. we took a guide. it is worthwhile to take a guide for explaining the havelis. the modern day buildings which also have similar machine carved stone work diminish the look of the havelis, but if one considers that it as hand crafted and years before, one can only marvel at the magnificence of the place. it is really worth visiting the place and spending few minutes of your time there.

title: Amazing view from outside...
review: I've visited this haveli and just to look from outside.. It was just wonderful haveli. nice work done and very interesting site for the people who are love to see some historic sites...

title: Jaisalmer Haveli
review: A really good insight into how big business men of those times lived. Really good sandstone carvings

title: Worth visiting
review: Only few good attractions within the city. This is one of them.

title: Can imagine how the rich lived!!!
review: The Haveli from outside looks much better then from inside. Rooms are pretty small then what I had expected to see. In spite of that its worth a look. Waring!!. Do not shop in the Handicraft showroom housed inside the Haveli. The prices are exorbitant, considering that they give almost 40% commission to the guide that brings you to the shop.

title: Architectural wonder
review: Amazing mesh work with stone. For the period without electricity, these haveli's had cross ventilation and enough sunlight because of the amazing architectural designs. Must visit.

title: Suggestion
review: Please take a guided tour of the 1st haveli which has a charge of Rs50 per person.This one is maintained very well and is a fine piece of art.But the one that has  a fees of Rs20 is a utter nonsense with empty unkept architecture.All you can see is bats hanging on the roof of all rooms.

title: Great work of architecture
review: Given that this haveli is a few centuries old, is a great work of architecture. Will make you wonder how would it feel to live in such a huge house.. very good, highly recommended

title: Five Havelis together
review: The place has 5 havelis - one after another. Out of these five, only one haveli is belonging to Government where the ticket fee is reasonable while other havelis are private and you have to pay almost double the amount. Most of the havelis have the same structure and hence spending good amount of time in one of them is good enough and you can breeze through the other four havelis.

title: Beautiful Stone Jari Work.
review: Brilliant stone jari work in yellow sand stone. If you are fan of old or heritage building this would be your first choice in jaisalmer. Patwaon-ki-Haveli mainly made by a marwar business man ,who was a trader of leather ,textiles ,weeds etc. He started to make this building for his five sons. Each building took 12 years to complete.In one of the Haveli 6th generation of Patwaon family still staying.You do not need a guide for this place. Camera must.

title: Worth a visit.
review: These are actually five havelis in a row, all with different ownerships. Recommend you visit the Haveli with the govt. We went all the way up and see the architecture and the design. The view from the top is good

title: Nice architecture and carvings.
review: Located within the walking distance of the city, a must place for those who enjoy architecture or art work. A good example for the skill of the artisan.

title: Great place
review: It was a awesome experience to go through the different facet of this Haveli with such great architecture and Carving. Dont forget to meet the Man who is having very long mustache and he claims his father had the Guinness book Record of longest Mustache. Over all it was very awesome experience. Dont buy any stone with having magical powers to make card in Half hour or reduce Blood Pressure. One local guy told us it is all Sham.

title: excellent
review: its very nice i saw many hawelies in india but it is toatally different,its very nice and i want to come again here with my family soon.

title: just visit outside
review: architect of this building is really great but I would advise to visit it from outside, no need to spend money to visit inside the haweli, inside haweli there is nothing as such only old  things of patwas.

title: Definitely worth visiting
review: The Haveli is a fine place and is a definite visit. Autos are the preferred mode of transport as the lanes are quite narrow.

title: Good maintained heritage building
review: Must see place and museum.. Must wear local traditional clothes and take the photo opportunity .. Must see the museum .. Very well maintained

title: Beautiful Haveli but good to see from outside
review: Our guide suggested not to spend any money to visit inside as haveli looks more beautiful from outside.  Must take group and individual photos in front of the building. Visit when there is direct sunlight on the building

title: Very good
review: Its a very good haveli .. I was amazed to see the work done on stone. Truly speaking it was better than the fort and the museum. They charge you for camera too..that is something I didn't like but it was worth. Better to take an auto in Jaislmer as car doesn't go to patwaon ki haveli .

title: Nice place again
review: Its a magna palace a lot of shops nearby trying to woo the tourists with goodies and baddies.. As they say see the real India here...

title: Well maintained Haveli
review: The haveli has awesome architecture. The intricate work done on stone is amazing. It is well maintained. Almost everything which one can think off of those days is preserved here. Outside the Haveli we saw the man with the longest moustaches in India (I guess...)

title: thumbs up
review: not gr8 when it comes to art, but a peep into a wealthy patwa family then. Suggest u take coupon for camera use as few goods snaps can be clicked

title: Must see in Jaisalmer
review: One of the well maintained haveli being the first haveli erected in Jaisalmer.

title: Excuisite Place
review: We did a quick tour of this place. It felt going back 200 years with royal feel to the place. The glass and mirror work with fine paintings on the wall are really outstanding.

title: fine work
review: best carving on stone its so amazing to see most visit out side in side thy have a handicraft shop i liked very much dont miss to see one of best haveli

title: Fine jali work and window designs
review: Walking distance from the fort, a worthwhile visit. Shows life style in early 1900 of money earned by opium trade. Intricate jali work on local stone and good blend of imported colourful glass. Gives a peep into history of how businesses thrived under British patronage and how the early adapters of. British influences gained in business. Smart conversion of private property into museum, to avoid government take over.

title: happy  family
review: olf charm of staying , eating sharing day to day life with other member of family with the daily chores is secret of the happiness of the family who stayed here . the collection of their private articles are of great importance to the mofern nuclear familis.

title: Magnificent Houses
review: These houses were originally built by traders who would cross the thar desert from modern day pakistan to modern day India and trade many items, even opium. The buildings were like rest houses and had a lot of fanfare inside the walls. The red sandstone structures are beautiful and made for such extreme conditions.

title: Great
review: We liked the Patwaon ki haveli. The haveli is well preserved and has lot to offer and to know about the life style of the residents who stayed there decades ago. It took us more than hour to see the haveli. Must see when in Jaisalmer

title: Simply Awesome
review: One of the best maintained Haveli. Somehow the contents therin were more awesome , we got to see in some of the forts. A must visit and I personally rate this as Numero Uno place to visit in Jaisalmer.

title: Just another Haveli
review: The most interesting thing about the Haveli is the story behind. Everything else is like in every other Haveli. Unfortunately without any nice paintings about stories from the past. The exhibits are ok. If you go with a guide, prepare to have a final showroom action for carpets and Co.

title: NICE
review: The Haveli is must visit, the museum and the other things which you can see in the Haveli is nice. It gives a glimpse of the lifestyle which was there in earlier days. Nice architecture and very near from the fort.

title: Magnificence of a by-gone era
review: the splendour our bussiness class lived in even in those days is truly awesome. it is amazing almost like a kings palace. a must visit place , i was reluctant to see another haveli , but the architecture is great, wonderful collection of personal articles and interesting locks in all shapes. the rooms are well kept and it is hard to believe that the descendents still are into similar businesses. fine work in stone and mirror, simply amazing.

title: Not to miss in Jaisalmer
review: The Patwaon-Ki-Haveli is a very special place. A great Haveli to absolutely visit if you go to Jaisalmer and like colors! The visit will take you approximately an hour.

title: Most well maintained of the Haveli's
review: This is one of the most well maintained haveli's. It has some very good musuem and awesome things which have been preserved. From the outside the architecture is beautiful and you will really like it. This place has got stunning view of the fort from the terrace. Please dont miss to take photos of the fort from here. There are lots of rooms to see and overall one can spend max 2 hours at this place. It is definetly must see. This is known as Kothari's Patwon ki haweli. Please dont confuse as one next to this there is another Patwon haveli which is not much to see and has bats in the staircase area. This is not maintained well and can skip once we see Kothari's Patwon ki haweli. There are small shops on the lane where one can get some stuff at bargain.

title: Well kept haveli
review: This is one of the 3 famous haveli. This is a must see while others can be given a miss. The haveli  has been turned into a museum showing how people used to live in older times. All the things have been nicely maintained. The haveli is itself beautiful......

title: One time Visit
review: first haveli was worth visit with all luxury and rich cultural aspect being shown. Rest all four were stinking and had bats inside them

title: Must see place
review: Must see it to know the facts of history in Jaisalmer. Beautifully built  specifically designed to beat scorching heat of desert. Every craft has a story behind it u can judge its worth by visiting there. In the absence of Patwon Ki haveli in my trip I would have missed a great point. I will categorized it in must see palces

title: Incredible Kothari's Patwa haveli
review: A friend suggested me this attraction. This is a unique museum with artistic pillars, beautiful Jhakoras and each room has a unique display of the Patwas lifestyle. Must say its much better that the jaisalmer palace.

title: A beautiful monument with some very interesting historical facts
review: This is not a king's palace but a business man's home in olden times. It encompasses some of the most interesting bits and pieces of history in it. It has some important and very unique elements of silk route. I would say its a must visit for all who travel to jaisalmer

title: Awesome heritage!!!
review: A place not to be missed for anyone and everyone visiting JAISALMER. One gets astonished to see such great places exist in India. It shows the excellence which Indians have inherited in Architect, thoughts and uniqueness about everything.

title: Different
review: This haveli is different from all other havelis I had seen in the rest of the trip. Great work on sandstone!

title: Beautiful haveli
review: Unmatched beauty in carving and detailing. The shopping experience is ok, but expensive. Just get astonished the quality of carvings...

title: Gloom personified!
review: It is a typical example of vernacular style of architecture!

title: visit to the haveli
review: Interesting place with well documented tour descriptions/placards at all attractions inside the haveli. Thankfully, we didn't get a guide. The tour will take 1 hour and worth the time with kids.

title: The best and most breathtaking architecture in the rajastahn !
review: Let me confess,at the outset,that what ever words i use, my vocabulary will fall short in describing this extraordinare peace of very rich heritage and breathtaking architecture! you must visit this haveli ,if you are in anywhere in Rajasthan.This is the finest piece of architecture I have ever seen!

title: exquisite carvings in stone
review: The entrance is not so impressive but once you enter inside & look for the facades they are extraordinary

title: Wonderful architecture but sadly very much neglected ......
review: Patwon-ki-Haveli is combined of five havelis built together, but only the first and fifth haveli is open to tourists. All the five havelis can be seen and photographed from outside. The curving and detailed work on stone at Patwon-ki-Haveli makes it a must visited place in Jaisalmer. But sadly poor maintenance and negligence left the place in poor condition. First haveli is a museum and items stored there are not in great shape. The interior of most of the rooms are restored and there are many items stored in the haveli which are not from the time when Patwons used to live there. The fifth haveli is very much neglected and restoration work is still going on. Inside of the fifth haveli is full with bats hanging from the ceiling in every room and the whole haveli smells horrible due to bat droppings. Take a guide with 100 rupees to know about the havelis and its history. Patwon-ki-Haveli is a landmark in Jaisalmer and I will recommend a visit to this place.

title: nice...
review: here also government and private "haveli" exists. government haveli is free to visit but not maintained well and private Haveli is chargeable and maintenance is good...

title: THIS IS THE SAME AS PATWAON KI HAVELI .
review: This is a beautiful piece of architecture.There is fee which is charged for seeing this beautiful monument.Cameras are allowed inside.

title: excellent architecture
review: Awesome intricate work on the buildings with ceilings coated in gold...Its a sad part that tourists have spoilt this place with litter ant kids urinating...

title: patvas luxorious glories
review: patwa were the financers of the king , they were the business of afim , Ganja < Havala money transfer, financer of king etc etc, how luxorious facilities in the haveli is a best view along with the make of haveli only with the iron joider and no bricks and cements were used in it

title: Largest Haveli in Jaisalmer
review: The havelis are also known as the 'mansion of brocade merchants'.It is the first haveli to be constructed in jaisalmer and consist of 5 small havelis.

title: not great
review: small place . nothing exclusive. govt of india board charges 20/- for indians but the people at the counter ask for 50/- .

title: A tryst with old times
review: Patwon ki haveli is situated right in the city, near the market. This monument is an salute to culture of Rajasthan. The entire haveli is carved into the shape of a square bracket. The haveli covers almost three sides and right in front of the haveli is a small courtyard.

title: nice old architecture
review: Reasonable place to go, privately owned, dont need a guide. Has some old artefacts. Out of 5 havelis only one is really open to public, two r with govt and two have peopke living in them.

title: commercialized
review: Too much of commercialization and fakeness ...though the place is good and still had old charm and gives a good feel of life 50-60 years back , however the commercialization of place is bad

title: Beautiful stonework and carving
review: It's definitely worth seeing. It's a lovely and beautifully crafted haveli. I also enjoyed the museum inside, but if you're havelied out, at least take time to see the outside.

title: Not Well Maintained
review: Just like another old haveli which is not very well maintained. Short Walk from Jaisalmer fort. Hire a guide to understand more about this haveli.

title: Superb
review: Good to see the museum, Haveli's and the structure of whole of Haveli. It's a good place to visit. I would recommend to book a guide (they charge approx 100 INR) to know the whole of history in detail.

title: Ancient One!!!!
review: This haveli is one of the attractions of jaisalmer. Good to see and enjoy from outside as there is mavellous amount of work done in Stones of which it is made of. Smelly and lonely from inside as there is not much to do.

title: Great Architecture
review: There are 5 havelis in all. Some have been converted to museums. These are much clean but lost their origionality. Try the govt owned haveli. It is in ruins, has thousands of Bats, but still it has retained the origionality.

title: Photogenic
review: Must visit in Jaisalmer. the place is not very big. there are ample opportunities for photography. Grandeur of a palace should not be expected. Is worthwhile to hire a guide to get some insights.

title: Very nice
review: This is a lovely place to visit and do some small shopping as well. You can capture some brilliant photographs here! We took a guide who took us around a bit. I would not recommend that as it was not that interesting

title: Beautiful.
review: We walked through the city with our guide from the fortress to the Patwaon-Ki-Haveli. Its a group of havelis and the carvings in the stone are amazing.

title: A time pass
review: Though you are visiting a new place with some expectations, but this is not having that appealing things which can be said "WOW". If you have time and not much things to do then you should visit this place also in Jaisalmer trip.

title: Best stone work
review: i had visited both part of havali the private & govt one the both part are good but the govt havali have super craft work on stone need to maintein and  the entree fees is just 20 Rs & in privete rs 50/- without camera

title: Architectural splendor
review: This haveli is a beautiful building with really intricate stone carvings on its walls and is a sight to behold. Hire a guide to explain the history and the tidbits about the place. Highly recommended

title: new year
review: I spent 2 night and one day at  Winds Desert Camp(Village: Kanoi , Near Sam Sand Dunes, Jaisalmer,Rajasthan India).It was mind blowing,Dancing and fun with Folk dancers of Jaisalmer  while camping in desert on New Year evening.I stay in Winds Desert Camp with my family . Staff is very good & cooperative.

title: See how the Maharawal's banker lived
review: The haveli, actually five but only is a museum is part of a complex built by a very wealthy merchant who had so much money he could bankroll the Maharawal. Ironically this haveli was built at the height of Jaisalmer's wealth. The invention of steamships would seriously diminish Jaisalmer's value as an outpost on a land route to Persia. You can see how the wealthy elite lived in Rajasthan at the zenith of their influence and before millions enjoyed the same creature comforts of life. After you explore walk across the street to the KB Lodge for great Thali and a cold Kingfisher.

title: beautiful carvings on walls & windows
review: The haveli has very fine carvings done by hand on golden stone. Haveli's architecture is mixture of hindu and muslim culture. Meuseum's collection is worth seeing. Walls are made of interlocking stones.

title: Stunning piece of architecture
review: The most beautiful building in all of Jaisalmer - the intricately carved exterior and interior will leave you breathless.

title: Worth a visit
review: The most famous haveli in Jaisalmer. Intricate carvings and old artifacts populate this museum-like set up haveli. Guides are easily available but you can also opt for the hassle free audio tapes. Did not like the fact that they charge extra money for each camera.

title: Haveli with photos
review: Nice photogenic place. Had nice experience there. Full of bats and methanogenic smell, but the place is too calm and soothing

title: good
review: property is having nice ethnic taste with wonderful belongings like their old oven,beds with silver work,sexophone,etc  and above all the secret treasure house .

title: Amit Jain
review: Must visit.

title: Experience how rich entrepreneurs lived hundred years ago
review: +ves - Easy to navigate through, bright interiors with real artifacts, well-maintained.

title: Fascinating
review: Loved the fretwork and the carved jharokhas.

title: Quite big and impressive but lot of hawkers.
review: The passage to that Haveli need maintenance. But shows the architectural brilliance of that time. No body can imagine that even after 200 years it is intact. Most of the work is of interlocking stones.

title: Beautiful but expensive
review: The detail in the building is exquisite and there are decent written explanations throughout the haveli so a guide is not needed.  The entrance fee is expensive and we chose to enter the one that was not across from the souvenir stalls because we thought it was a bigger haveli (staircases on either side of the lane and they said we could explore both sides).

title: Must Visit
review: Patwaon haveli is  full of history and its structure , design . everything is unforgettable.Must visit it.....

title: The Best Stone Lattice Work Showcase
review: This group of five havelis (Big Houses) are quite impressive. It is amazing to know that such structures existed outside the fortified city and the owner still constructed them with or without fear of an attack if the city is attacked in those olden days. The stone lattice work on the frontage is quite minute and takes your breath away. So are the rooms and their purposes in those days. I suggest the travellers to first see the 2 havelis which is under the upkeep of the Government and, then, if they wish, can see the ones owned by private persons. All the 5 havelis are constructed in a cluster.

title: worth a visit
review: Despite having to walk down many little lanes which were smelly and awash in places..so closed shoes are advisable..it was worth the effort. The Havalis are interesting and you can find out lots of interesting facts about the way people lived and dressed.useful labels.

title: Not to be missed
review: Patwaon ki Haveli shows the rich culture, life, and architecture that affluent trader families enjoyed during the time of Maharajas. Perhaps they were the Ambanis of their times:)

title: Liked it
review: The museum is good, take guide to get explained, inside decorated, top floor nice view, be ready to walk stairs, parking available

title: Must go!
review: No Words can be used to describe What a fabulous Building it is! Anyway, There are so many harvelis in the old town ( not in the fort)

title: Beautiful Architecture
review: Must visit if in Jaisalmer. Please visit the one that is privately run as it has been recently renovated. The carving and architecture is very beautiful.

title: Jain merchant mansion
review: There are several houses.  I skipped the annoying touts at the first one who spoilt my mood and went to the government-run house. It's dirty, smells of bats and probably unsafe but there are some lovely paintings and great views.  Watch the Hindi film 'Paheli' (the original or the new one) for a feel of the merchant life, even Bollywood style.

title: Must visit in Jaisalmer
review: I would recommend hiring a guide to know the history associated with the place. Shops around are over-priced. Probably the best of all the tourist attractions in Jaisalmer.
Unless you have a slight insight into the historical significance of this beautiful structure, you'll find yourself staring at a buliding just like one of the thousands you'll find in Jaisalmer..

title: Exquisite
review: An ornately carved exquisite haveli which will stun you with its intricacies. At least 2 hours are needed to explore this heritage building. Look out for pigeon droppings and extra pushy local vendors.

title: good old heritage property
review: stunning work in the haveli and amazing how well it is still looking. The paintings are really beautiful.

title: Lovely intricate designs
review: We visited the Patwaon-ki-Haveli before we went to the Jaisalmer fort which was a good idea as we were amongst the first tourists there and could take in everything at our pace.

title: better to see from outside
review: the haveli has an excellent craving from outside. worth seeing. 5 haveli of which three are open. on ground floor there are shops. not well maintained.

title: Totally Avoidable
review: The only reason to give this place 3 stars is the beauty of the architecture and the great street shopping options right next to it...

title: Nothing special here
review: Very good stone craft on the walls of haveli, but there is nothing to spend more time and feel wow about it.

title: Beautiful from outside, nothing inside ...
review: It sure looks beautiful from the exterior but with a 50Rs entry price there was nothing much that we wouldnt have seen anywhere else, everything else was quite ordinary and it was a waste of time and money ,,,,

title: Wow
review: We couldn't go there during normal hours because of traffic jams and NO parking facilities. So our driver suggested we go at  7 in the morning on our way back to jodhpur which was a very good idea. ..walked around and enjoyed looking at it from outside and feeling very angry with the locals for letting it go down so badly.

title: Well preserved haveli
review: Nice and well preserved haveli showing the various aspects of life of the traders. The haveli has more to display compared to the kings palace in the fort. Worth a visit

title: A great work of art
review: This is a unique n intricate masterpiece,difficult to find anywhere.a must see place.u can hav a fair look into the lives of olden times.

title: Worth a watch
review: Shows the opulance and style in the life style of the financers of the king. Nice architecture but cramped place.

title: Quite nice
review: The outside architecture of the place is amazing again, as most of them are in Rajastan. Although the palace is a bit poorly maintained and is not an altogether art jem as one in Bikaner, it is still well worth visiting.

title: Well done house could be museum in future
review: Best part of this was the intricacy of the stone work and old things which bring nostalgia back. View of the fort was fantastic.

title: Well preserved heritage of Rajasthan
review: Locating this place is not difficult, but as jaisalmer is a small town, so you need to cross the narrow lanes and roads. They are pretty strict about cameras, so better pay for it and happily take your shots.

title: Mind blowing
review: This is a must see in Jaisalmer with all it's beautiful jharokha work and history. Don't miss this place.

title: Awesome arcitecture
review: The intricacy of the architecture is breathtaking.  This is a must see.  One can do a little bit of shopping in front of the Haveli.

title: fantastic
review: the havelis are a complex of 5 buildings, out of which 2 are open for public viewing. one of the havelis belongs to a private person and is very well maintained with a good museum displaying a whole host of intresting antiques. the government owned building need to be better maintained.

title: Go in Early if you want to come out Easily
review: Place gets very busy, there are sections which are ornately maintained and others which are a let down due to poor inscriptions or bad lighting. The queues were horrendous at around 11 am, should have noted the opening times and got there early. Keep track of your kids, we lost track of our parents which were even harder to find in the interconnected corridors. Glimpses of the yesteryear Rajputana nobility's grandeur and way of life make the trip worthwhile.

title: Marvellous heritage buildings
review: Liked : Superb architecture ,beautifully curved row houses offer a marvellous sight .The view of the havelis on both sides of the lane is just unforgettable.

title: Strictly average
review: A visit to Patwon ki Haveli can actually be completed in 5 minutes flat, as the only interesting thing is the carvings and architecture from the outside. In fact, one can completely avoid going inside the haveli, as its poorly maintained and infested with birds and bats and emanates an unbearable stink.

title: Brilliant
review: Did not manage to go inside  but it looked really nice from the outside. a work of art indeed. wish we could explore more of this haveli , looks to be worth a visit indeed

title: Crazy awesome
review: This place is on steroids! Really gorgeous. Not much else to do other than see, and take in the mela-type atmosphere, but totally worth it to do so.

title: very good dont miss it
review: patwaon kee haveli is very well maintained now, u actually feel it got vacated few days back only, the owners seem to have rtestored lot of rooms fully, its better managed than forts and dont miss the silver shop in adjacent haveli, good designs and bargain hard, if u r accompanying ur wife or girlfriend, she gonna love it.

title: A not so grand haveli
review: The portion  of the Haveli that is maintained by the ASI is as usual dirty and dilapidated. Lots of steep stairs to climb unless you reach the roof and the view is not worth the effort. the Gold painted ceiling is nice but the old painted walls are in a state of decay.

title: Exotic work... Unimaginable
review: The Havelis are a treat to watch ....

title: Must see in Jaisamer
review: Dont miss Patwon ki Haveli if you are going to Jaisalmer. Veru beautiful work in stone, well maintained too.

title: Great attraction next to Jaisalmer fortress
review: The haveli is as elaborate as any king's palace. there are some dizzying amount of intricate carvings and decoration.

title: Amazing experience
review: Patwaon-Ki-Haveli is a must see at Jaislamer. We hired a guide who was a local resident and has contributed some photographs to the havelis. The first 2 havelis are very well known as museums in their own right. The others are private and people still live there. The carvings and work done on the walls are magnificient.

title: Beautiful stone carving ...
review: 1 Beautiful stone carving & Superb architectural  ..

title: Cheap Tour
review: The tour was great and very interesting to learn all about the history. The guides are pretty good, they don´t over charge you. We paid just Rs 50/- for our guide.

title: Good view of life in the city
review: This haveli is well worth the visit--as it shows life in the city in two ways. First, it is a bit off the beaten track, and if you walk through the surrounding neighborhood you can see how average people in Jaisalmer live now. Second is that the Haveli itself is well preserved and has much of the furniture still in place, with good explanatory signs to tell you about how life was at the time.  Beware the touts in the streets out front who will want to guide you....and the shop on the ground floor. It is possible to sneak back down the stairs you entered by to avoid this shopping trap.

title: ok to visit
review: Huge stairs, You need to put effort in going upto 6th floor. but good view from the top. More efforts should be put in restoration of the detriorating structure

title: Blast from the past
review: One of the havelis listed as tourist attractions, Patwaon ki Haveli is the best maintained.. and i believe, the restoration is ongoing.

title: worth a visit-- lovely old house to imagine history
review: This is a beautiful old haveli with lots of history.    Be aware that there are a lot of stairs, although the view from the rooftop is a good reward.   Also-- maintenance is not their top priority, and there are bats hanging in a few rooms/stairwells.   Next door, there is another part of the haveli (or another entire haveli?) that has furnishings, rugs, etc--- and charges a bit more to visit--- but offers a good sense of how the haveli must have looked at its heyday.   The neighborhood is WONDERFUL for wandering and seeing other old, not as weallthy havelis, regular people, and regular life.    We strolled several times day and night through this area (with 4 adults-- 3 women, 1 man) and felt very safe at all hours.    Highly recommended, even just to walk in the area.

title: Dont miss out on this once you have seen the Fort
review: Great local architecture, take time to see the extent of work done...great way to learn about the wonderful history of rajasthan. Great photo opportunity.

title: Overrated
review: We found it overrated and gaudy.. There is an old musician there though who will gladly sing folk songs for a 100 rupees. That part was magical

title: A well maintained haveli
review: The carvings on the haveli walls and the jharokhas are worth seeing.It could be better maintained though. There are lots of bats so be careful.The stairs are too steep and elderly people and people with knee problem should avoid.

title: Amazing craftsmanship
review: Well you come to Jaisalmer - after hours of bumpy rides - because of those havelis right? They are worthwhile to visit, but the whole fortress inner city is full of old and new havelis, so do take some time to stroll through the city.

title: Beautiful structure
review: we just walked around the outside of this Haveli and didn't pay to go in, as we were told it's better from the outside anyway.  The structure is remarkable and is the best one in Jaisalmer.  Be sure to check out the Jain Temples inside the fort too, that is worth paying to go inside.

title: a first hand experience of rich people of old times
review: the haveli is been managed by personal group (not government) and will charge Rs50 for entry and Rs50 for camera too (though its worth paying).

title: a guide was worthwhile
review: I liked the glimpse into the past and how the families had lived cheek-to-jowl, cooked, and conducted business.

title: Amazing architecture
review: Nice visit. there are 5 floors and its a little scary wen u see the bats in one of the floors but overall its so unique and beautiful that its worth one visit

title: Worth watching
review: Good design and a unique infrastructure. You need to go up the floors to have a look at all the dimensions. The bats on one of the floors makes it a scary place and there are many cracks which adds to the adventure.

title: Fantastic!
review: One of the better attractions in Jaisalmer and in a good state of preservation. Certainly the best of the Havelis. Recommend that you see the one maintained by the ASI (Archaeological Survey of India) & not the privately owned one (both charge for entry.) Viewing the outer facade is free! :)

title: Simply a MUST see
review: If you are in Jaisalmer and you don't see the Patwon kee haveli, it's like going to Agra and not visiting theTaj!!

title: A 'must' for any Jaisalmer visit
review: This Haveli/museum is well preserved and gorgeous. The museum itself is only so-so, but the Haveli itself is so magical (and the streets surrounding) it is a must for visitors to the city

title: Great place
review: It was worth the distance and efforts to go there. Wonderful architecture, carvings, paintings etc. Take a guide to make best use of your visit. Do not forget to negotiate with the guide.

title: Amazing stone carving!
review: Very beautiful. There are 5 havelis in all. Two are open for public. One of them is run by the Govt Tourism Deppt. This is not maintained at all. You would find bats hanging from the roof all over. Though it still is in the origional form.

title: All Jaisalmer Haveli are worth driving hours to get to Jaisalmer
review: Jaisalmer Havelis are really worth to drive hours and hours to this golden city. This stone carving is not from this world.

title: Old Heritage house converted to a museum
review: It is and old building owned by the rich local businessman from old times. The haveli has now been converted into a museum and one is charged Rs 50/- for visiting it. Extra charges for camera etc.

title: Haveli to be visited
review: Patwaon Ki Haveli has lot more to see and experience than other Haveli.

title: unbelievable
review: this is a treasure with so fine work that we could not believe on our eyes.haveli is also well preserved

title: beautifully made..
review: u have to see to believe the beautiful and intricate architecture...

title: beautiful outside ugly inside!!
review: the are marvelously built on the outside but inside lies the real truth .  .. .. .there are pigeons and bats inside squealing almost in your ears and also there is a intolerable smell that makes it difficult to breath. . . . please govt. restore the charm and maintain it!!

title: Royal Tour of Jaisalmer by Ganesham Tours & Travels India Pvt. Ltd.
review: Patwon Ki Haveli Architecture is very interesting. It's a cluster of 5 small havelis. Thanks to Ganesham Tours and Travels India Pvt. Ltd. to make a nice Jaisalmer trip for us.

title: Beautiful Haveli
review: This place gives a glimpse the way "Tha Patwa's" used to live and do their business in these haveli's in their time. The kothari museum  showscases the lifestyle of "The Patwa's" and the govt run musuem gives the as it is showcase of the haveli where nice carving on the window, paintings on the wall, mirror carvings and other things can be seen. A good place to visit and see how business used to run by "The Patwa's "  at the time of Silk route era.........

title: Nice. Worth a visit.
review: Good place. Nice artistic construction and planning. Excellent carvings... worth visit. Kids got bored though

title: High Living From Ages Back
review: Beautiful Havelis, with intricate carving on the outer wall and age old luxury inside. Also on the streets below, the local market with handicrafts and textiles.

title: Real Heritage
review: We visited the haveli on 24th October. It was amazing. The architecture was simply marvellous. The person with a long mustach sitting in-front of the haveli was an added attraction. A must see for anybody in Jaisalmeer.

title: Awesome architechture!
review: Take a guide and get tour. There are 5 Havelis (large houses) in all and you get to visit the first and the fourth for a price. The entire tour should not take more than an hour. Worth a visit. There are people still residing in the other Havelis here.

title: Beautiful but boring
review: It was a nice building, but we would have enjoyed our tour more had we not been followed by an annoying guy through every room asking if we needed a guide.

title: dissapointing
review: it was a showcase of someones home that was tackily done up. what a waste of time. Maybe the govt owned part would have been nicer but the guides around strongly dissuaded us from going there.

title: Beautiful spacious haveli with a lot to see
review: We visited the haveli together with a guide not sure you need one as there are signs everywhere. The haveli itself is in good condition you can see some beautiful rooms which take you back in time and show how life here has been. It is also beautiful from the outside.

title: Just view from outside. best out of three Havelies
review: This one is the best haveli out of the three famous Havelies. The carving is worth looking at. There are benches in the front of the havelies where you can sit, rest and watch the Haveli.

title: Amazing architecture
review: If you are in Jaisalmer than havelis are something you should see and visit... Not just this one... and not just only those famous mentioned in guide books... walk trough streets of old town...inside and outside of fort and discover your havelis... there are dozens of them around Golden Jaisalmer...and this one is surely most impresive one... Huge structure, fantastic architecture, some unbelievable intricate facade stone carvings... photographer paradise... just ignore the guides around and walk around and inside by yourself... as an architect I very recomended this place for a visit...

title: Great Piece of Art
review: Great piece of art, indeed.

title: Rich man's mansion :)
review: The elaborate haveli is a good place to see how the rich lived in the not too distant past. The government owned havelis need urgent maintances - they are infested with bats!

title: touts and scams
review: A very nice Haveli but the camera fee was more than the entrance. There were two boards outside with different prices and we were quoted the entrance fee on the more expensive board. As soon as I questioned it, I was given the cheaper rate, Touts abounded the area offering guided tours of the Haveli. There is no need for a guide.

title: An original
review: Extremely well maintained and preserved.  Many shops around this area offering great bargains - you must bargain!!!  Good area to visit.

title: Singing stones
review: The skill of the sculptor, the facades, the intricate work, your camera will love it. The play of sunlight from the arches with the gloden stone reflecting it, is awesome. Avoid the shopkeepers inside.

title: Don't miss it
review: The stone work is wonderful and it's a simple site that should not be missed.  Make the point of walking the whole street as there are lovely havelis everywhere.

title: Nice visit
review: Great place to take lovely exotic pictures. My friends and I had a good time exploring that location.

title: "very fantastic  & amazing arcitect in world"
review: The stone work is wonderful and it's a simple site that should not be missed. Make the point of walking the whole street as there are lovely havelis everywhere.

title: Nice Carvings but nothing great inside
review: If you are short of time, you can just visit it from outside as we did. The beauty is visible outside. Inside as we were told was just OK.

title: Outstanding workmanship
review: The decorative stonework on this building is amazing.  The building towers over a narrow alleyway and almost drips with gorgeous carved stonework.  It's best viewed from outside, and there are a ciouple of places opposite where you can sit on stone benches and just admire the building.  It's good to visit at sunset time when the light is on the upper part of the facade.

title: very intricate workmanship
review: It has very intricate workmanship not seen everywhere.

title: Audio-Visual Guide at Patwon-Ki-Haveli, Jaisalmer
review: Kothari's Patwon Ki Haveli is the best among the other haveli's. The government haveli's are filled with Bats and foul smell everywhere. The audio-visual tourist guide at the Kothari's Patwon Ki Haveli is mind blowing. They give you  a tablet which displays photos of the room you go to along with a great audio. I suggest anyone going to Jaisalmer should ask for it.

title: amazingly beautiful
review: must see - beautiful carvings - you can still feel the opulence of a bygone era. Take a guide to understand the history & cultural background to the details, stay away from people trying to sell you stuff all the times.

title: Royal House
review: These Haveli's show us how the merchants of the time used to live, they were no less than a King. You can get a close look on their life style, taking a guide can help, cause he can explain their heritage. We took audio guides and looked around. The architecture is quite unique, something different from the rest of Rajasthan.

title: Inside the crowded village of Jaisalmer
review: Patwaon ki Haveli is very good maintained and having very beautiful look inside the haveli. Their is too much crowd in near by areas because Haveli situated center of village

title: Old old old, and interesting !
review: Definitely worth a visit, but be warned of the bats !

title: Good views
review: The haveli itself is getting dilapitated however one sees great views of the city and the fort from the roof top.

title: Must visit for amazing stone carvings
review: Good place to visit for unique stone carvings of what was once the residence of wealthy merchants profiting from the Silk route.

title: Wiving or Sewing : Un-believable carvings on stone
review: An astonishing carvings on stones. Unbelievable artistry, Need to see and feel to believe Still leaves you thinking Is it possible to make this years long ago..... The efforts beyond par excellence... Hats Off to the Crafts-men immortal.....

title: Terrible. Avoid.
review: This place looks like a haunted house with 1 million bats zipping past you. The entire places stinks. You are better of sleeping one extra hour than to visit this place.

title: Must visit to feel the real Jaisalmer culture!!
review: The haveli (1 out of 5 is open for tourists) takes you back to history showcasing how the wealthy people of old used to live with all the amenities (some of them pretty fascinating). The stone carvings are simply amazing all over the haveli and it is a far better visit than the Jaisalmer fortress.

title: superb, but only the insides !
review: palace surrounded by sewage drains !! had to sidestep over overflowing mosquito ridden open sewers...but once inside, was overawed by the colorful interiors..the colors ,the craftmanship is truly amazing...if the jaisalmer fort scores in size,the haveli scoes in grandeur...a must see

title: Haveli
review: A Haveli is a rich mans multistory house with lots of stone carved windows and posh living in the olden days. The place was good but was full of bats hanging in each room. It was scary but a must visit in the area.

title: Marvellous
review: Have a wonderful time there, the museum and the way of displaying it very nice. Liked the way 3 stories buidling it built without cement. Loved the methods they used for their livings. Locks with birth signs are good to view. Their utenils are also wonder ful. Loved, graving on stone and the technique they used for design from the ornaments. Would request traveller to hire a guide as it really help them to know about its past and history.

title: Nicely Done
review: If you have been to your share of havelis in Rajasthan it is still worth visiting this one.  The restoration work helps bring polish to the experience.  The interpretive information was more abundant than I am used to at similar sites.  The collections were good too.

title: pakwa haveli
review: the best haveli in jaisalmer. a nice museum; from the top a great view on the fort

title: the best haveli of Rajastan ,
review: the best architecture of city, just walk and see ,amazing houses,some of them you be invited /free/ to visit,some of them are shops,you be also invited to see plenty rooms , 200, 300 years people still live at this rooms, working and so on,

title: Very much hyped spot
review: It would be beautiful earlier but due to neglect and non maintenance, not worth visiting....highly disappointed after visiting?..spent only 3 minutes there"...........................?.................................

title: Gorgeous Haveli
review: a must see haveli in Jaisalmer. The intricate works and the haveli itself is a treat.

title: Curious & antieques
review: Good curious collection from past. One has to go through various floors and do take a guide to explain you details. they will tell you the story of the family, the intricate arts, origin of the collections etc

title: it look like a best art
review: it was well carving on stone and lookslike painting

title: Magnificient
review: its an experience to take a sneak peak into the lives of the rich in those days in Jaisalmer

title: Havelis everywhere, which to visit? Patwaon-Ki for the bling, government owned for the bats
review: The postings here seem to be for all of the havelis in Jaisalmer.  We went looking for Patwaon-Ki at first based on TripAdvisor, but ended up in a run-down government haveli on the same street... which was awesome because it was filled with bats hanging from the ceilings (though some people may be horrified). That was of course totally different than Patwaon-Ki once we found it-- decked out with mirrors, stained glass, furniture, exhibits, and plenty of signage.

title: Good to spend some time and take photographs
review: Good structure and ancient architecture. Stairs are little tricky at places, but over all a good place to visit.

title: Awesome
review: A visit to Patwan Haveli is an absolute must when visiting Jaisalmer.  The character of the complex is a sight to behold with all the vendors and tourists. The displays are very well maintained and gives a realistic impression of life in Jaisalmer of old. The tendency of guides and staff to force you in the direction of the "rip off" vendors inside the Haveli is a bit of a frustration but firm NO's usually did the trick. Most of the goods on sale can be bought in Pahar Gunj in Delhi for less than half the price, if you really need to buy it

title: Best Of The Jaisalmer Havelis
review: This haveli has been renovated and converted into a museum and will provide the best insight into such buildings in the area. There is some pressure to hire a guide as you enter - we declined having spent 4 days in Shekawati and heard the history of such constructions many times - but it would probably be worthwhile to spend 100-200 rupees.

title: Intricate stone carvings
review: WOW... at very few places in rajasthan you will come across such wonderful carving on the external facade.. Amazing..

title: Worth a visit
review: Good restoration and information. Gave very good insights into the world of the merchants and the role they played.

title: Great!
review: This is a set of 5 buildings, exactly the same, but owned by different entities now. A father had made these for his 5 sons. All are the same, except, the 2 that are privately owned charge a higher fee from tourists than the ones that are owned by the govt. The guide is free in the Govt owned ones and is pretty good at his work. You could tip him at the end of the visit. The natural colours that have not faded in all these years and the hidden drawers for keeping Opium are the best things to see in these buildings. Apart from these, i found the buildings very average. However, as Jaisalmer does not have a lot of other attractions, these buildings and the Safari are the only two things we did when we were here for a day..

title: good
review: It is old house and very beautiful. This is awesome place to hangout and shop around.

title: "Traders lifestyle"
review: This is a beautiful haveli built with the trademark yellow sandstone of Jaisalmer with intricate carvings that makes you stare forever - the artistry is unique. Here the traders of Jaisalmer conducted their business and all the relics are preserved in the musuem inside the haveli.  No photography is allowed inside the premises.  There are many similar havelis where the traders still reside and one unique feature we noticed was the painting of the wedding announcement on the walls of he haveli - as the only means of inviting guests for a family wedding as there were no postal system in that era.  Some of the invites still remain freshly painted on the exterior walls.

title: Amazingly well maintained
review: Not to be missed, this haveli is set up like the home it was. Somehow it has been well maintained and preserved with it's fabulous walls and ceilings intact, you can actually imagine yourself living here!

title: what an insight !!
review: one shouldnt miss this haveli...its well preserved and gives an insight of how they lived.  There is a nominal fee to enter and i suggest that one should view the haveli from inside (quite a few visitors just click pics of the beautiful exterior facade and dont enter the haveli).

title: A great piece of craftmanship
review: This is one of the places where you will find the most exquisite piece of craftsmanship.

title: Gorgeous building from an era goneby
review: Patwaon ki haveli was built by a well to do businessman. There are 6 havelis (mansions) built in a row for 6 sons. The buildings are a work of art. Intricate carvings, gorgeous murals and amazing ceilings adorn the haveli. Must see the haveli from inside just clicking the facade is not enough. If you can walk up to the terrace you will get a splendid view of the Jaisalmer Fort and The golden city. Patwaon ki Haveli is a must see!

title: architectural building but not much to see
review: the haveli is a building with some unbelievable carvings. you cannot go indoors though. all the havelis look the same after a while

title: Great place to check on a typical haveli.
review: A must to get a feel of the Jaisalmer culture during the olden days.

title: Amazing carvings sad state
review: The haveli has amazing carvings ,it looks like lace in stone. The sad part is it looks lonely and on the verge of ruin.

title: The great hawali
review: The fantastic structure and art.

title: A rare Jewel in the desert
review: Seen to be believed. The workers who had carved such minute carvings were not only masters but also loved their work.

title: Beautiful n gorgeous!
review: Its one of the most beautiful things to see in Jisalmer.......The place is breathtakingly beautiful, the carvings, the glass work leaves you craving for more. The paintings in the walls, intricately painted ceilings.....the museum which takes you back in that era......the place literally is a traveller's paradise...because you get lost in its beauty and you dont want to come back from the place it takes you to! :)

title: beautiful, must visit, jaisalmer is different.
Good Museum
review: This is very Nice Haveli with good collection of antiquities used by olden times. The outside carvering of the fort is beautiful . Inside the haveli is collection of antiquites well placed with good details which will help the tourist.

title: all look the same
review: Jaisalmer itself is a beautiful place.If you walk around the old city you will see that after a point all the houses do look similar.So i was not very fascinated by the haveli.Basically if you hv seen one then seen all.

title: Patwaon-Ki-Haveli
review: Highly recommended, but there are two parts. One run by goverment (50RS admission), second private one (150 RS admission) - and I higly recommend that one. There are very well restored rooms where you can see real live of haveli owners.

title: Place with unbelievable designs made on yellow stones
review: Initially you can not believe that those designs are made out of stones. It looks as if made in wood. This place must be visited for a  complete experience of visit to Jaisalmer.

title: Grand Stone architecture.
review: Liked the architecture and cutting. Disliked- The place was not properly maintained.

title: A piece of Artwork
review: I loved Patwaon-Ki-Haveli! The house was in a well-preserved state and you could almost feel that there were people still living there. All the walls and ceilings were encrusted with jewels and decorated with shiny mirrorwork. The decorations were so intricate and exquisite in nature that the whole house looked like a piece of Artwork. There were lot of interesting items like antiques, furniture, kitchen utensils, etc. It was one of the best attractions in Jaisalmer.

title: A chance to see a furnished haveli
review: It was a bit hard to find this haveli, but the visit was worth it. We finally got to see a typical haveli inside furnished as it would have been a century ago.

title: Stunningly beautiful
review: Loved the intricate stone carving and the romantic interiors.  The explanations for each exhibit are good, so fend off the guides, and take your time looking round at your own speed.

title: Interesting old house
review: Beautiful building, intricate carving, lots of fascinating items from life in the past.

title: Medieval Splendour
review: A most beautiful and well maintained mansion..abt 400 years old,every inch is an explosion of stone carving.The courtyard in front with bencehs to sit on is very thoughtful,as one can gaze at the splendour in comfort Pleas buy a puppet from the young boy selling there,,he must be 14 and is a sole breadwinnet for 7 brothers and sisters.

title: good architecture
review: must visit. little spooky but gives you a glimpse of those ancient days. will end up clicking lot of photographs

title: beautiful
review: This haveli out of other 2. it was best and well maintenance and nice architectural. We liked all it's interior. There were few shops to buy traditional clothes and stone items. People were so friendly to tell you the direction where to go and it was amazing getting lost in streets and getting back to the same point from where you start. It was nice time i had in Jaisalmer.

title: Pretty and well preserved
review: Lovely place. Simply adored the lights at night. It is a real treat to visit.

title: The carving and the museum
review: Visit the Kothari's Patwon ki Haveli and see the opulent style in which they lived.Its far better than the palace

title: Great carving.
review: an ancient haveli with great carving. one of the best part to see in jaisalmare.

title: Great architecture but too many touts
review: On arrival at the gate we were directed to a ticket desk whilst being harrassed by "guides" offering their services. This distraction meant that we had bought our tickets and camera passes (total 170 Rs per person) before realising that you can actually walk past the desk and wander the streets free of charge.

title: Awesome!
review: Simply wow! The wood carvings, the work done, its picturesque... Just unforgettable! Do not miss this spot. There are many havelis in rajasthan esp in jaisalmer... But patwon is the best! Undoubtedly! A must see! All the sections are not open, there are just 2 of 5 that are made available for public visit.

title: Beautiful - Dont miss!
review: Just gorgeous. It is defitely worth a visit. There is also a museum inside, which is very informative. Drop by on your way to or out of the fortress.

title: Great Museum
review: Patwan Haveli is more than a house  --  it's a complete museum, fully furnished with antiquities, so you get a colorful picture of what haveli life was like.  This is a very special experience, one of my favorite on the trip.

title: Must to see in Jaisalmer
review: It has beautiful architecture and really fine hand work carved on walls and on ceilings. I liked this place very much. I am fond of photograhy and I was really very fortunate to have my tripod at that time with me and I took some very good photos of this beautifully hand carved indian building.

title: Spectacular mansion, two separate museums
review: This mansion of a wealthy merchant, Patwa, was (and still is) really a collection of five mansions, one for each of his sons. Today one of them is the Kothari Museum. This building was purchased by a businessman called Kothari and done up, presumably using original furniture and artefacts, to replicate the life of the Patwa family. Everything inside looks freshly done up so it doesn't have the "faded museum" feel (just as well, since every other museum in Jaisalmer is rather faded). The interiors are lush and fascinating and plenty of information is provided.

title: nice architecture
review: nice architecture, not far from jaisal fort. you can visit museum and have a nice feel of old architecture..

title: Lovely architecture
review: The intricate architecture is worth seeing, it's beautiful.

title: Worth a visit
review: This is a very quaint but beautiful haveli ..go for it.

title: Magnificent
review: Great architectural work with lovely carving . Beautiful and worth admiring.

title: Nice Carving..
review: Nice and best place to visit within 3 haveli. The Patwo ki haveli were best to see...and worth to pay...

title: nice Haveli
review: Look & very nice haveli.. but now is kept by rajasthan govt

title: Neighbour's envy,owner's pride
review: What a gorgeous haveli!
