The brocade merchants of Jaisalmer built this palace for themselves,before Indira Gandhi purchased it for the Govt.,some 40-45 years ago.The intricate carvings,the pure gold paint on it's walls and ceilings are breathtaking.Enjoy photography and architecture to the core here.The best haveli in Jaisalmer-a must must visit.

title: The inside is excellent too!
review: The outside stonework is intricate & lace-like and the retored work inside is equally impressive reflecting tradtional Rajasthani crafts. A set path guides you through the entire haveli so you really don't need a guide. You will see a lot of paintings & mirror works. Pay the fee for camera / video usage as the guards are hot on checking!

title: A must visit
review: A well maintained Haveli, with a lot of items displayed. The tour gives us a glimpse of the royal life led by the owners. The items are also well marked. However, audio guide system can be thought of to ensure complete history is told to the visitor.

title: Typical Rajasthani architecture
review: These are five similar residences, build for five brothers. One of them has been converted into a museum. The rooms have been restored in their original conditions and give an idea of the lifestyles of the rich and famous residents of Jaisalmer. The outside walls are exqusitely carved and quite impressive

title: LAVISH DECORATION
review: Although there are a number of havelis to see, this one is very well restored and furnished to give an idea of how it would have looked originally.

title: Deceiving exterior
review: Vehicles are allowed only upto a certain point, so you are forced to make your way througgh some very dingy and filthy lanes to get to the haveli.

title: Architectural heritage
review: Awesome architecture. Now a govt property. Must watch for art enthusiasts. Great shopping around the place. Good place to click photographs. the place to get there is bit clumsy but the haveli has a good appeal to it for its archaic beauty

title: Touristy thing to do
review: If you want to see a haveli go there but its ike a palace or a fort where things are up for display bit not quiet how they would otherwise be placed ..designs on the walls and intricate carvings are spellbinding. Can take great pics if a you have a knack of it

title: Stay outside
review: Don’t visit inside. As many places in India, you’ll pay an expensive ticket to discover few things in bad shape. Instead, stay outside and enjoy the architecture!

title: Nice old Haveli
review: Nice old Havelis of Tradesman having old things that were used that time , an ok place to go looks really nice from outside .

title: Got the first movers advantage for me, otherwise average
review: Tourist spots are forcibly made out of places where there is a scarcity of tourist spots. Patwon ki haveli is one such place. It is a small haveli which feels exciting if this is the first place you visit in the city. But if you have been to the fort first, it will lose its flavour. 30 - 40 min spot.

title: Must visit!!
review: One should not miss Patwon ki haveli while he is in Jaisalmer.

title: intricately carved and well preserved building housing a family museum
review: most beautiful haweli of 200 years old vintage, maimtained in excellent shape and housing beautiful collection of furniture, clothings, household articles , from a private collection of generations who lived there.

title: Old chains of havelis
review: 2 km from jaisalmer fort a chain of chain of havelis founded. Architecture is vary good you can feel glory of Rajasthan.

title: Havelis
review: It is nicely constructed. One of few Havelis which are on the tourist map once you open the pages for Jaisalmer must visit places. The architecture is good. Go with some time in hand if you want to actually study the construction.

title: Intricate facade , worth a visit
review: You have to pay around ₹100 pp and it entitles you to a guide (if you are in a group). It's a heritage building which was built by traders about a hundred + years ago. You will find antique items inside and a shop that's run by the original descendants. However, the real beauty is on the outside !

title: I’ve never seen this kind of carving!!
review: I was lost in Hawelis after seeing their carving. I went literally speechless after seeing the workmanship of the Labours or persons who made this masterpiece of art after spending this much time and money in era when there were no Automations or anything. It was totally done with Hardwork and made my hands. Must visit place in Jaisalmer!!

I went literally speechless after seeing the workmanship of the Labours or persons who made this masterpiece of art after spending this much time and money in era when there were no Automations or anything. It was totally done with Hardwork and made my hands. Must visit place in Jaisalmer!!

title: Nice old Haveli
review: Nice old Havelis of Tradesman having old things that were used that time , an ok place to go looks really nice from outside .

title: Stay outside
review: Don’t visit inside. As many places in India, you’ll pay an expensive ticket to discover few things in bad shape. Instead, stay outside and enjoy the architecture!

title: intricately carved and well preserved building housing a family museum
review: most beautiful haweli of 200 years old vintage, maimtained in excellent shape and housing beautiful collection of furniture, clothings, household articles , from a private collection of generations who lived there.

title: Got the first movers advantage for me, otherwise average
review: Tourist spots are forcibly made out of places where there is a scarcity of tourist spots. Patwon ki haveli is one such place. It is a small haveli which feels exciting if this is the first place you visit in the city. But if you have been to the fort first, it will lose its flavour. 30 - 40 min spot.

title: Old chains of havelis
review: 2 km from jaisalmer fort a chain of chain of havelis founded. Architecture is vary good you can feel glory of Rajasthan.

title: Must visit!!
review: One should not miss Patwon ki haveli while he is in Jaisalmer.

title: Havelis
review: It is nicely constructed. One of few Havelis which are on the tourist map once you open the pages for Jaisalmer must visit places. The architecture is good. Go with some time in hand if you want to actually study the construction.

title: Intricate facade , worth a visit
review: You have to pay around ₹100 pp and it entitles you to a guide (if you are in a group). It's a heritage building which was built by traders about a hundred + years ago. You will find antique items inside and a shop that's run by the original descendants. However, the real beauty is on the outside !

title: Touristy thing to do
review: If you want to see a haveli go there but its ike a palace or a fort where things are up for display bit not quiet how they would otherwise be placed ..designs on the walls and intricate carvings are spellbinding. Can take great pics if a you have a knack of it
